Martiza is able to get her housework done while she runs her salon and is able to spend pleasant evenings with her family. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevo Sol ( $375), which she will pay back in four months, she will purchase hair coloring, permanent solution, hair crème, combs, clippers, and rollers. Martiza tells us that the loans she has received are a great help to her and give her the opportunity to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Coraje, ubicado en el Jr. Amazonas 998, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es policía. Maritza con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un salón de belleza. En la actualidad su salón de belleza cuenta con mucha clientela por el buen trato y amabilidad que ofrece, las tareas domesticas las comparte con su negocio, y por las noches comparte momentos agradables con su familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará tintes, líquido ondulador, cremas para cabello, peines, maquina para cortar pelo, bigudíes. Maritza manifiesta que los préstamos recibidos son un gran apoyo para ella y le da la oportunidad de seguir adelante

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase various products to use in her business

loans.name: Fomunyoh

texts.en:
Born on the 6th of May, 1970, Fomunyoh M. is married and a mother of four children, all below the age of fifteen. She is also the mother to two adopted children. Due to the death of her only sister who was financially supporting her, things became very miserable for M.. Her husband is not hard working and did not provide for M. and her children. All these factors, together with her low level of education, made her very confused in life. Seeing her plight, several GHAPE members advised her to join the program. She became a member of GHAPE in 2004 and was trained in business and marketing. She took her first loan ($40) in the same year. Since then, she has successfully managed and repaid three loans amounting to $280.
	Requests a loan to invest it in buying cocoa and coffee, and the rearing of pigs and goats. She knows her business is going to be successful because she has customers who come to buy her goods, and take them to the cities. In addition, she has several years of experience in the business.
She has 18 months to pay the loan. The first installment shall be repaid four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy cocoa and coffee and to rear pigs and goats.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Mr. Nelson Ramón M. Cuenca is from Jejui in the district of Choré. He is 27 years old and married to Mrs. Pelagia M. de Irala, who is 28 years of age. They have 2 children and their own home.

In his neighborhood, he operates a well-stocked clothing business, which makes customers giver preference to his shop. His wife helps him run the business, which has been operating now for 2 years. Aside from his clothing shop, he also owns a property in which he raises cattle for both milk and meat sales.

The customer would like to keep expanding his business and increase his merchandise, as well as start selling home products, thus diversifying his selection. Some of the items he will purchase with the loan are t-shirts, pants, winter clothing, buttons, zippers, tablecloths, cups, jugs, and utensils, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Nelson Ramón M. Cuenca es de Jejui distrito de Choré, tiene 27 años de edad, casado con la señora Pelagia M. de Irala de 28 años de edad, tienen casa propia, y 2 hijos.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropas en general en su barrio, cuenta con buen stock de mercaderías en su negocio lo que hace que sus clientes tengan preferencia de compra en su local. Su señora la ayuda con la atención del negocio que ya tiene 2 años de funcionamiento. Además de su ropería también tiene una propiedad en donde tiene animales vacunos que cría para la venta de leche y carne.

El cliente quiere creciendo y aumentar el stock de mercaderías de su ropería, y también la venta de otros artículos varios para el hogar, así el diversificará las mercaderías que ofrece en su negocio. Algunas de las cosas que comprará son remeras, pantalones, ropa de invierno, mercaderías para mercería como botones, cierres, manteles, vasos, jarras, utensilios entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and home products

loans.name: Flora's Ikunda Group

texts.en:
Flora S. is 30 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children ages 10 and 6. She owns a small general store which she started in 1996. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Flora now hopes for a loan of $1525 to buy more rice commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses dealing with tailoring, and banana sales.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Srey Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people in Toek Khlaing Village in Kandal Province make up the Village Bank LoA., led by Village Bank President Mrs. Kim S. M., who was selected by the members. Mrs. M.’s living conditions are poor because her household makes only a small income. She is a vegetable farmer and cow breeder with three cows. Her family has only one bike for travelling to the field and local market. Her husband, Mr. Keo SoC., is a fishermA. who needs more fish nets to improve his business, Mrs. M. is requesting a loA. to buy additional nets  to increase household income.  

Mrs. S. M. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory earning $38 per month while the remaining three are attending school. 

This is a village bank loA. consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loA. term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fish nets for her husband's business

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir K. is a 48 year old trader. He is married and has 3 children, and is proud to be a grandfather of one grandchild. Tahir is an entrepreneur, and he sells foodstuffs like confectioneries, sugar, tea, and eggs. He has been in this business for 15 years. His wife is also involved in the business and helps Tahir in the market. The business is successful and generates sufficient income to support their large family. He is requesting a loan to increase his capital for purchasing foodstuffs, and to improve the condition of his shop.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and improve the condition of his shop.

loans.name: Petrona Del Socorro

texts.es: Su principal actividad  es una pulpería, donde ofrece variedad de productos de necesidad diaria. Con financiamientos  de Adim ofrece a sus clientes mercadería en general y cosméticos que antes no vendía, logrando así satisfacer necesidades y gustos que demanda la población. Tiene 15 años de experiencia en la actividad.  Su mayor deseo es contar siempre con financiamientos para inyectarle a su negocio. Y hacer un local más grande con mejor presentación. Vive con su hija quien  le apoya   con la atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
Petrona del Socorro has a small general store where she offers a variety of items for everyday use. With the financial help she's received, she has been able to offer her customers general merchandise as well as cosmetics which she wasn't able to sell before, therefore better meeting the demands of her customers. She has 15 years of experience running her business. Her hope is to be able to continue with these loans so that she can continue to invest in growing her business, one day having a much larger shop. She lives with her daughter, who helps her with the customers in the shop.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small general store and continue to grow the business

loans.name: Rukhsana M.asif Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a wife of M. Ali. They reside in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 6 years.

Rukhsana baji is a very hardworking lady. She helped her husband in the building of their new house. She earned money by sewing clothes day and night. Rukhsana baji’s husband is a driver. He drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has been doing so for 5 years. Rukhsana baji is a mother of two sons. Her elder son is 6 years old and her younger son is 4 years old.

She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw. The auto-rickshaw is creating many problems for the family and so must be repaired.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zakia baji wants a loan to buy edible items such as chips and biscuits wholesale to resell retail. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy sugarcane to make into and sell as syrup. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Vinodio Julião Dos Santos

texts.pt:
Vinodio Julião dos santos C. é natural de Boane, província de maputo e tem 21 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de um filho com dois anos, ainda vive com os pais.

Vinodio é estudante da 12ªclasse,  desde 2007 faz negocio de compra e venda de recargas de credito Mcel qual vende no estabelecimento da mãe, isto é, gere o estabelecimento em sociedade com a mãe.

Vinodio pretende com este empréstimo abrir seu próprio estabelecimento comercial, onde vai vender mais produtos dentre as cervejas. Neste momento tem tido ajuda de uma empregada e sua mãe. Onde tem de rendimento mensal liquido 3000,00mt e este constitui o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no kiva.

Vinodio pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo afim de começar a juntar material de construção para sua casa.
texts.en:
Vinodio Julião dos Santos C. is a native of Boane, Maputo Province, and is 21 years old, married and father of a two-year-old son who still lives with his parents. Vinodio is a student in the 12th grade. Since 2007, he has bought and sold Mcel phone credits which he sells in his mother's store. That is, he runs the store in partnership with his mother. Vinodio plans to open his own store with this loan, where he will sell more products, including beer. At this time, he has had help from an employee of his mother's. He has monthly net revenue of 3000 meticais, and this is his third loan from Hluvuku and first on Kiva. Vinodio plans to repay early so that he can request another loan in order to start to assemble construction material for his house.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret O. is 46 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. The profits from this business are used to support her family. She hopes to stock her shop with more goods. She is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva leaders for their financial support

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provision and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 23 years old and lives in Soyapango, a city outside of the capital of San Salvador, El Salvador. He buys and sells corn to distribute in the communities in Soyapango. Together with beans and rice, corn is the most important food in the diet of Salvadorans.

With this loan from Kiva, Pablo hopes to increase his corn sales and produce more tamales in his home. Tamales are especially profitable for him because the insides of this traditional Latin American food consist primarily of corn! Although this is not his first micro-credit (Pablo has had 3 in the past), he hopes that the increase in his business will help him repair his broken-down car.

loans.use: Buy more corn to increase his sales

loans.name: Huma M. Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Huma baji, 37,is a married lady and a citizen of a historic place called Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Huma baji passed her 10th standard. She couldn’t study further because her parents married her off to a man whose name is M. N., a painter by profession. This is not his regular source of income because he can only get income when people call him to paint their houses.

Huma baji shares the financial burden of her husband by doing decorative embroidery. She prepares embroidered dresses, taking the orders from her relatives and neighbors. Her husband is very happy with her caring behavior. Huma baji successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more paint for her husband’s painting business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rani baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Rehana Kosar baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell. Josphen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nazia baji wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments on her auto-rickshaw. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint for her husband's business

loans.name: Delgermaa`

texts.en:
Delgermaa B. is a micro-entrepreneur who lives with her mother in Hentiy, which is one of Mongolia's southern provinces and the homeland of Chinggis Khan, the most celebrated Mongolian of all time. In 2005, together with her mother, she began to run a bread-sales business. Her mother bakes bread at home and Delgermaa sells it at her small booth in the local market.

To expand this tiny business, in 2007 Delgermaa took a loan with XacBank, Kiva's partner microfinance institution in Mongolia. With the help of the loan, she began to sell many small items, such as instant noodle soup, biscuits and cookies, at her booth. With her profit she bought a bigger oven, allowing her mother to bake more bread. The mother-daughter team now distributes some of the bread to local grocery stores. All their bread sells out every day, as the bread is very delicious. Delgermaa is locally respected for her business and for her friendly, hard-working personality.

With this loan, Delgermaa will invest in her business and buy flour. She says, in Mongolian, "I'm planning to have my own bakery in near future."

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice A. is forty-eight years old and married with five children. She sells secondhand clothes and bags.  She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more clothes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon A. is 50 years old and married with five children. Solomon has a cool room where he sells ice and fish. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more fish to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
This is Mariama Siray M., Sento K., Mamusu S., Julius T. and Kadiatu T.. They named their group God is Great. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT.  The last loan they received was for Le 800,000 each. Previous loans have made meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. Nevertheless, they still need additional loans to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. They are therefore requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000 each.

Mariama Siray M. (second from right) is the leader of this group. Mariama was born in Sanda Magbolontho, one of a group of small villages about thirty miles from Makeni City.  She is married with five children. One of her children is in secondary school, two are in primary school, and two are still not of school-going age.  Mariama Siray M. sells ready-to-wear clothes. She has been in this business for three years now.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah E., 41, married and the mother of two adult-aged children, is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental where she owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store. The main income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as soap, toothpaste, shampoo etc. to the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Leah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having recently repaid a previous loan of 10728.34 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 11500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Leah’s tenth from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to support her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Тутинисо женшина- 44 лет. Замужем имеет 4-х детей.Она и её муж торговали небольшим ассортиментом запасным запчастей и сантехникой. Теперь они торгуют большим ассортиментом, в этот ассортимент входят : хна, расчески, иглы и различны кремы. Её муж ездит за товаром. Он привозит товар из Уратюбе. В зависимости от продажи муж  ездит за товаром.Тутинисо хочет увеличить свою прибыль для семейного положения: выдать дочь замуж, сделать ремонт.
texts.en:
Tutiniso is a 44 year old woman. She is married and has four children. Together with her husband they used to sell a small assortment of spare parts and plumbing parts. Right now they have a larger assortment which includes henna, hair brushes, needles and lotions. Her husband travels for the merchandise which he brings from Uratube. He travels depending on the sales. Tutiniso wants to increase her profit for their family's livelihood, she wants to make a wedding for her daughter and make renovation at home.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (113060401) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn.  She is married and has three  school-aged children.  To make a living, V. owns & operates a business selling agricultural equipment.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling plant seedlings & young crops to local farmers.  V. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 8000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1996, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  V. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell.  The loan will be the 13th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima is the daughter of M. N..  She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and she is married with 4 children.  She works as a vaccinator for a children's health institute.  She wants to take a loan of 50000 Afghani and she is very happy about this lending process so she can secure a loan that she will use to help solve some of her problems.

loans.use: For buying materials.

loans.name: Atyrkul's Group

texts.en:
Atyrkul is thirty-eight years old. Being a mother to three sons, she lives the humble life of a shepherd’s wife. Twenty years ago, her husband inherited some cattle from his parents and since then, he has been raising cattle and working as a shepherd.

Atyrkul, being a housewife, takes care of the household. She also actively helps her husband look after their cattle. Her daily routine begins with milking cows in the morning, then selling the milk to her neighbors. Besides cows, they keep some other livestock, too. So, Atyrkul has always a lot to do around the house.

Having lived all her life in a rural area, she decided to send her eldest son to college, to live in the city. Two other sons live at home and help their parents. By selling some of their livestock, they managed to buy a house, though Atyrkul’s monthly income from selling milk is just US$ 65.

Now, Atyrkul is desperate to buy another cow. One more cow means more milk for sale, consequently more daily income to save for their second son’s education. For villagers every liter of milk is valuable, since it brings cash, which is a rare thing in a village area.

Here are Atyrkul’s partners: Amanbu, Altyn and Nazira. Amanbu is fifty. With her husband she keeps livestock: one cow and twenty sheep. Her husband is an electrician, but Amanbu, being a housewife, meets her daily needs by selling milk. Now, Amanbu wants to get a loan to buy a calf and with the rest of the loan she would purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

Altyn is twenty-five. She is married and has three children. To help her husband, who is a welder, she sells foodstuffs and earns US$ 130. She needs a loan to include more vegetables, fruit, and salads in her assortment.

Nazira is twenty-three. She is not married yet. However, for five years already she has lived independently in terms of finances, as she has been selling newspapers, magazines and some detergents. Nazira needs a loan to open a small shop to sell detergents out of.

====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to sell milk

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She sells fairly-used clothes and has been in the business since 1998.  She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more fairly-used clothes to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony N. is a farmer from Banga, South Cotabato. He has two children with his wife, Veronica N.. His family manages a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) rice field.

Anthony is grateful for the financial services he obtained when he became a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). He said that ever since CEVI became his business partner, he hasn’t experienced many problems and he has been able to save because of the low interest rate.

Anthony applied for a loan of Php 12,000 that he will use to finance his farm. The loan will surely help Anthony and his family in improving their farm.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. has been doing tailoring in Naivasha town for the last seven years. His services include tailor-making clothes for individuals and repairing torn clothes. He is 28 years old and not married.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy more materials to make clothes in order to meet the demands of his customers. His hope is to grow his business, employ people, and make clothes in wholesale.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make clothes

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is 40 years old and married with 3 children. He is an electrician and he also sells electrical materials. He specializes in the repair of television sets. He is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita P. owns a small parcel of farmland in their village. She is 48 years old and has been married for nearly 30 years now. All the produce coming from her farm has immensely benefited her family. Because of her farm, she has been able to adequately provide her family with food and other needs.

She desires to apply for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She would like to borrow a bigger amount of money, Php 24,000, to support her business. This loan will help buy all the farming necessities that will help contribute to achieving an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 35 years old and divorced with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader. Patience is in the palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies it to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. 

Patience has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
La socia CEFERINA pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER”. 

La socia, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, Ella vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comidas, gaseosas y cervezas. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora. La socia requiere el préstamo para la educación, la alimentación y la mensualidad del colegio de sus hijos y aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos. Con este crédito de 1,300 nuevos soles comprará más víveres como arroz, aceite, fideos y verduras para preparar más platos de comida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ceferina is a member of the Communal Bank “Amanecer” (Dawn). She is 37 years old, married, and lives in the imperial city of Cusco. Ceferina divides her time between her household activities and selling prepared meals, sodas, and beer. She has been in business for a number of years and has done very well thanks to all of her hard work.

Ceferina is a hardworking and enterprising mother. She is requesting a loan to help pay the tuition, food, and monthly school fees for her children. In addition, she wants to increase her business capital so that she can generate better earnings. With this loan of 1300 soles, she will buy food items such as rice, oil, noodles, and vegetables for preparing more dishes.

Ceferina is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to complete her payments on the respective due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing dishes

loans.name: Abdoul

texts.en:
Abdoul is 38 years, married, and has 5 children aged between 5 and 12 years old.  He lives in Gasabo, not far from the center of Kigali.  Abdoul has been a proven entrepreneur selling a variety of goods in his retail general store located in his area of residence.  He employs two people from his community and the business working hours are from 6 AM to 9 PM every day except Sunday.

Abdoul’s general store is currently facing an increased demand of some products.  Therefore, he is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so as to expand his business through purchasing more products that are in high demand.  The products to be purchased include cosmetic goods, toilet soaps, toothpastes, cooking oil, and many others.  

Abdoul expects to satisfy the growing number of customers who demand his products a lot as well as earning more profits than before.  Abdoul will also increase his savings for future financial stability and continue taking good care of his wife and children.

loans.use: to increase store inventory

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Como todo padre responsable, el señor Francisco Javier C. se ha dedicado a trabajar para mantener su humilde hogar compuesto por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en edad escolar por lo que les debe de brindar las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.
En vistas a que su vivienda ha estado en malas condiciones, el señor Francisco ha iniciado a reconstruir su vivienda y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así dar paso al mejoramiento de su vivienda. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará en gran parte su vivienda y por ende le brindará mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Like all responsible fathers, Mr. Francisco Javier C. has worked hard to maintain his modest home, comprised of his wife and their four children. Two of the four children are of school-age, and therefore Francisco must provide them with the necessary conditions for their successful studies. Seeing as his home has been in bad shape, Francisco has begun working to improve his home. He therefore came to Ceprodel to request a loan in order to purchase construction materials and continue working on his home. He hopes that his loan request will be granted, thereby allowing him to complete his renovations and give his children a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Felipe Rafael

texts.es: Felipe Rafael tiene 58 años, a pesar de su edad es un hombre que ha trabajado mucho y que disfruta de su actividad como es brindar el servicio de sastrería. El inicio trabajando como aprendiz en otro taller, pero con el tiempo este medio de vida le fue gustando hasta que logro comprar su máquina de coser y con el paso del tiempo compro las herramientas necesarias, anteriormente él decide establecerse en su vivienda pero no tenía suficiente clientes pero esto no lo deprimió pues lo ayudo a salir adelante y con la ayuda de los financiamientos lo obtiene. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de telas, tijeras, hilos, bordados, botones por lo que se acerca la temporada escolar. Su deseo es agrandar un poco mas su local y ofrecer empleo.
texts.en:
Felipe Rafael is 58 years old. In spite of his age he is a man who has worked hard and who enjoys his work as a tailor. He started working as an apprentice in another workshop and he grew to like the trade, so he managed to buy his own sewing machine and gradually acquire other necessary tools. He decided to establish his business from his home, but he did not have enough customers. But this did not get him down, because having his own business helped him to get ahead and with the support of these loans he will achieve success. Currently he requests financing for working capital so that he can buy fabric, scissors, thread, embroidery and buttons because we are approaching the school season. His wish is to expand his premises a little more and offer employment.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Hugo (30) y sus dos pequeños hijos; José (7) y Soledad (5).
Cada día se despierta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos y mandarlos al colegio, luego empieza una larga caminata para ofrecer los productos de belleza que vende desde hace 3 años. Aunque es cansado terminar las labores del hogar y después trabajar, le agrada mucho porque puede generarse sus propias ganancias y esto la hace sentirse realizada, ya que no depende tanto de su esposo. Por otro lado, considera que su capacidad de persuasión para recomendar que tipo de maquillaje le queda a cada persona es lo que logra que pueda vender su mercadería no solo a clientes conocidas, si no también a desconocidas que terminan confiando en su buen gusto.
Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora tiene planeado para el futuro instalar una tienda en su casa donde ofrezca sus productos con mayor comodidad, y también quiere llegar a tener una tienda de ropa.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con los miembros de su grupo. Edita tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, especialmente en productos que estén en promoción para tenerlos en stock y venderlos a mayor precio posteriormente.
texts.en:
Edita, 37, lives in her own home with her husband, Hugo (30), and their two small children, José (7), and Soledad (5). Everyday Edita wakes up very early to care for her children and to get them ready for school. Next, she begins the long trek to sell beauty products which she has been selling for the past three years. Although she is tired from doing housework and then going to work, she appreciates it a lot because she can earn her own money and this makes her feel accomplished because she doesn't have to depend so much on her husband.

In addition, she believes that her power of persuasion to recommend what type of makeup fits each person is what allows her to sell her merchandise not only to clients that she knows, but also to strangers, who can rely on her good taste. She is also an enterprising woman who has plans in the future to move her store to her home where she can sell her products in greater comfort and open up a clothing store, as well.

This is Edita's first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she promises to make all of her payments because she does not want to make a bad impression with the other members of the group. She plans to invest the money she is requesting in buying a greater quantity of merchandise, especially her special order products, so that she can have them in stock and sell them for higher prices later on.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase stock of special order merchandise

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en:
Faasaveve T. is 58 and married with 4 children (ages 12 - 29).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faasaveve has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faasaveve needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at: http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2007, Faasaveve joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faasaveve's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faasaveve T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Foaad

texts.en: Foaad is a 40-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their six children. Foaad has owned a grocery store since 1998. He sells canned food, beverages, candies, pasta, rice, oil, chewing gum, cakes and lots more. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as passers-by. Foaad is a very welcoming person and each time he receives a client, he likes taking time and chatting with him. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase new merchandise for his store so that he can expand his stock. This is the first time that Foaad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Foaad decided to go into his business because he wanted to provide the best for his family. His store is well located and allows him to improve his family’s financiA. situation, but more importantly he likes trading and likes his work. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel C. is a responsible married man living with his wife and two children. He has a junior high education.  Samuel sells soft drinks and bread at Elmina. He has been in this business for some time now. His wife is a trader.  Samuel uses the money he gets from his sales to take care of the family.  Samuel will add the loan to his original capital to purchase more soft drinks to resell. With the new profits from his extended business, Samuel plans to save to build a house on inherited family land.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Mirian Fatima

texts.es:
La señora Mirian Fátima forma  parte del Banco Comunal Familiar en la localidad de Colorado en la provincia de Manabí en la región costera del Ecuador,  ella tiene  30 años  y es oriunda de Santa Ana en la misma provincia, se fue a vivir a Colorado desde hace 5 años, está casada hace 13 años, ella junto al esposo trabajan en la  compra  y venta de chanchos para lo cual  en su  propiedad tienen un espacio  para criarlos hasta venderlos,  llevan tres años en ésta actividad, nos comenta que antes de empezar en  este negocio ella  trabajaba en una fábrica de tagua hasta que un día decidió junto al esposo tener su propio negocio motivados por  algunos amigos.

Para poder trabajar el esposo compra  los chanchos pequeños para hacer la cría, lo grandes son para pesar por libra y vender en su casa, cada semana se sacan a vender los que ya están grandes  y cada tres meses los de cría.  El crédito solicitado es  para comprar más crías y alimento para su crianza y  seguir incrementando su negocio para de esta manera pagar sus créditos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Señora Mirian Fátima is a member of the Banco Comunal Familiar (Family Communal Bank) in the town of Colorado in Manabí province in Ecuador’s coastal region. She is 30 years old and is originally from Santa Ana in the same province. She went to live in Colorado 5 years ago. She has been married 13 years.

Her and her husband’s business is buying and selling pigs. They have space on their property for raising them until they are ready for sale. They have been in this business for three years and told us that before beginning it they worked in a factory making products from tagua (a type of palm nut). They did this until one day she and her husband decided, with the encouragement of some friends, to have their own business.

In order to start the business her husband purchased some piglets so that he could raise them. The large pigs are weighed and sold at their house. Each week they select mature pigs to sell. It takes three months to raise a pig.

The loan they are applying for is for the purchase of more piglets and the feed required to raise them. They want to continue increasing their business and, in this way, pay their loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of piglets and feed required to raise them.

loans.name: Ranjani

texts.en:
Ranjani is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has one son and one daughter. Her husband is a government employee. Now he is retired from the job; they are very close.  

Ranjani manages a sewing business.  Twenty years ago she started this business.  She cooperates well with others and is very enthusiastic. She has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is 49 years old and married with 3 children, aged between 3 to 15 years old. Two of the children are currently attending school. Zakayo is a mixed farmer from Western Kenya in Kitale town. He has been farming for 15 years and has been able to employ 3 workers to help him with the farm work. His main produce is maize, vegetables, and milk which he sells on the local market. Zakayo owns some rental houses in Kitale and also earns income from bricks that he sells to the locals.

Zakayo has successfully completed two loans from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.30,000 and KES.45,000. He has requested this third loan from Juhudi for KES.46,800 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help him educate his children by paying their school fees and buying them books. In five years' time, Zakayo hopes to be the main supplier of milk to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries in Kitale town. He says that this loan will enable him to expand his dairy farming and take better care of his family as well.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Abilio Jose Das Neves

texts.pt:
Abílio José Das Neves R., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Fronteira com Suazilândia, a Oeste da Província do Maputo, tem 32 anos de idade vive maritalmente, é pai de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 8 anos, o mais velho é que vai a escola. Fez a 7ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições, vive na casa própria não responsabiliza se por ninguem. 


Abílio nunca saiu do Distrito, vive maritalmente com sua esposa. E dono de uma oficina mecânica em sua casa, e conta com ajuda de dois empregados que auferem 2.000.00mt mensal por pessoa. Para aumentar a renda familiar com o fundo coletado ele consegue abrir um estabelecimento comercial onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade nomeadamente (feijão, arroz, amendoim, bolachas, farinhas), e alguns refrigerantes trabalhando das 7h as 20h e tendo de lucro 5.000.00mt a 6.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas da casa e na sua obra. Aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo para aumentar os produtos já existentes e satisfazer a necessidades dos clientes no período da peregrinação (cerimonia religiosa que se tem feito anualmente).


Este é o segundo empréstimo de Abílio na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 12.000.00mt foi usado para comprar insumos agrícolas para sua machamba, estes 15.000.00mt serão usados para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos e satisfazer a necessidade dos peregrinos. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para dar inicio da construção da sua capoeira.
texts.en:
Abílio José Das Neves R. was born in Namaacha District, near the Swaziland border, in western Maputo Province. He is 32 years old, is married, and has two children who are 3 and 8 years old. The eldest goes to school. Abílio finished seventh grade but did not continue because of financial problems. He lives in his own house and does not support anyone else. Abílio has never left this District and lives with his wife. He owns a mechanic's shop which is in his house, and he relies on the help of two employees who each receive 2,000 meticais per month. To increase his family's income, he used his savings to open a shop where he sells basic items, namely beans, rice, peanuts, crackers, flour and some refrigerated products. He works from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm and makes a profit of 5,000 to 6,000 meticais, which he uses for household expenses and for work. He approached Hluvuku and Kiva to ask for a loan to add to the products he now carries and meet his customers' needs during the time of pilgrimage (a religious ceremony that takes place annually). This is Abílio's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan of 12,000 meticais was used to buy agricultural supplies for his machamba (a large garden or small field). These 15,000 meticais will be used to increase his inventory and meet the needs of the pilgrims. He is confident that he will pay off the loan ahead of schedule and ask for another to begin building a chicken coop.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, flour, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Mrs. Hay S. is an older woman and the mother of five children. Two are now married and already have their own homes, while the remaining three are single. She has a financial earner in her husband who has the skill of building stone houses. He currently works in a small firm located in Kompong Tom Province.

Hay S. built a large pig stall where she always raises a lot of hogs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this field since she was single so she has a lot of experience. Because her pig-raising trade is the main source of family income, she has obtained a loan to use as capital to buy pig feed and many piglets for her pigpen. With any remaining money from the loan, she will grow crops for additional income.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and many piglets for her stall

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa L., 50 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has nine children. Her oldest child is now 31. Some of her children still go to school. Rosa owns & operates an agicultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 30 years. Like other mothers, she hopes all her children finish college and have a bright future.

Rosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers and to pay the laborers who helped prepare her farm. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers, and to pay farm laborers

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Mrs. Nan C. is a villager in Melong Khang Cheung village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1974. She is a meat and beef seller at her local market. She earns some money to help support her family while her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Ouch, is a farmer who owns a four-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice to be able earn some money to support his family. Aside from farming he is also a motorbike taxi driver. Now her husband’s field has some problems because it has infertile soil and it is has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Nan C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are studying in the local public school, while the youngest one is five-years-old. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen L., 22, is from the village of Kabayan, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. She is married with one infant-aged child. To make a living, Aireen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Aireen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aireen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aireen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Aireen is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Aireen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married to an accountant with whom she has two children. Both her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.  She owns a stall at her home in Nalukolongo selling bananas. She buys bunches of bananas from delivery vans which get them from villages. 

Edith wants to use this loan of 2,000,000/= to buy more bunches of bananas. She has been in this banana business for over ten years. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale and works seven days a week. Her business challenges include thieves and the rainy season. She is aspiring of  going directly to farmers and hopes to start selling wholesale only.

Edith decided to work with MCDT because of low interest charged.    She resides in and owns a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes food and school  fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle D. R. is 29 years old, married and supports her family by operating three business ventures: furniture making, food vending and a piggery. She lives in Prk. 2, Brgy. Tumarbong, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her furniture making, food vending and piggery businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,200. 

Michelle is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase new equipment. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Michelle aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor EMILIO G. F.  tiene 45 años, vive en la Zona del Plan 3000 calle 7 Av. principal. Tiene dos hijos dependientes de el, el tiene un taller de cerrajería en su mismo domicilio. 

Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a esta profesión pero como es un trabajador independiente no tiene seguro contra accidentes y infortunadamente tuvo un accidente laboral y por este motivo necesita el préstamo para poder pagar los gastos curativos de su empleado. Por lo que el cliente requiere del dinero para esta emergencia. 

El Sr. Emilio es un cliente antiguo del CIDRE, es muy buen cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. Emilio G. F. is 45 years old and lives in the Plan 3000 zone, 7th Street, Main Avenue. He has two children who are dependent on him and he runs a locksmith shop from his home. He has been dedicated to this profession for 20 years, but since he is an independent worker, he does not have accident insurance. Unfortunately, there was a work-related accident and he needs this loan to pay for his employee's medical expenses. He needs to borrow money for this emergency. Mr. Emilio is an old client of CIDRE, and he is a very good client.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for his employee

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine G. is married with three children. She has been trading in women’s and men’s clothing and shoes since 1996. Lusine rents a trading booth at one of the city markets. While her husband helps her run the family business, she travels to the neighboring countryside to purchase stock.

This business is the only source of income for Lusine’s family. The couple has been investing in their children’s education to insure their future prosperity.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Yaiko Porave Rekavo (In Search Of A Better Life) Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Jaiko Porave Rekavo (En busca de una vida mejor) se conformó en fecha 24 de setiembre del 2.010, se encuentran en el 1º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
La Sr. Isidora es una de las integrantes y quien trabajo mucho para la conformación del comité, es una de las señoras más activas y es la presidenta del grupo.
Ella se dedica  a la venta de minicarga para celulares para desde su casa, esta actividad consiste en que personas que utilizar varias líneas de telefonía celular prepagos compran saldo para sus líneas y ella provee.
Según, ella esta actividad le beneficia mucho y le conviene seguir con ella ya que le ayudará  con el ingreso de la familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de saldo para su teléfono ya que quiere ampliar el monto que tiene disponible para sus clientes.
Según la Sra. Isidora las actividades que realizan entre las compañeras son muy útiles para el desarrollo personal de cada una.
texts.en:
This group of women has named themselves Jaiko Porave Rekavo (meaning In search of a better life). It was created on September 24, 2010 and they are on their first loan cycle, working together as a group in the program. 

Aside from their individual businesses they also work together to raise funds to have a cache within the group. They help each other to reach their goals, especially when working to support their families.

Isidora is a member of the group and she worked very hard in the formation of the group. She is one of the most active members and she is also the leader of the group. She sells prepaid cell phone card from her home. Her business sis based on the fact that people can use various brands of prepaid phone cards and she is able to provide these to her customers. She states that her business is of great benefit to her because she is able to have a source of income for her family.  She requests a loan to purchase phone cards to have a larger inventory available for her clients. 

According to Isidora her colleagues all have businesses that are instrumental in their personal development.

loans.use: To purchase prepaid cell phone cards for resale.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Flora is married and has two children aged 20 and 18. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Flora works hard to sustain her childrne's education. She said college tuition gets higher every year so it is a challenge for her and her husband.

Flora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Paulina M., who is a landlady, is 47 years old, lives in Kayole Estate where her rental houses are located. Kayole is a slum area and most of her customers are low income people but they like her houses which are built with iron sheets because they are semi-permanent, affordable and well kept.  She is married to John Kitau.

Paulina has been running this business for the last 10 years and her monthly income is KES 40,000.  She also rears pigs as her secondary business. She was introduced to KADET LTD by another existing customer and she wants to use the loan to renovate her houses so she can add to the rent amount.

If the loan boosts the business, she plans to build more houses to rent and she dreams that in future she will be able to build permanent houses to rent.
Paulina describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To renovate her houses.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 56 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad, trabaja de 9:00am a 3:00 pm esta venta es muy buscada por varias personas por lo que para doña Mercedes es rentable y de sus ganancias ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar maíz, por lo que este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de contar con suficiente materia prima para realizar sus ventas, su propósito es salir con la demanda de los clientes y a traer a nuevos a su negocio para ir creciendo poco a poco.
Sueña con ser una gran comerciante, ampliar el negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in San Miguel, department of San Miguel. She is 56 years old and sells tortillas. She lives with her husband and two children, who are 20 and 15 years old. She works from 9 a.m. until 3 p.m. every day. Her product is very much in demand from several people. For Mercedes it is profitable and her earnings help her husband with the household expenses. 

She needs a loan to buy corn, and this loan will give her the opportunity to have enough raw materials to make her sales. Her motive is to meet her customers' demand and bring new ones to the business so it will grow little by little.
 
She dreams of being a great businesswoman, of growing her business and of helping her family.

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Hindu

texts.en:
Hindu is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Hindu has been selling <i>kikois (a type of sarong) door-to-door for over one year. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Hindu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a boutique shop in the future. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase 30 pieces of kikois and 20 pairs of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 30 pieces of kikois and 20 pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Elena is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Elena is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo's Group

texts.en:
Rodrigo C. is from the village of San Miguel Ramon. He is 55 years old. Rodrigo is the leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rodrigo is married. To make a living, Rodrigo provides recycling services, hauling plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for more than 26 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Rodrigo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Rodrigo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional recyclables to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Ericka; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 Hijo; La socia  tiene un negocio de venta de animales, ella vende pollos y patos y también trabaja en un comedor para niños como cocinera, la socia el negocio de venta de animales lo vende en forma ambulatoria, ya que tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como pollos y patos.

Los otros socios  se dedican la agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, ganadería, crianza de animales y restaurant.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
These are members of the communal bank known as “Nuevo Amanecer la Rinconada.”  This bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cuzco.

This member is Mrs. Luz Ericka.  She is 25 years old, lives with a partner, and has a child.  Her business is selling animals; she sells chickens and ducks.  She also works as a cook in a dining hall for children.  She sells her animals by traveling around, for she has a small farm at her home.  She wishes to expand and improve her animal-sales business, and requests a loan to buy animals such as chickens and ducks.

The other members work in farming, a general store, livestock, animal husbandry, and a restaurant.  

This member is happy to have a loan, and commits to make payments as required.

loans.use: This members requests a loan to buy animals, such as chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Ms. Sabina is a widow with two adult sons. She owns a small general store called “Sagrada Familia” (Holy Family) that is located insiD. the Ciudad del Este Downtown Market.  Business is going well and her income is good. With the help of her children, Ms. Sabina is moving forward with a lot of sacrifice and hard work. Today, she is a successful micro-entrepreneur with a growing clientele due to her good customer service.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Kha's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who are villagers in Trapeang Chamkar village, Takeo province. It is led by Mrs. Kha H.. The members will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Kha H. is a string maker. Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Kloeng, is a construction worker. She is the mother of four children. One is a construction worker,  one is a student, and the others are too small to study or work.

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. For  this purpose, Mrs. Kha H. is applying for a loan to buy more materials to make string for selling. 

With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make string for selling

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan S. is a married man, who lives with his family in Korolyovo. To earn a living, Ivan sells household cleaning and personal products in the central marketplace of his small hometown. Ivan explains that small business ventures like his are the only source of income for families in remote parts of the Ukraine. Ivan has been in this business for 9 years. Currently, his inventory amounts to 70,000 UAH, and his income is approximately 6,000 UAH per month.

Ivan states that his business is characterized by stability and positive performance. The goods that he sells are always in demand, because people need dishwasher and laundry soap, shampoos, and other household products to go about their lives. Ivan would like to see his business grow in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 UAH ($2,525). The loan proceeds would be used to increase his working capital. Ivan’s goal is to open another retail location in the near future.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business by increasing working capital

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Тошева Мадина проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 22 года. Не замужем. Образование-среднее. Уже два года как занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает фрукты. Кредит берет для покупки инжира, персика и винограда.
texts.en: Madina T. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 22 years old, she is not married and has secondary education. She has been selling on the market for two years. Madina rents out a vendor space on the market where she sells fruits. She is taking out the loan to buy dates, peaches and grapes.

loans.use: to buy dates, peaches and grapes

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a thirty-four year old married woman with four children, who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a permanent house and her family dream is to educate her children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. She has been in the agricultural sector for fifteen years and she is able to sell 100 bunches of bananas per month. She faces the challenge of limited manpower, and she would like to buy her own vehicle to transport her produce and diversify into growing tomatoes. Teddy needs the loan to grow tomatoes.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with two children who are 19 and 16 years old. They live in the town of Banga, South Cotabato.

Mary Jane is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She grows rice and corn crops and then sells her harvest to the market. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. Mary Jane hopes that her farm will always be productive and her piggery will grow.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Elia Aurora

texts.es:
Elia D. 69 años D. edad,es casada, tiene casa propia y vive en la zona rural del distrito D. San Pedro D. Lloc a unos 30 minutos D. la provincia D. Pacasmayo y a una hora del departamento D. la Libertad (Trujillo).  Acá sus pobladores se dedican al comercio, agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Elia tiene un puesto en el mercado D. San Pedro D. Lloc desD. hace unos 20 años, donD. venD. toda clase D. verduras, actividad que le permite tener ingresos diarios y cuenta con su propia clientela.  Al ver que su negocio día a día va creciendo ha creido necesario solitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. productos (verdudras) y seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad D. sus clientes que han ido en incremento en su negocio, lo que le permitirá poder pagar su préstamo y solventar sus gastos en su casa.

Elia es conocida por ser una mujer D. trabajo que con mucho esfuerzo a sacado su negocio adelante, para mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Elia, 69, is married. She has her own house and lives in the rural area of the district of of San Pedro D. Lloc, about 30 minutes from the Pacasmayo province and one hour from the department of La Libertad (Trujillo). Here the locals work in commerce, agriculture, livestock and tourism. 

Elia has had a stall in the market of San Pedro D. Lloc for about 20 years. She sells all kinds of vegetables, which allows her to have a daily income, and she has a stable client base. Seeing that her business is growing every day she has had to request Edpyme Alternativa a 2000 soles loan to buy more products (vegetables) in order to continue to meet the needs of her clients. The growing number of clients will allow her to pay back the loan and meet her living expenses. 

She is know for being a hard working woman who has painstakingly moved her business forward in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of vegetables.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio de 63 años, está casado tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 30 años que tiene de experiencia con este negocio, es una persona muy emprendedora.  El inicio con ciertos financiamientos y ha sido con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio que ha logrado obtener su medio de vida. Labora todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche pues ya está acostumbrado a tener este medio de vida. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de llantas, repuestos de su vehículo, focos y luces.
texts.en: José Antonio is 63 years old, married and has four adult children. He works as a taxi driver. He has been working in this business for more than 30 years. He is a very enterprising person. He started with some financing and with much effort and sacrifice, he has been able to obtain his way of life. He works every day from 6 in the morning til 9 at night, but he is already accustomed to this way of life. He is requesting a loan to buy tires, spare parts for his car, reflectors and lights.

loans.use: purchase tires, spare parts, reflectors and lights.

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es: Delia Maria tiene 66 años, su actividad es la venta de productos lácteos. Tiene más de 24 años con su negocio, inició con capital propio, fue con el paso del tiempo que logró ampliarlo fueron sus mismos vecinos quienes le sugirieron que empezara a vender leche, cuajada, crema, queso entre otros. Todos los días se levanta temprano para atender a sus clientes es una persona muy emprendedora. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de leche, crema, cuajada, queso y leche agria. Su meta es continuar organizando su negocio para aumentar sus ventas y tener mayor capital de trabajo con que responderle oportunamente a sus clientes.
texts.en: Delia Maria is 66 years old and she sells dairy products. She has been running her activity for more than 24 years. She started with her own capital and in time she succeeded in increasing it. Her own neighbors encouraged her to start selling milk, curd, cream, cheese and other products. She gets up very early every day to tend to her customers, as she is a very practical person. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy milk, cream, curd, cheese and filmjölk (similar to yoghurt but less sour). Her goal is to continue managing her shop in order to increase her sales and to have a wider selection of products to suitably satisfy her customers’ requests.

loans.use: To  buy milk, cream, curd, cheese and filmjölk.

loans.name: Ndeeba Tukorerehamwe Group, Kihihi

texts.en: George is the leader of Ndeeba Tukorerehamwe Group, Kihihi. He is a very hard worker. He has had a produce selling business dealing mostly in beans and rice sales from Kihihi Town for two years. He generates 100,000/= as weekly profits. George also has a retail shop as his mother's business from which he gets capital for the produce sales. He is 30 years old and married with two children aged 5 and 2 years and his dream is to see his business grow and have a self-reliant family in the future. He needs a loan to be able to buy more rice and beans for an expansion in business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 64 years old and lives in the city of Latacunga in central Ecuador. He is married and lives with his wife Gladis. They have three grown children aged 38, 36, and 35 years old. Jaime is a responsible and peaceful person who likes to work. He is a cobbler who began his business by repairing shoes. He currently makes and repairs his own footwear.

Jaime reports that business is going well. He is seeking a loan to purchase materials to make shoes. Jaime has been working with microloans for eight years and says that they have helped him improve his house and send his children to school. His dream is to have his own brand of footwear.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes
