loans.name: Chom

texts.en: Mrs. Chom is a 44-year-old married woman who has been living in Arnlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province. To make a living, she sells materials to make a fire used for cooking meals and earns around US $3 each day. She has other financial earnings from her husband who works as a doctor in his community and has a formal salary. Recently, their existing motorbike broke during the driving process. He really wants to buy a new motorbike but he doesn’t have enough funds to buy one. So Mrs. Chom would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Janco Pampita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JANCO PAMPITA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lorenza. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chuño, producción de chuño, mecánico, venta de papa, albañil, venta de fruta 

La señora Lorenza,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratado), que viene trabajando desde hace diez años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de chuño y papa) que adquirirá de las comerciantes de Achacachi y lo comercializará de la feria de la Ceja los días jueves y sábado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos.  

En la fotografía nos acompaña la señora Justina, que hizo reverción por problemas familiares, ella esta de manta cafe y sombrero negro.
texts.en:
The “JANCO PAMPITA” communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi regional center. It is composed of eight members and is governed by a board, which is headed by Lorenza. The businesses pursued by the communal bank's members are diverse, including sales of chuño [dehydrated potatoes], chuño production, mechanic services, potato sales, mason services, and fruit sales. 

Lorenza reports that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution on the invitation of the promoter. Currently, she has a business in which she sells potatoes and chuño. She has operated this business for ten years, having learned the profession from her mother. 

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her capital (buying chuño and potatoes). She will buy the products from dealers in Achacachi and sell them at La Ceja market on Thursdays and Saturdays. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has two children. 

In the photograph, the group is also accompanied by Justina, who withdrew because of family problems; she is wearing a brown blanket and black hat.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and chuño [dehydrated potatoes]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the fixtures necessary to get his plumbing job going.

loans.name: Imilda

texts.en:
Imilda is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Imilda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Imilda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Imilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Librada

texts.es:
La señora librada cuenta con 22 años de edad, está casada su esposo se llama José, quien es campesino, tienen 1 hijo que apenas tiene 2 meses de nacido, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, desde hace 4 años.
Doña librada dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos, también para tener una mejor solvencia económica, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos, para la elaboración de sus ricos antojitos como son: variedad de chiles, jitomates, cebollas, papas, carne, queso, etc.
Ella también tiene una meta para su negocio, desea hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere construir un local para poner una fonda de comida, comprar sillas, mesas y más utensilios, y así tener una mejor producción y variedad de platillos.
Esta muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ahora puede continuar invistiendo en el negocio y apoyar a su familia
texts.en:
Librada is 22 years old.  She is married to José who is an agricultural worker.  The couple have one son who is just two months old.  Librada has been making and selling food for four years.

Librada says that she decided to start out in this business because she wanted a way to support her husband with their household expenses and to pay for their child's education.  She also wanted to achieve better financial solvency.  Librada will use the loan that she received to buy more supplies for making her delicious snacks including a variety of chilis, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, meat and cheese.

Librada has a goal for her business.  She would like to grow it a lot as she would like to build premises and set up a small restaurant, buying chairs, tables and other utensils.  This would help her to produce more and offer a variety of dishes to her customers.

Librada is very grateful to Kiva lenders and FRAC for their support and the trust that they are placing in her.  Thanks to this help she is now able to continue investing in her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more supplies including a variety of chilis, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, meat, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Florentino has a cassava garden from which he harvests & sells dried cassava in due time. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for cassava plants.

Florentino is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Florentino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for cassava plants.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 42 años,  es un hombre trabajador ya que tiene un negocio de venta de pollos. Comenzó criando cerdos y como fue muy rentable decidió vender pollos en un pequeño criadero. Poco a poco ha mejorado su negocio ya que en la actualidad le ayuda su esposa criando los pollos. 

Vende los pollos por libras y enteros. También vende electrodomésticos para poder mejorar sus ingresos ya que tiene con su esposa 4 hijos. Para seguir mejorando su negocio quiere comprar con el préstamo pollos pequeños para criarlos y venderlos a un mejor valor.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old; he is a hard-working man who has a business selling chickens.  He began by raising pigs, and as this was very profitable, he decided to sell chickens in a small hatchery.  Little by little, he has grown his business, and currently his wife helps raise the chickens.

He sells the chickens both by the pound and whole.  He also sells appliances to increase his income, as he has a wife and four children.  In order to continue improving his business, he wants to use the loan to buy young chickens to raise and sell at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is married with seven children. She is 71 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis, Occidental.
Inocencia sells soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and spices to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she   earns PHP 3,980. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional stock for her store. 
Inocencia has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future Inocencia hopes to improve her business so that she can support her grandchildren by sending them to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Cela Maria

texts.es: Cela María se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Su negocio lo inicio hace 11 años, como madre soltera tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos, a pesar de que no fue fácil en ese momento pues no tenía apoyo de nadie y Cela se preocupaba por sus hijos a los que tenía que proveerles alimentos, vestimenta y estudios. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado, cosméticos y ropa interior. Sueña con ampliar su vivienda cada día más.
texts.en:
Cela María sells general goods for a living. She started her business 11 years ago and as a single mother, she had to bring her children up well. It wasn’t easy because at the time Cela had no support from anybody and she looked after her children, providing them with food, clothing and an education. 

She is requesting the loan to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shoes, cosmetics and underwear. She dreams of extending her home every day.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shoes, cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente, de 31 años, es un hombre bueno y muy responsable. Vive en compañía de su pareja, con quien tiene dos hijos de 7 y 6 años en su casa propia.  El trabajo de Vicente consiste en el transporte de carga y pasaje dentro y fuera de la ciudad, el posee dos mototaxi, en una trabaja él movilizando a sus pasajeros, mientras que en el otro mototaxi trabaja un chofer que le alquila a diario. Por otro lado también tiene un galpón donde cria aves de corral, tiene un promedio de 300 pollos, EL proceso de crianza es de 40 días y los saca a vender en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, tiene ya dos años en esta actividad,  mientras que con su mototaxi esta ya mas de 10 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que le da el hecho de poder andar por toda la ciudad ya que el admisntra su tiempo, por eso le esta yendo bien, pues gana bien con sus dos trabajos. Mas adelante desea consolidarse en la crianza de aves y comprar un par más de mototaxi más. Este será el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, le agrada pertenecer a este grupo ya que le va muy bien y sus socios son muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado, comprará muchas piezas para la refacción de sus dos mototaxi, tiene que restaurar el tapizado, llantas, los aros y dar mantenimiento.
texts.en: Vicente, 31 years old, is a good man and very responsible.  He lives in his own house with the company of his partner, with whom he has two children, 6 and 7 years old. Vicente’s work consists of the transport of cargo and passage within and outside the city. He has two motorcycle taxis. In one he works transporting passengers while in the other motorcycle taxi is rented to a driver daily. On the other hand, he has a barn where he raises poultry. He has an average of 300 chickens. The breeding process takes 40 days, and then he takes them to sell them in different markets in the city. He has two years in this activity, while with his motorcycle taxis he already has more than 10 years. What he likes about his job is the freedom that it gives him and being able to walk around the city on his own schedule. So it is going well and it pays well with his two jobs. Later he wants to strengthen his business raising birds and buy another pair of motorcycle taxis. This will be the third loan with the institution MFP. He likes belonging to this group as it is doing very well and he has very responsible partners. With the amount requested, he will buy many parts for the renovation of his two motorcycle taxis. He has to restore the upholstery, tires, rims and conduct maintenance.

loans.use: To send his motorcycles to the mechanic, buy parts, tires, and upholstery.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Arnaldo tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Delia hace 26 años, tienen ocho hijos: Andrés, Lida, Griselda, Karina, Hugo, Ronaldo, Iván, Juan, todos viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo hace más de 7 años.
El Sr. Arnaldo se dedica a la serigrafía hace 5 años. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque tiene muchos hijos y tuvo que criarlos a todos gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su señora,. Su sueño es comprar más maquinarias para trabajar y así progresar cada día mas. Está muy contento por la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, pues la ayuda es muy importante para el.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, pinturas y remeras para hacer las impresiones, pues de esa forma va a cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is 44 years old and has been married to Delia for 26 years.  They have eight children: Andrés, Lida, Griselda, Karina, Hugo, Ronaldo, Iván, Juan and all have been living in the city of Coronel Oviedo for the past seven years.

Arnaldo has been doing silk screening for the past five years and says that his work requires a lot of sacrifice because he has many children and he raised them through his and his wife’s hard work.  His dream is to buy more machines so that he can work and get ahead more each day.  He is happy about the opportunity he has gotten through Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  The assistance is very important to him.

He is asking for this loan so that he can buy fabric, paints, and t-shirts to make the screenings.  In this way he can satisfy his customers.

loans.use: Comprar telas, pinturas, remeras para impresiones.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single lady who lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent. 

Asha has operated a beauty salon for the past two years. Her potential clients are the local area ladies. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair relaxers, hair extensions and cosmetics for her salon. She decided to join Yehu to access fund to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair relaxers, hair extensions and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Age 37, Lay is married with two children who are dependents and still in school. Being a farmer who has been farming on her farm for more than 13 years in a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district, she sometimes works for others to supplement her income to feed her family. She earns less than 4 U.S. dollars (USD) per day and can save less than 1 USD from her current business. 

Lay is the second cycled client who completely repaid her first loan in 2010 with VisionFund. After the first loan, she had enough regular income to regularly feed her family and send her children to school. She now is applying for another loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more rice and earn more income to set aside some savings to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 39 years of age and a dedicated farmer. He raises five children through his farming business. He cares a lot about his farm. He is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to maintain his business. He has been in business for over 10 years and his monthly income is PHP12,000. 

Selling crops is his family's only source of income and Rolando is trying to increase his profits each month. He hopes, through this applied loan, he can uplift his income and uplift his business as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to maintain his business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy    habite dans une banlieue au Sénégal  et est âgée  de 32 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce. Elle s’adonne à la vente de tissus  et d’habits prêt a porter. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité dans le but d’augmenter ses revenus. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite et a déjà remboursé un crédit  antérieur dans l’institution. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour honorer ses commandes de tissus vis a  vis de ses fournisseurs. Son objectif est de développer son activité de commerce en augmentant ses bénéfices pour  mieux se prendre en charge ,mais aussi soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
Amy lives in a suburb of Sénégal and is 32 years old. She is advancing in her business. She devotes herself to the sale of fabric and ready to wear clothing. She chose her business out of necessity with the goal of increasing her income. 

She is a member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC in the region where she lives and has already repaid a previous loan with the institution. She is requesting a 100,000f loan to honor her fabric orders from her suppliers. Her goal is to develop her business by increasing her profits to better take care of herself, but also support her husband in managing daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her order of fabric to resell.

loans.name: Karina Beatriz

texts.es:
Karina Beatriz, tiene 30 años de edad, casada desde hace 9 años, tiene 3 hijas de 1, 4 y 6 años, vive en Cofradia, Cortes. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada.
Karina se dedica a elaborar piñatas para la venta, desde pequeña aprendió hacer esta actividad. Actualmente tiene mas de tres años de establecido su negocio. Vende piñatas en su casa y por encargo según el diseño. Le dedica 6 horas todos los días. 
Esta recibiendo un segundo préstamo para invertir en materia prima como papel china, pegamento y alambre. Su meta es ampliar el negocio, para obtener más ingresos y ayudar a una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Karina Beatriz, 30, has been married for nine years and has three daughters who are 1, 4 and 6 years old; she lives in Cofradía, Cortes and her husband is employed at a private firm.

Karina makes piñatas to sell.  She learned how to make them when she was a little girl.  To date, her business has been in operation for more than three years.  She sells piñatas at home and on order according to the design.  She spends six hours daily at work.

She is getting her second loan to invest in raw materials like crepe paper, glue and wire.  Her goal is to expand the business to earn more income and help to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy piñata making supplies.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 38 years old and from Gilgil. She is a single mother to one son, who is 17 years old.

Beth has a retail shop where she sells soft drinks to her customers. She is applying for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more drinks to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business and open up a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to add to her stock.

loans.name: Honorine Sèdè's Group

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Honorine Sèdè est la responsable d'un groupe de deux personnes. Elle a une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des mèches, des produits cosmétiques, des pagnes et autres articles. Elle s'approvisionne sur les marchés de la place. Pour étendre son activité et répondre aux préoccupations de sa clientèle, elle fait recours au financement de Finadev afin de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. La responsable est celle qui se retouve à droite de la photo.
texts.en: Honorine Sèdè is married and the mother of four children.  She is the representative of a group made up of two people.  She has a shop in which she sells hair extensions, cosmetic products, some "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and other items.  She buys her goods at a local market.  In order to expand her business and to meet the needs of her customers, she is requesting a loan from Finadev.  This loan will allow her to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's school fees.  Honorine Sèdè is the woman standing in the photograph on the right.

loans.use: to buy 20 cosmetic products and 10 "pagnes" of all kinds.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine aged 42 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 12 and 17 years.They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 25 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Equip the guards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fit in the seatbelts in the public service vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in enlarging and improving the eatery, along with the purchase of a new stove.

loans.name: Tot

texts.en:
Miss Tot is 38 and her husband is 43 years old. They have 3 children. Her first daughter stopped going to school and her second is in grade 5. They don’t have a house or any land for cultivation so they have to stay in a rented house.

Miss Tot sells sweet soup at the local market. Her husband buys waste material from door to door and then sells it to the local recycling company. They repaid a loan on time and from that loan increased their family income by about $2/person/month. Their average income is $11.5/person/month. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for their selling business.

loans.use: Sells sweet soup

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man aged 40 with two children aged 10 and 8 years who are attending primary section at a nearby school. In addition, he provides shelter and basic needs to two other relatives who reside with him.

Mr. M. sells new clothes, shoe polish, mosquito nets, and many more items. He purchases the above items in bulk at wholesale prices and sells the goods at his shop in the city center and to retailers in villages to get a profit margin. In addition, he keeps poultry, specifically layers, to supplement his income. Despite juggling here and there, Mr. M. feels that he still has potential if given financial assistance of $1200 to expand his income base by re-stocking the clothing business, which will enable him to meet his basic needs comfortably.

loans.use: Re-stock

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
The education she received from her parents taught her to work hard, and that has been very important since from the age of 10 she learned how to repair blenders expertly and efficiently.

She has become a courageous woman who is always looking for the best way to offer security to her children. And so it is that 5 years ago she independently formed her own repair shop and store selling replacement parts. Unfortunately, she had to close her business for health reasons; she had surgery twice and as a result was bed-ridden for two years.

This situation left her in a great financial crisis, which she managed to overcome thanks to the support of her family and husband.

Some time later, Ana decided to devote herself again to repairing blenders, going to her clients' homes. Up until now she has offered her services to acquaintances because she does not have a commercial locale. It is her hope to have one so she can expand her business. All her efforts are directed to making improvements for her beloved family, who day to day give color to her life. As part of this dream, she requests a loan of US$200 to buy blender replacement parts wholesale.

With your valuable contribution Ana will be able to continue working for the good of her children.

Translated by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

La educación que recibió de sus padres le enseñó a trabajar esforzadamente y eso le ha sido muy importante ya que desde los diez años aprendió a reparar licuadoras con suma destreza y rapidez.

Se ha convertido en una mujer valiente que siempre ve la mejor manera de ofrecerles bienestar a sus hijos; así hace 5 años se independizó y formó su propio taller de reparaciones y ventas de repuestos que lamentablemente tuvo que cerrar por motivos de salud; fue operada en dos oportunidades y a consecuencia de esto estuvo postrada en cama por dos años.

La situación por la que atravesó la ha sumado en una inmensa crisis económica que ha podido superar gracias al apoyo de su familia y el de su esposo.

Tiempo después Ana decide dedicarse nuevamente a la reparación de licuadoras a domicilio y hasta ahora siempre brinda sus servicios a personas conocidas porque todavía no tiene un local comercial, su deseo es poseer uno para acrecentar su negocio y todo su esfuerzo está orientado a generar mejoras para su querida familia, que cada día le dan color a su vida, como parte de ese anhelo solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares para comprar al por mayor repuestos para licuadoras.

Con tu valioso aporte Ana podrá seguir trabajando por el bien de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying replacement parts to increase volume and income.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
It’s been eight years since Yolanda began selling beauty products by catalog. She started this endeavor to be able to help with their cost of living, given that they have three children and the school supplies and books that are required by the school are very expensive. She does not like the idea that her children go through what she did by not having the opportunity to get ahead and have an education. For this reason, she does even the impossible to assure that they can continue with their studies. With much effort, and little by little, her customer base has grown. Despite this, the struggle continues to earn enough money to cover basic living expenses.

Yolanda is asking for a $700USD loan to be repaid over a period of six months. With these funds, she will be able to purchase merchandise to give demonstrations to women in her town. With your help, Yolanda will be able to help her family get ahead and share in her successes. She wants to treat them to special, delicious meal for the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ocho años que Yolanda comenzó a trabajar vendiendo productos cosméticos por catálogo. Y desde ese entonces lo hizo para poder ayudar con los gastos en el hogar, puesto que tienen tres hijos y los materiales y libros que le piden en la escuela son muy caros y a Yolanda no le gusta la idea de que sus hijos pasen por lo mismo que ella al no tener la oportunidad de salir adelante por falta de estudios. Por lo tanto ella hace hasta lo imposible por que sigan estudiando. Con mucho esfuerzo y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su cartera de clientas sin embargo la lucha sigue para poder sacar dinero para pagar las cosas del hogar.

Yolanda está solicitando un crédito de US $700 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para hacer demostraciones entre mujeres de su colonia. Con tu ayuda Yolanda podrá sacar adelante a su familia y podrá compartir sus triunfos con ella. Porque les quiere regalar de navidad una cena muy rica entre familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra Kamate prepares a native food called ‘Wakye’ for sale. She also fries fish on a large scale for distribution. Her husband is an operator of a milling machine but his daily income is not enough to meet the family’s financial needs. Zahra is working very hard to support her husband to meet the family’s financial needs. She wants to increase her income; she has plans to improve upon her business

She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more fresh fish, beans, oil, rice, and other food supplies which are the raw materials for her food production.

loans.use: Buy more fresh fish, beans, oil, rice and other food supplies which are the raw materials for her food production.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mrs. In C., age 47, works making Khmer noodles and selling them wholesale for a profit, earning typically about $7 each day. Her husband works as a security guard and makes around $2.50 per day. They have four children. One is a security guard and the rest help her make noodles.

She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for business transportation. This will save on transportation costs and increase her efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her noodle business transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Marta's Group

texts.es:
The committee is composed of 15 hard-working women from the Kennedy neighborhood of Caacupe. The majority of the members work in the cultivation and sale of garden plants, some sell groceries, and a few sell clothes for men, women, and children. A special characteristic of the group is their unity, which is demonstrated as they coordinate the sale of their products each weekend in the main neighborhood square.

The group is currently in the 7th cycle of the Entrepreneurial Women program, where each member manages an average credit of ~$188. The members are involved in the sale of plants, clothing, and groceries.

The women of the committee found out about the program through the local newspaper, and got in contact with the Caacupe office program advisor. The group of 15 women formed quickly, calling itself the “Tekova Pora Rekavo” committee, and the first meetings were carried out in group president Marta S.’s home. They are very grateful to Fundacion Paraguaya for the support they are receiving through the program, and that not only are they receiving credit, but also training that helps them learn how to confront the challenges that come with being small businesswomen.

The loan they receive will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, flowerpots, seeds, and garden plants; other women will invest it in the purchase of basic products like sugar, herbs, milk, and beef among others.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Kennedy de Caacupé, la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican al cultivo y venta de plantas para jardín, algunas poseen despensas y una minoría se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, una de las características muy especial del grupo es que son muy unidas, inclusive cuando deben coordinar la exposición de sus productos los fines de semana en la plaza del barrio.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 7mo. ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de gs. 853.000 cada integrante. Entre las actividades que realizan se encuentran: vendedoras de plantas, vendedoras de ropas, y despensas.

El comité se inició gracias a que una de las señoras se enteró a través del diario local (prensa) y se puso en contacto con el asesor del programa de la oficina de Caacupé y rápidamente empezó a formarse el grupo de 15 señoras que lo denominaron Comité “Tekove Pora Rekavo” y sus primeras reuniones lo llevaron acabo en la casa de la presidenta la señora Marta S., quien además manifestó estar muy agradecida a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que están recibiendo ya que a través de este programa no solo reciben el crédito si no también están recibiendo capacitación y esto les permite asimilar nuevos conocimientos para afrontar los desafíos que conlleva ser un microempresaria.

El préstamo que reciban lo invertirán en la compra de abonos, macetas, semillas, plantas para jardín, otras señoras lo invertirán en la compra de productos de consumo diario como azúcar, yerba mate, leche, carne, entre otros productos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, flowerpots, garden plants, sugar, beef, herbs, flour, milk, charcoal, drinks, and clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Mercedes Adilia

texts.es:
Mercedes Adilia is 35 years old and the mother of five children.  She dedicates herself to purchasing and raising pigs, conducting her business as a traveling salesperson to help out her husband, Mr. Argling Suarez, who works as a gold miner in the town of La Libertad.  She is interested in this third loan to continue making improvements to her home.  This time, in particular, she wants to make repairs to her kitchen and add a living room floor and in this manner improve the living conditions in the house.

 Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer. 

La Sra. Mercedes Adilia, de 35 años de edad, madre de 5 niños, que se dedica a compra y engorde de cerdos y hacer venta ambulante para apoyar a su marido el Sr. Argling Suarez, que trabaja de pequeño minero en la mina de extraccion de oro del poblado de La Libertad, esta interesada en un 3er credito para continuar haciendole mejoras a su casa, esta vez en reparacion de su cocina y poner el piso de la sala y brindar mejores condiciones de vida en el hogar

loans.use: Make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria started her business when she realized that her husband’s salary was not enough. They were always having difficulty getting by and were always short of money. Because of this they were not meeting household expenses and school fee payments. She decided to become self-employed in something that would not take her away from home, and so she chose to start selling cosmetics. She started more than 3 years ago with the help of her family who helped her to buy some catalogues and to build up clientele.

She now needs a loan of $250 that she will pay in 3 months in order to buy merchandise and be able to deliver some orders. With your help Victoria can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria inició el negocio cuando se dio cuenta que el sueldo de su esposo era insuficiente y siempre tenian carencia y falta de de dinero, ya que no completaba con los gastos y pagos de escuela. Ella decidio emplearse por su cuenta, en algo que no descuidara su casa, por loq ue decidio empezar con la venta de cosmeticos. Comenzó hace mas de 3 años con apoyo de su familia le ayudaron a comprar unos catalogos y se hizo de clientela.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder entrgar algunos pedidos. Con tu ayuda Victoria podra incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
Khurshed M. is 20 years old and he is a hard worker. He is single with no children. He has been farming since he was a young boy. He has five years of experience and he has been able to support himself by learning how to manage his crops in the short growing season. His business includes growing and selling crops such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots and cabbages.

This year is very important for Khurshed as he is planning to enter the University. Khurshed would like to use this loan to purchase more farming supplies such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities in order to manage his crops appropriately and in the end to make enough profit to be able to pay the University fees. With your help he can achieve his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing of herbicides and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria P. is 43 years old, and is married to Mr. Sixto Reyes who is 46 years old, they have 4 children, 2 of them are older in age and the youngest is in elementary school. Her business is the sale of milk and its by-products which she began 6 years ago with the purchase of 3 cows. Maria tells us that this activity was not sufficient to bear the expenses of her children, so they decided to open a small store with the help of her father who gave her a loan. Today the business is managed by her husband who then provides for the household and children’s expenses. This loan will be earmarked to purchase feed for their farm animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Maria P. tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Sixto Reyes de 46 años, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor está cursando la primaria. Su actividad es la venta de leche y sus derivados la cual la inicio hace 6 años con la compra de 3 vacas. Maria nos cuenta que con esta actividad no fue suficiente para sobrellevar los gastos de los chicos, así fue que decidieron abrir una despensa con la ayuda de su padre quién le otorgo un préstamo, esta actividad hoy día es manejada por su esposo quien así aporta para los gastos de la casa y los gastos de los chicos. Este préstamo será destinado la compra de balanceados.

loans.use: Purchase feed for her farm animals.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn S. is a farmer who grows rice, and is 43 years old. She has been growing rice since 1980 and earns US$1.50 per day. She lives with her husband and one child in Pteah Rong Commune, Pursat Province, and they work hard every day.

The farming season has arrived, so Sorn is seeking a loan of US$100 to purchase fertilizer and increase the farm's yield for her business. She hopes that the loan will increase her income and sustain their family. Sorn and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es: Su primera experiencia en negocio fue viajando a Costa Rica con un crédito  otorgado por ADIM  ofreciendo variedad de mercadería, de esta manera logro salir adelante e incrementar sus ventas. Lo que le ha permitido establecerse en un punto fijo en el mercado central de Rivas, donde ahora ofrece además de chinelas, calzado y variedad de ropa para adulto y niño. Doña Teodora vive en San Rafael, cuenta con el apoyo de  su esposo y  de  sus hijos, Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio más grande para darles una mejor atención  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Her first experience in business was traveling to Costa Rica with a loan obtained from ADIM offering a variety of merchandise, in this way she was able to move forward and increase her sales. What this has allowed is for her to establish herself n a stand in the central market of Rivas, where she now offers also foot wear and a variety of clothes for adults and children. Mrs. Teodora lives in San Rafael, counts on the support of her husband and her children. She dreams of arriving at having a bigger business to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mrs. Noem C. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Tonle village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a widow and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed while the other attends the local school.  She has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to supplement her income from cultivating rice and thereby to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Lus

texts.en:
Lus N., 35, is married and lives with her two children and husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia.  She weaves palm leaves to make roofs and sells them to the local market in order to earn a living.  Lus is able to make $4 USD per day.  Her husband grows sugar cane, and he makes $5 USD per day.  

Lus N. would like to take out a loan of $500 USD to purchase fertilizers for her husband to put on his farmland.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. is 32 years old. She is married with two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children are currently in the basic school. Dora’s husband is a farmer. He cultivates food crops such as cassava, plantains, etc., in the community in which they live. Dora is into trading. She sells provisions like milk, sugar, bread and vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc., and all kinds of cooking oil. Dora sells in a small kiosk in front of her house. She has been in business for three years. Dora says she buys her goods from Kumasi and sometimes from the wholesalers in her community. It is Dora’s dream to expand her business by acquiring a bigger store to sell in. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk from the big cities where the cost is more economical.

loans.use: To buy provisions, vegetables and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
V. has been working as a staff member of the Toothpaste Company for the past three years and currently gets a salary of $180 a month.  

He is aged 27 and lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia.  He is married to Mrs. Seth, 27, who is working as a garment worker for a garment factory.  The young couple now cares for one young child, who is enrolled in the primary school. 

The family has been suffering from the pollution surrounding their house for a long time, which is harmful to their health.  Therefore, V. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase another piece of land and also to repair his old house.  The loan will help the family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of land and to repair his old house

loans.name: I Made Mekir

texts.id: Jatuhnya harga vanili berimbas kepada semua petani yang menanam pohon vanili di kebunnya. Demikian juga yang dialami oleh I Made Mekir. Namun, dengan adanya pendampingan dari staf Dinari, I Made Mekir disarankan untuk beralih ke usaha baru yang lebih menjanjikan yaitu menanam pohon kakao. Saat ini tanaman kakao sangat diminati oeh banyak petani karena perawatannya yang mudah, namun hasilnya maksimal. Harganya pun relatif stabil dipasaran. Pinjaman kedua ini akan dipergunakan untuk biaya pengolahan tanah dan membeli bibit kakao. I Made Mekir merasa bersyukur karena mendapat pendampingan dan solusi untuk masalahnya sehingga ia tidak merasa rugi terlalu banyak. I Made Mekir berencana untuk mengganti seluruh tanaman vanilinya dengan kakao agar hasil yang didapat akan maksimal.
texts.en:
The drop in vanilla price impacted a lot of vanilla farmer, including I Made Mekir. For the next farming season I Made Mekir is advised by DINARI foundation to switch to cacao. Cacao is the favorite plan at the moment. It is easy to grow and the price is stabile.

I Made Mekir is going to use the new loan to grow cacao.He will replace all of his vanilla with cacao.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cacao seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem B., 47, is a villager living in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia, where he has established a family with six members. They live in a small wooden house. He currently makes a daily income to help support his family by working as a construction worker.

He is married to Em, 43, who is a local rice farmer. The couple has four children: three of them are single and the other one is married. One of their daughters is employed as a garment worker. To earn extra income, B. is applying for a $100 loan in order to buy a piglet to raise. (Mr. B.'s wife and his daughter are pictured.)

loans.use: To buy a piglet to raise

loans.name: Foyeke

texts.en: Fekoye O. is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials, shoes and bags. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials, bags and shoes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca posee 41 años y esta casda con el sr. Vicente de 47 años.  Ellos tienen 3 hijos todos mayores de edad que trabajan en el negocio.

La señora siempre trabajo en ventas. Con mucho esfuerzo lograron abrir un local que actulamente cuenta con mas de 20 empleados y una buena cantidad de cleintes.

Le gustaria para el futuro qu sus hijos estudien y que tengan sus propios negocios. Ademas le gustaria contar con local propio para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca is 41 years old and married to Vicente, age 47. They have 3 adult children who work in their business. Blanca has always worked in sales. With great effort they were able to open a shop that currently has over 20 employees and a large number of customers. In the future they would like for their children to go to school and have their own businesses. They would also like to own their own shop to meet their customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sunglasses, CDs, radios, chargers, batteries, DVDs

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
T. Marie est âgée de 35 ans. Marie est originaire de sahouè dans le Département du Mono.  Marie est mariée à TETE Janvier,chauffeur de taxi. Marie a quatre (4) enfants. Marie n'est jamais allée à l'école; très jeune, Marie fut placée auprès de sa marâtre, qu'elle aidait à vendre de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Après son mariage, Marie s'est mise dans l'agriculture avec la culture de manioc qu'elle transforme en farine appelée localement gari. Mais depuis deux ans, Marie prépare et vend la pâte de maïs et du poissons frits. Marie pour acheter de maïs en gros et stocké, afin de faire plus de bénéfices sur ses ventes, a besoin de moyens financiers. C'est pourquoi Marie sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Marie, 35, comes from Sahouè in Mono county. Marie is married to Tete Janvier, who drives a taxi. Marie has 4 children. She never went to school. At a young age, she went to work with her step-mother, whom she helped to sell various items (bonbons, cookies, tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, detergents, dish-washing liquid, bath soap, etc.)

After her marriage, Marie began to grow manioc which she would turn into rough flour or grits, locally called "gari". But after two years, Marie is making and selling maize porridge and fried fish. She would like to buy the maize wholesale, in order to make more profit on her sales. For this she needs more working capital. This is why she is requesting a loan from ALIDé. The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa, beside Nigeria. Its per capita yearly income is US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 15 sacks of 50 kg of maize

loans.name: Silman

texts.en:
Silman M. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting for a loan to open up a restaurant. She is 25 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry to hire. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a resturant

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing E. sells secondhand underwear and has been in this business for a long time. She is married with eight children and she is 55 years old.

She is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more secondhand underwear to sell. Blessing says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand underwear to sell

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
O. Đỗ Thị (218981253) is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has two school-aged children.

O. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, O. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

O. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Odildjon

texts.en:
Z. Odildjon is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. Odildjon is a very diligent and hardworking man. With his car, he is providing taxi services. For the last 3 years, this business has been the main income for the family, allowing Odildjon to improve the living conditions of his large family. Along with his wife and children, he is also supporting his mother and brother. As any business generating income, the business of Odildjon also requires some investments from time to time. Thus, his car needs some fixing. For this purpose, Odildjon requests 1,500 USD for purchasing spare parts. Odildjon promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Thorough fixing of the vehicle used for providing taxi services

loans.name: Levica

texts.en:
Levica and her husband, Leonardo, are living in the simple village of Madiangat Quezon Nueva Vizcaya with their five children. They help each other to support the education of their children through their buy and sell business of recyclable materials.  

Despite the hardships of life, they are determined to become successful in their business endeavor. Aside from collecting scrap materials that they will sell in the junk shop, Levica also sells charcoal at retail price in the market of Solano. Every day her husband looks for scrap materials and sells them in big junk shops in Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She can see that their small businesses are doing good and are very beneficial to their family. Thus, she wants to request additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000 for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her businesses (buying and selling of recyclable material and charcoal)

loans.name: Tawop Arsobeh Group

texts.en:
This is Ramatu K., Wotho F., Mohamed I. K., Mohamed K. and Musu K.. They called their group Tawop Arsobeh. They are petty-traders and farmers in Masorie village, about thirteen miles from Makeni City. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, generate more income to look after themselves and children. 

Ramatu K. is the leader of this group. Ramatu was born in Masorie village. She is thirty-five years of age, married with three children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School II, the other is in class V and the other in class II. Ramatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and vegetables. She buys these items from villages surrounding Masorie village and sells in Makeni City. Ramatu has been a businesswoman for over ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy T. lives in Zabarte Road, Caloocan City.  She is 25 years old.  She owns and manages a general store which she inherited from her parents when she got married.

Joy grew up with her general store, which is why this business is very dear to her.  From her profits, she was able to set up a small computer shop which proved to be another strong source of income for her family.  She earns at least P13,000 a month from the combined operations of the general store and the computer shop.

The start of 2009 was a real blessing for Joy.  She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the first week of January.  She was impressed at how her neighbors are progressing in their businesses so she gave it a try and was convinced of the many good things her neighbors have been telling her about the cooperative.  

Joy has applied for a new loan in the amount of P9,000 to purchase computer peripherals.  She is now religiously saving for the future of her children and so she can also open another branch for her computer shop.

      

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase computer peripherals

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina B. is from the village of Sipaloc. She is 44 years old. Nina is married. To make a living, Nina raises and sells pigs. Nina is just starting this business.

In 2008, Nina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Nina is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP that she will use to purchase more piglets to raise. This will be Nina's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: God Time Group

texts.en:
God Time is a group of five borrowers led by Isatta K..  Isatta is 49 years-old and married with a 25 year-old child with an educational level of the eleventh grade.  Isatta is illiterate due to the fact that most Muslim parents in Liberia when she was growing up could not send their girl children to school. 
She and her family live in Virginia but she works in the Dualla market, the largest food market north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia 

Isatta's business is selling prepared food. She buys food and cooking materials such as rice, oil, seasoning, charcoal and vegetables and sells the well prepared food plates in the market.  She has had this business for 20 years and hopes to establish a large restaurant in the future.  Isatta's delicious food is affordable and she talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Unfortunately, she faces difficulties in the rainy season because when it rains there are fewer customers.

Isatta is seeking a loan in order to purchase rice, seasoning cubes, oil, vegetables etc. in order to cook more food to serve her customers. Isatta dreams of improving her and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 43-year-old businesswoman who sells trousers and shirts in Kiambu Market. She has been in this business for nine years and hopes to open two more locations and a boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add to her stock of shirts and trousers. A mother to three, Jane plans to employ one more person to help her run her successful business. She describes herself as hardworking, time conscious and persistent.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and trousers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell jewelry, pearls, bracelets, and necklaces

loans.name: Waterside  Youth Group

texts.en:
Thompson Q. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Waterside Youth. He is 52 years and is married with 6 children aged 15-31. The children's educational levels are from 2nd -6th grade and some are drop-outs. Thompson is a 10th grade drop-out due to poverty. He lives and sells on Randall and Water Street, Monrovia, Liberia.

Thompson's business is the sale of used shoes, which he buys wholesale and sells retail from a table on Water Street. He sells goods that attract customers to continue buying from him. Thompson has been running this business for 10 years, and hopes to expand his business and open a shop. He needs this loan to purchase new goods to improve business. Thompson dreams of sending his children to a better school and providing them with better health care.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to improve business.

loans.name: Yesica Leonor

texts.es:
En su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Yesica E. se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos pero actualmente no cuenta con dichos productos para comercializarlos y por tal razón ha solicitado un crédito oportuno para adquirir dichos productos y así comercializarlos para continuar contribuyendo al bienestar de su familia y de su hijo en edad escolar ya que ella es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a este pequeño.
Ella siempre ha vendido ambulantemente estos productos pero ahora ha iniciado a venderlos en su propia casa de habitación donde le ha ido mejor y por esto espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
In her house in the county of San Rafael del Sur, Mrs. Yesica E. has been selling cosmetics, but she currently has no such products to sell and for that reason she has requested a timely loan to acquire said products, in order to sell them and in that way continue to contribute to the well-being of her family and her school age son, since she is a single mother with the responsibility to support this little one. She has always sold these products on the street but she has now started to sell them out of her own house where she is doing better and this is the reason she hopes the loan will be given to her satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Dioselina

texts.es:
La señora Maria  Dioselina V.  forma parte Banco Comunal El Pedregal desde hace 13 ciclos,  las socias se reúnen  en la  parroquia Picoaza en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Maria está casada su esposo es comerciante y viaja al Oriente llevando mercadería como prendas de vestir y ella se dedicada a la venta de productos de belleza Avon,  recorre en la parroquia donde vive visitando a sus clientes puerta a puerta   dejando la mercadería con  facilidad de pago, para comprar los productos invierte un aproximado de 300 dólares por pedido mensual.

Con este nuevo préstamo ella invertirá en su negocio comprando perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, sombras y todo los productos de belleza para la mujer y otra parte entregará a su esposo para abastecer su negocio con ropa para toda la familia e incrementar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Dioselina V. has been part of the Communal Bank “El Pedregal” (The Stony Ground) for the past 13 loan cycles. The members meet in the city of Portoviejo in Picoaza Parish.

Maria is married to a merchant who travels to the east and brings back merchandise such as clothing. She spends her time selling Avon beauty products in the parish where her customers live. Maria travels door-to-door to deliver her merchandise and provide different payment options. She invests approximately $300 dollars each month in order to fulfill her orders.

With this new loan, she will purchase products for her business such as perfumes, crèmes, treatments, eye shadows, and all types of beauty products for women. Part of the loan will be used by her husband to acquire clothing for all ages so that they can grow both of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & clothing

loans.name: Koul

texts.en:
The small wooden house and grocery shop located in a commune of Siem Reap Province belongs to Mrs. Koul T., age 36. There, she sells a few cooking ingredients to her neighbors who own houses near hers. Beside this, she distills Khmer wine and sells it to the retailers in the market for extra income. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who sells carving wood. Koul T. is a good mother caring for five teenage children, all of whom are students. They also assist in their parent’s businesses when they are not going to school. 

Koul T. is taking her first loan to accumulate her inventory for her grocery shop. With any remaining money from the loan, she will buy animals and raise their babies.

loans.use: To accumulate inventory for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Olawuyi

texts.en: Olawuyi is a hardworking and honest man. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He sells foodstuffs at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He uses his experience in business to attract and retain customers. He is married with 6 children and he is 58 years old. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La  Asociación Comunal “Estrellas” que trabaja en el centro focal de Panamericana cuenta con diez integrantes. Los negocios que las señoras declaran son: venta de buzos, papa, chuño (papa deshidratada) verduras, útiles escolares, ropa y también algunas se dedican al transporte público.
Una de las socias es Ana María V., indica que se encuentra en la Asociación desde hace 1 año, ingresó al grupo por invitación de una amiga.  A sus 48 años, tiene el negocio de venta de útiles escolares y tiene épocas de venta  alta a principios  y mediados de cada año, después la venta es regular, vende su mercadería en la Feria 16 de Julio, ofreciendo a diferentes personas. Ana María invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de material escolar como cuadernos, hojas y demás.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas" (Stars) communal association, that is part of the Panamericana focal center, has 10 members. The woman are involved in the following businesses: sweatshirt sales, potato and dehidrated potato sales, sale of vegetables, school supplies and clothing; some provide public transportation services. One of the members, Ana María V., 48, has been a member for a year; she was invited to join by a girl friend. She sells school supplies and her highest sales occur at the beginning and half way through each year. During the rest of the year, sales are regular. She has her business in the 16 de Julio market and she has various customers. Ana María will use the funds to buy school supplies, such as: notebooks, paper, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Alma Doris

texts.es: Alma Doris C. D. A. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como empleado para una empresa privada, junto a sus dos hijos D. 14 y 4 años D. edad, quienes estudian y junto a su madre la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a ayudarle con el cuidado D. los niños. Alma posee un puesto ambulante D. tostadas D. plátanos, yuca, los cuales se preparan con limón, chile y sal. Este negocio es ambulante debido a que ella trabaja en conjunto con una feria, la cual se va moviendo D. pueblo en pueblo en donD. se estén celebrando las fiestas patronales del lugar. Alma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. yuca y plátanos, así mismo comprar aceite para freírlos y todos los aderezos que necesita. D. esta manera es como Alma se ha ganado la vida durante muchos años, es por ello que desea poder invertir un poco más en el negocio y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alma Doris C. D. A. is 46 years old. She lives in Soyapango, located in the district of San Salvador. She lives together with her spouse, who works as an employee for a private company. She also lives with her two children, ages 14 and 4, who are in school, and with her mother, who does the housework and helps her care for the children. Alma owns a street stand for fried plantains and yuca, which are prepared with lime, chili, and salt. This business is mobile, requiring that she work jointly with a fair which moves from village to village, in which the patron saint festivals of the region are celebrated. Alma is requesting a loan through which she can buy a larger quantity of yuca and plantains, as well as buy oil to fry them and all of the seasonings she needs. Alma has maD. a living in this way for many years, and it is for that that she wishes to be able to invest a little more in the business and so increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plantains, yuca, and limes.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 36-year-old single man living with his mother and sister. He helps his mother with the family expenses after the death of his father.

Iyad has owned a carpentry shop for the past eight years and produces all types of wood products upon request of his clients. Today, Iyad is requesting $1,000 to purchase additional wood to be able to present a variety of products to his customers and to increase his income.

Iyad is certain that, with the help of the loan requested, he will be able to develop his business in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Group For Used Shoes

texts.en:
Solomon G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Group For Used Shoes'. He is 40 years old, single, and has three children who range from 5 to 17 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty.

For four years, he has been selling used shoes on Mechlin Street downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  He sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  He plans to use his 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 42,800 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used shoes.  His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Solomon is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Marthaline L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. She is 35 years old, married and has four children who range from 4 to 19 years. She cares for two siblings. She is also a nursing student.

For 12 years, she has been selling palm oil at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She started selling with 1,500 Liberian Dollars and now has 20,000 Liberian dollars as working capital.

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 53,000 Liberian Dollars group loan amount to buy more palm oil.

Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman who likes to take good care of her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, group member Edith is inset at lower right because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil.

loans.name: Jaquilyn

texts.en: Jaquilyn M. is from the village of San Jose. She is 22 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Jaquilyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jaquilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jaquilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Susita

texts.en:
Susita M. is from the town of Banga. She is 54 years old. Susita is married and has nine children. While some of her children have already finished college, she still has kids who go to school. Susita owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to sustain her family and her children's education.

Susita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Susita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Susita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion C. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store business. She lives in Purok Antolanga, Barangay Tinongan, Isabela, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Romeo, and their two children who are 19 and 28 years old. Salvacion has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000. Salvacion is now borrowing Php 17,500 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her general store. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Salvacion aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Sainoding

texts.en:
Sainoding R. is from the village of San Roque, Barinaut, Iligan City. He is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Sainoding owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Sainoding has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Sainoding joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sainoding has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sainoding is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sainoding from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Roque, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 25 years old and has 3 children who range from the age of 2-12 years.  All of the children are in school apart from the youngest.  Her husband is a businessman.

Julienne has a shop which contains sugar, Vaseline, salt, etc. She has done this business for 12 years and she aims to have a wholesale shop. She is requesting a loan to increase the number of items she sells in her store.

loans.use: Purchasing items to sell in her store

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel D. is from the village of Namnama. He is 35 years old, married and has 2 infants. To make a living, Rodel owns & operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Rodel has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rodel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. Rodel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be Rodel's 3rd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maria del Socorro se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo. Pues no es el primer crédito que solicita ya que tiene cierta experiencia para mejorar su negocio. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que le gusta luchar y sacar a sus hijos adelante, pues su negocio ha crecido con el paso del tiempo. Este crédito es para  mejorar su negocio y comprar cerdos. Ella sueña con obtener una pulpería, ya que así ganaría más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Maria del Socorro earns her living by selling pork. As this isn’t her first loan, she has some experience using money to improve her business. She has always been an enterprising woman so she enjoys the daily struggle and helping her children make their way in the world. Her business has grown over the years.
