With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда мать троих взрослых детей, которой 55 лет. Мужа нет в живых, поэтому она живёт со старшим сыном и он вместе ведёт семейные расходы. Сын работает водителем маршрутного городского такси, а его жена занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Мавлюда вносит маленькую лепту в семейные нужды внося хоть не большой но доход с продажи сезонных домашних шлёпанцев и тапочек. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет завезти партию зимних тапочек.
texts.en: Mavluda is a 55 year-old mother of three adult children.  Her husband has passed away, and this is why she lives with her oldest son, and they manage family expenses together.  Her son works as a driver of a municipal set-route taxi, and his wife is involved in household work and raising children.  Mavluda brings in a small contribution to the family needs, contributing her small profit from the sales of house flip flops and slippers.  She wants to use this loan to bring in an inventory of winter slippers.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of winter slippers

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. 

Rosela owns and operates a food stall where she sells snack foods in the local community. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Rosela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sopen

texts.en:
Sopen, 35, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Nowadays, she’s basket producer, earning USD 2 per day. Her husband and one of her children are construction workers, earning USD 9.50 per day. Family monthly expenses for food are USD 30, utility expense is USD 6, and school fees for her children are USD 17. Other expenses come to USD 25. 

Sopen is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase construction materials to build her house. This loan will help her have a nice house and good living conditions. In the future, she wants to improve her living standard by collecting baskets from other makers to sell at the market to get more income. Moreover, she wants to support her children to study more to become a teacher.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 55 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 38 and 25 years; all of them are married. She sells beans and has been running a business for the past 4 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans to sell. She will use the profits from the business to reinvest in it and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve on his business

loans.name: Cristelo

texts.en:
Cristelo A., a native of Catembe, grew up with his mother and attended school until the eighth grade. Due to increasing pressures he discontinued his studies and has since sought a profession that can help him in the support of his family, especially after his parents’ separation. In 1992, he began an apprenticeship as a mechanic. During these 3 years he also worked in the offices of Radio Mozambique. At the end of these 3 years, he began to work for himself, opening a small vehicle repair shop. In early 2006, he acquired a Land Rover from a friend and began to transport passengers from Catembe to Ponta de Ouro, 120 km from the city of Maputo. Right now, the Land Rover is disabled. With the loan Cristelo intends to repair his vehicle. His services are a positive contribution to the community. The route he operates lacks sufficient transport due to precarious road conditions. Only 4-wheel-drive vehicles like Cristelo’s are capable of traversing these roads. Cristelo also has to account for an increase in rent and securing another job. A family of five, including himself, his wife and three children, are dependent on this business. In the future, he intends to improve his transportation services by obtaining a vehicle with greater passenger accommodation.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristelo A., jovem natural da catembe, cresceu com a mãe, frequentou a escola até a 8ª classe, dada pressão da vida desistiu de estudar procurando desde então uma profissão a qual podia ajudar no sustento familiar uma vez que os pais estava separados. Em 1992, iniciou com aprendizagem da mecânica e tendo trabalhado durante 3 anos na oficina da Rádio Moçambique. Passado os três anos começou a trabalhar por conta própria onde abriu uma pequena oficina de reparação de veiculos. No inicio de 2006 adquiriu um viatura da marca Land Rover a um amigo e iniciou com o transporte de passageiro Catembe-Ponta de Ouro cerca de 120Km da cidade de Maputo. Actualmente a Viatura está avariada e com o crédito pretende reabilitá-la. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo pois a via que opera tem carência de transporte dada as condições precária da estrada e apenas circulam viaturas com tracção as 4 rodas (4X4) como a dele é que são capazes de transitar. Por outro constitui um incremento da renda familiar e garante mais um posto de trabalho. Deste negocio depende uma família constituída por cinco membros incluindo o próprio a esposa e três filhos. No futuro pretende consolidar mais esta área em adquirir mais um meio de transporte que garante maior comodidade aos passageiros.

loans.use: To buy spares to repair his public transport car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy more used shoes in order to expand her used shoes business.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is a 70-year-old single woman who has a grocery store in her home. She also buys clothes at the border where it costs less, and sells it in her store. She belongs to the group “Poderosas 2” together with Maria Elena Alvarez Bautista (grocery store) and Maria Luisa Gomez V. (clothes sales in her home). With this loan they will purchase merchandise to supply the grocery stores as well as invest in the purchase of clothing items to have a larger variety to offer their clients.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Teresa tiene 70 años , es soltera , tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y tambien compra ropa en la frontera donde es mas economica y la vende en su local. Pertenece al grupo Poderosas dos y sus otras integrantes son : Maria Elena Alvarez Bautista (tienda de barrotes ) y Maria Luisa Gomez V. (vende ropa en su casa). Con el prestamo compraran mercaderia para abastecer las tiendas de abarrotes y ademas invertiran en la compra de ropa para poder tener mas variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes .

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita and her husband have a small business selling fruits and vegetables. It is located in their house and they work every day of the week. Juanita is also an artisan. In her free time she embroiders napkins, bedcovers, shawls, and table decorations, which she sells in the artisan market of San Cristóbal de las Casas. With the loan, she will invest in a shelf to exhibit her stock of fruits and vegetables. She will also buy fabrics and threads to continue with her embroidery. In this way they hope to improve the business and thereby increase their income and their economic situation. Juanita is 46 years old and has 6 children. She is part of the loan group Merced 4.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANITA junto con su esposo tienen un pequeño negocio de frutas y verduras. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa y lo trabajan todos los días de la semana. También ella es artesana, en sus ratos libres borda servilletas, sobrecamas, chales, centros de mesa y los vende en el mercado de las artesanías de San Cristóbal de las Casas. Con el préstamo invertirá en un estante para exhibir el surtido de las frutas y verduras de igual forma comprara telas e hilos para continuar con el bordado. De esta forma desean mejorar el negocio y así aumentar las ganancias mejorando la condición económica. Ella tiene 46 años y tiene 6 hijos. Forma parte del grupo merced 4.

loans.use: To buy a shelf to exhibit fruits and vegetables; to buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Mrs. Nuon C., aged 31, makes and sells desserts out of her house to earn about $3.30 per day in income.  Her husband is a laborer, earning about $2.30 per day.  They have two children who are currently too young to attend school.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a plot of land to grow vegetables to feed her family.  She plans to use any remaining funds to purchase dessert supplies so that she can vary the types of sweets she makes in response to client demand.

loans.use: To purchase land to grow vegetables and purchase dessert making ingredients.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina K. is a young woman who has been occupied with the selling of mens’ clothes since 2004. Despite of her young age, she is very smart and a very quick businesswoman. She has a stable business and her assets are increasing every month. She reimburses her loans in time without any problem. Now, she wants to enlarge her business and is hoping for another loan. Madina thanks you in advance.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Here we find Mrs. Eulalia, working anxiously in her small carpentry workshop. This noble profession, to which she's been devoted from four months ago, helps to provide higher education to her three beloved children, while also helping two other children who look after the welfare and safety of their respective families. Mrs. Eulalia's greatest dream is to make her small carpentry shop, one of the largest and most recognized in the city of Juliaca. She plans to realize this goal by working carefully and thoroughly putting her best effort in each piece of furniture she makes. Her desire is to offer beautiful, fine and innovative works to her clients, in order to ensure that they feel very satisfied and pleased with the results of her products. To this end, Mrs. Eulalia wishes to obtain a loan which she'll invest towards the purchase of good quality wholesale lumber, so she can slowly meet the demands of her customers. Eulalia hopes to count on your help. Please don't let her down.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Eulalia, trabajando ansiosamente en su pequeño taller de carpintería, este noble oficio al que se dedica desde hace cuatro meses le permite brindarle estudios superiores a sus tres queridos hijos, y al mismo tiempo ofrecerle trabajo a otros dos jóvenes quienes velan por el bienestar y seguridad de sus respectivas familias.El deseo más grande de doña Eulalia es hacer de su pequeño tallercito de carpintería uno de los más grandes y reconocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca, es por ese objetivo que trabaja con sumo cuidado y detalladamente poniendo lo mejor de sí en cada uno de los muebles que realiza, con el fin de ofrecerles hermosos, finos y novedosos trabajos a sus clientes, con el propósito de que sus exigentes usuarios se sientan muy satisfechos y contentos con los resultados que obtienen.En esta oportunidad doña Eulalia desea obtener un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima (madera) y así cumplir poco a poco sus metas propuestas.Eulalia espera contar con tu apoyo, no la defraude.

loans.use: To purchase high quality wholesale materials (lumber).  (Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de materia prima.)

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S., 41, works selling clothes in front of a garment factory to plenty of garment workers passing by. She can typically make on average around $5 each day of profit.

Her husband, meanwhile, is employed as a policeman and makes around $8 each day. She lives with her husband, four children and her elderly mother in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. One of her children is employed as an accountant, another one is a teacher, and the rest stay at home.

Chea S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: to expand her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Nuvith

texts.es:
Nuvith is a member of the community bank "Honestidad y Trabajo" (trans: Honesty and Work). She lives in the city of Saint Martin in the province of Mariscal Caceres in the Juanjui district. She runs her business from her own home, located in Jiron Tomas Villacorta No. 241. This is the location where she runs her small grocery store, although she also sells cosmetics, eye-wear, and eggs, wholesale.

With her constant hard work and dedication she has managed to establish her grocery store, and she has installed wooden shelving, and glass cases to better serve her clients.

With the loan of $450, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase rice and sugar in 50kg bags, pastas, cooking oil, milk and canned goods, and sweets. She will also purchase another glass case, a table and 4 plastic chairs.

Nuvith is 32 years old, and is a single mother to a girl and a boy. She is very active and is solely responsible for herself, these are the virtues athat are helping her make every day a success and helping her raise her children. In the future she plans of installing a public telephone.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nuvith es socia del banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Tomás Villacorta Nº 241, lugar donde posee una bodega y vende abarrotes en general, lo cual combina con la venta de cosméticos, lencería fina y últimamente huevos al por mayor.

Gracias a su constante esmero y dedicación ha logrado ir implementando la bodega, con andamios de madera y vitrinas de vidrio para así dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos de 50kg, fideos, aceite, leche y conservas enlatadas en cajas, variedad de golosinas, también confeccionará otra vitrina de vidrio, una mesa y 4 sillas de plástico.

Nuvith tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de una niña y un niño, es muy activa, responsable y segura de si misma, virtudes que la están ayudando a salir cada día adelante y concretando sus sueños, en el futuro piensa instalar un locutorio telefónico.

loans.use: Buy grocery goods (rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seafood wholesale

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom S. makes around $1.33 per day breeding pigs. Her husband is a staff member of Hallo Trust which is an international organization and makes $6.66 a day. S. lives with their five children in Trapeang Trom Village, Siem Reap Province.  S. seeks a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike, which will dramatically reduce the family's traveling expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use in family

loans.name: Norma Iliana

texts.es:
Norma has been selling cosmetics for four years because she needed to help her husband with household expenses. Besides that, she has an eleven-month-old son and needs to spend as much time as possible at home so she makes sales to her family and friends. Her husband’s name is Francisco Javier Hernández Saldaña; he works in a company and they have three children – 12, 10 and 11 months, all boys.

Now she needs a loan for US$500, which she plans to repay in six months, to purchase merchandise and deliver some orders. With your help Norma will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma tiene 4 años dedicandose a las ventas de cosmeticos, porque necesitaba ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa ademas tiene un niño de 11 meses y necesita estar el mas tiempo posible en su casa asi que las ventas las hace con su familia y amigos. Su esposo se llama Francisco Javier Hernandez Saldaña trabaja en una empresa y tienen 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 11 meses, son niños.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y entregar algunos pedidos. Con tu ayuda Norma hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San T., 40, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. Since 2003 she has earned a living selling chickens and can make up to $10/day in sales revenue. Her husband operates a small drink stand from their house. The couple has two children who help their parents’ businesses after school.

San is now seeking to boost her family’s drinks business. She would like to borrow $1,200 to increase their variety and depth of inventory so that her husband can improve business.

loans.use: San would like to purchase more drinks to sell from home.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta is 38 years old, with two school aged daughter. Her husband is an auto body worker and she worked as an artisan (production of tablecloths of ahopo and crochet, which are typical weavings of Paraguay) for more than fifteen years.

She learned this valuable profession from her mother as a young child as this activity was an important source of income for her family. She is a very hard-working person and encourages entrepeurism in her neighborhood, encouraging her neighbors to work for themselves. She wishes to continue growing as an artisan and to be able to export in the future.

With the loan she will buy fabrics and threads.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mirta tiene 38 años de edad, con dos hijas en edad escolar, su esposo es chapista y ella se dedica a la artesanía (elaboración de manteles de ahopo·i y crochet, que son tejidos tipicos de Paraguay) hace mas de quince años.

Esta valiosa profesión la aprendió de su madre desde muy jovencita, siendo esta actividad una fuente importante de ingreso económico para su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y fomenta el emprendedurismo en su barrio, alentando a sus vecinas a trabajar por cuenta propia. Anhela con seguir creciendo como artesana y poder llegar a exportar más adelante.

Con el crèdito comprarà hilos y tela.

loans.use: Operating capital (purchase of threads and fabrics)

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam N. lives in Hang Chhouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province where she is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Mr. Phin Eing, is a construction worker and farmer. Unfortunately, his field is infertile, so Mrs. N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. 

Mrs. Sam N. is 31 and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her husband's field

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva López, tiene  61 años de edad, es viuda y  tiene 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Doña Elva nos mencionó que para poder empezar su negocio, por los años 1988 aproximadamente, su marido aún en vida, plantaba algodón y con sus ganancias pudo montar dicho negocio.
Gracias a esta actividad logró que sus hijos sean  todos unos profesionales, ambos docentes.
En la actualidad es una de las despensas con mayor movimiento en la zona por la que es una de las más antiguas y con clientela formada.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un congelador, ya que está empezando la temporada de calor y necesita para que sus bebidas estén bien frescas, porque en nuestro país el calor es bastante fuerte, llegando a alcanzar temperaturas de 38º C muchas veces.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elva López, 61 years old, is a widow and has 2 grown children. Elva tells us that in order to begin her business around 1988, when her husband was still alive, she planted cotton and with her earnings she was able to start her current business. Thanks to this business she was able to ensure that her children would be professionals, and both are teachers today. Today her convenience store is one of the busiest in the neighborhood as it is one of the oldest and has a good customer base. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator, as the hot season is beginning and she needs to keep her beverages well-chilled, because in our country the heat is rather strong, frequently reaching temperatures of 38º C.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator and merchandise (rice, sugar, tea, baked goods, etc.)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 56 años D. edad, no tiene estudios, es casada y madre D. 04 hijos (dos varones y dos mujeres, todos con familia). Vive en la Parcialidad D. Phorque, distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Pardo D. Bellido” en Conduriri.

En un inicio obtuvo el crédito D. S/.300, con el que compró cuero y fibra D. alpaca D. primera calidad para hilar y vender a los intermediarios D. Conduriri. DesD. niña se dedica al engorD. D. alpacas, llamas y ovinos. En la actualidad, paralelo a su hilado, se dedica a vender carne D. alpaca que entrega a los mayoristas en Ilave y Conduriri D. 02 a 04 degollados semanalmente.

Con este crédito D. S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 alpacas con S/.240, 10 libras D. fibra D. alpaca con S/.100 y con el saldo comprará cueros D. alpaca y D. ovino.  

Su sueño es criar alpacas mejoradas.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old and she never attended school. She is married and has 4 children (two sons and two daugthters, all of whom have their own family). She lives in Parcialidad D. Phorque in the district of Conduiri, within the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Maria Pardo D. Bellido" in Conduiri.

At the start she obtained a loan in the amount of S/.300 with which she purchased leather and high quality alpaca wool to spin into yarn for producers in Conduiri. Since she was a girl she has been raising alpacas, llamas and pork. Currently, in parallel to yarn production, she sells alpaca meat to wholesales in llave and Conduiri, usually from 2 to 4 heads of livestock weekly.

With this loan, amounting to S/.500 which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 2 alpacas at S/.240 each and 10 pounds of wool with S/.100. With her earnings she will purchase alpaca leather.

Her dream is to be able to raise more alpacas, yielding better quality.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 alpacas, alpaca woold and leather.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is a 45-year-old man who lives with in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Issam has been working as a blacksmith for 25 years. He requested a loan of $1200 from Al Majmoua to buy an electric generator. 

Issam builds iron doors and windows for homes. He is known for the  good quality of his work and his low prices. His clients are his friends and others.
 
When he first started his business, he faced some difficulties because he inherited the business from his father who left him with debts. Therefore, Issam had to reimburse accumulated business debt from his father. In the beginning, if Issam choose to start this business, it was in order to improve his financial situation. His future view is to expand his business.

loans.use: Issam needs the loan to purchase an electric generator

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Phách năm nay 50 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại xã Cao Minh thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Năm 1997 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tìnhthương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài chăn  nuôi gia đình chị còn đầu tư mở xưởng mộc chuyên sản xuất và bán các lại đồ gia đụng. Bên cạnh đó  để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình  chồng chị  còn làm thêm nghề xe ôm. Vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn ổn định ở mức 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm gỗ đầu tư cho xưởng mộc
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi P. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and two children at the village of Phuc Yen in the town of Cao Minh, Vinh Phuc province. She joined TYM Fund in 1997 to borrow fund for investing in raising livestock. Currently, besides her livestock business, she also invests in a factory specializing in producing household utensils. In order to increase her income, her husband also works as a motorbike cabbie (Instead of a car, motorbike cabbies takes passengers on motorbikes for fares). Her family's income is at a stable 6,000,000 Vietnamese dollars per month. Sheb wishes to borrow 10,000,000 Vietnamese dollars (600 USD) to buy additional lumber for her factory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A., 34, is married and the mother of four children.  Currently, all of her children are in school.  For three years, Diana has been a food vendor in a community school within the village of Agogo, where she lives with her family.  

She sells ‘ampesi’ and rice with stew; this food is mostly purchased by school children during their break time.  Ampesi is cooked and enjoyed with any kind of stew. Diana says the demand for her food has grown, extending outside of the school to the people in the community.  After she closes in the morning, she prepares more ampesi in the afternoon and sells it in the community market.  

Diana wants to use the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal and among others.  She is convinced that this loan will increase her stock; in the event of price hike, she will still be able to cook food.  Diana wants to use the proceeds to supports her children's education.  She says she is grateful for your assistance.  It has always been her dream to add the sale of soft drinks to her existing business, so that she can make additional income to support her husband in taking care of the children.

loans.use: Diana needs your assistance to buy food stuffs like yam, plantain, bags of rice, meat, fish, spices and charcoal etc.

loans.name: Leub

texts.en: Leub P., 48, is a widow who resides in Battambang province, Cambodia. She makes and sells rice cake. She walks with her cake and sells it from house-to-house to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 per day. She is also supported by four of her children who work as local doctors, a garment worker and a goldsmith. Mrs. Leub P. is asking for a loan to purchase medicines for her two children who work as local doctors to sell.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for sale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam N., 64, is a cow dealer who lives with his wife and two school-aged children in Bati, Takeo province. He purchases and re-sells cows to earn a living and is able to make US$ 6 in revenue a day. His wife is a good housewife who stays at home, cooking for her family members. Mr. Sam N. would like to take out a loan to purchase more cows to re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase cows for re-sale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
“I cannot do everything but I can do something” is a quotation Julieta B. thinks of every time she encounters problems and trials in life. She is already a widow and left with three children: Judith, Jeremy, and Jhon Loui. The eldest is a high-school graduate, the second is in his senior year in high school, and the youngest is in grade school. She and her children are living a happy life in the village of Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya.

Julieta manages a village store located in front of their house. Aside from her store, she also manages their farm for extra income. Her farm products include vegetables and other root crops. Her income from her businesses is being used to meet the needs of their family and to send her children to school. She is planning to improve her business but she lacks capital. With determination to succeed in the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP6,000.00 that she can use as business capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew M. is fifty years old. He is married with three children. One of them is out of school and currently working. Two of them are in the senior-high school. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Andrew is hardworking man. He is a trader and deals in cosmetics. Andrew procures cosmetics such as body sprays, powder, creams, etc., and hawks to sell in the community he lives in. He also treks to other markets to sell on the market days.

Andrew has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure a variety of cosmetics in bulk. Andrews is hoping to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Sulemana

texts.en:
Sulemana M. is thirty-nine years old, but his face looks younger. He is married and a father with four children. He lives at Takroase, a mining community at Akim Oda, in the eastern region of Ghana. Sulemana is very resourceful and committed to his family, especially in the area of their education. He is a buyer and seller of gold and diamonds. He makes a living with this business and has worked in the field of mining for fifteen years. He has many suppliers in the village from whom he purchases the gold and the diamonds. Through the relationship he has with the suppliers, he always has stock to sell. He mostly deals with foreigners who come from abroad to buy his gold and diamonds.

Ghana is rich in natural resources. It is a fact that the quality of diamonds and gold from Ghana is rated as one of the best as compared to other countries. This has created increased demand from his buyers, but he is not able to meet those demands. He buys the gold and diamonds at high prices from the suppliers, but, because of the economic situation he now finds himself in, he is not able to buy more. He is requesting loan support to buy more gold and diamonds to supply his exclusive customers. He was thinking about forming a partnership so that he could buy more, but there are none to find. Sulemana has a diamond in his palm in this picture. He would be grateful for your support. He belongs to the village bank called Divine.

loans.use: To buy gold and diamonds to resell.

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Trần Thị Tú is a 52-year-old female married mother of three adult children.  She lives in the town of Kim Động.  Tú owns a business providing food services to local community members and she has been doing this for over 18 years.  Tú earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from her business.

Tú joined TYM Fund in 2003 to secure a loan to help grow her business and improve her living situation.  The loan helped to expand her business and she successfully paid it back.  Now Tú is requesting her 6th loan from TYM Fund, in the amount of 10000000 VND, to purchase a transport vehicle for her business.  Tú hopes this will help th grow her business and improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle for her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles S. is married and has 5 dependents. He has received schooling through Junior High. Charles sells boutique materials at Kotokraba, which he has done since 2007. His wife is a petty trader.

Charles uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. Charles will use the loan to purchase more boutique materials to resell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Charles plans to reinvest.

loans.use: purchase more boutique materials to resell

loans.name: Karomatullo

texts.ru: Косимов Кароматулло проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Один сын находится на заработках в России. Кароматулло 5 лет работал учителем. Теперь он производит лепешки для продажи. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить сырье для производства.
texts.en:
Karomatullo K. lives in Kurgan-Tube region. He is 43 years old, married, and has five children. One of his sons lives and works in Russia to support the family back home. Karomatullo worked for five years as a teacher, and now he makes bread which he sells. He is requesting a loan to purchase the ingredients for his bread.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech E., 26, lives in SiE. Reap Province, where she earns her daily income by selling a few vegetables in the local market. She also plants a variety of crops on the land next to her house, while her husband works with her in growing crops. They have been married for a year but have no children. Pech E. hopes to earn additional profit by using a loan from Kiva to build a store in her home where she will sell a few groceries for her neighbors.

loans.use: To build a store in her home where she will sell groceries to neighbors

loans.name: Raji

texts.en: Raji is 52 years old and married with 6 children. He sells engine oil and electrical materials. He is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. He says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
Indira Burić is a 41-year-old women who comes from the town of Banovići. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is employed in a local company.

Indira has a stand at the local market where she sells shoes. She did that part time when she was employed in a factory as a tailor. Then she decided to extend that business at the market and do just that. Besides that, she does embroidery as a hobby and for orders.

Indira requested her first loan from WWI (Žene za Žene International) for 1,500 KM to invest in her shoe business and in her embroidery hobby.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell and materials for her embroidery hobby

loans.name: Grupo Solidario G.m.s Group

texts.es: La Señora Flor de Maria García P. es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 45 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Su compañera Maria Ignacia García M. se dedica a la venta de pelibuey juntas conforman el Grupo Solidario G.M.S ellas son mujeres que trabajan muy duro para proporcionarle a sus familias lo necesario. A pesar de las dificultades de Maria como fue el poco espacio que tenía en su vivienda para tener a sus animales, pero esto no le impidió salir adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos de los diferentes productos. El sueño de ambas es que sus negocios sigan adelante.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria García P. is a very hard working woman. She is 45, and she sells clothes. Her colleague, Maria Ignacia García M., sells pelibuey sheep. Together they form the G.M.S. United Group. They are women who work very hard to give their family the necessities. In spite of the difficulties Maria had, like the small space for her animals at her house, she did not let this keep her from getting ahead with her business. The loan they are asking for is for working capital to buy different products. They both dream that there businesses keep going forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nymph

texts.en:
Nymph C. lives in the village of  Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 37 years old, single and has two school-aged children. She makes a living selling clothes to people in her community. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Nymph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from HSPFI. She used each of them to buy more inventory to sell, and will use this latest loan for the same purpose. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a young, single man who he lives in the city of Bethlehem. He didn't finish his university course because he began work as a taxi driver to help his mother and young brothers and sisters. The family economic status is very bad and Hasan has to work very hard to help his young brothers and sisters finish school. His work is the only source of income.

Hasan needs the loan to pay for insurance and registration fees in addition to doing some maintenance on his the car. He appears in the photo beside his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for taxi registration, insurance fees and maintenance

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
H. Karomat is 47 is years old. She is widow and mother of three children. Karomat is working hard to ensure the best future for her children. Karomat has been running her own small business for 12 years already. She has a place in the central local market for selling foodstuff such as sugar, tea, sweets, eggs and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. The business is stable that allows her to improve the level of living condition of her family. Now Karomat needs a loan of 10000 Somoni for increasing the range of her selling goods. Karomat and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Salud

texts.en: Salud M. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 83 years old, is widowed, and has three adult children. Salud assists in a family business running a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. In 2009, Salud joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for house repair. Salud is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used for completion of her house repairs. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for completion of her house repairs

loans.name: His Grace Group

texts.en:
Marie H. is the leader of a five-member loan group called "His Grace." She is 50 years old and married. She has five children, ages 8 to 28 years old. Their educational levels range from 3rd grade to a sophomore college student. She is also responsible for two of her nieces. She is a professional nurse who decided to start a business. Marie and her family live and work in the Barnesville Estate, which is north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Marie sells farina, a local Liberian food that is made from cassava. She also makes soap. She buys the farina and the chemicals to make soap from wholesalers and sell them retail to residents of Barnesville Estate. She has been running this business for 4 years and hopes to improve it by establishing branches around Monrovia.

Marie talks to her customers politely and sells at affordable prices in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business. She started her business with LD$160.00 which was given to her by her husband. She needs this loan to purchase more charcoal and chemicals to produce more soap so she can serve her customers. Marie dreams of giving her children better education and helping family members who are in need.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and chemicals for her soap-making business

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
La señora LIGIA MARIA S. A. tiene a su cargo sus dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar, ella es madre soltera, ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante seis años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 7 créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que reside, con el fin de darle un mejor estilo de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Señora Ligia Maria S. A. cares for her two children who are school-aged. She is a single mother and has worked with Ceprodel for six years. In this time, she has managed to improve her living conditions with the seven credits she has had with them. She will invest the requested credit in the purchase of construction materials to replace the roof on her home where she lives. Her goal is to give her family a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to replace the roof on the house where she lives

loans.name: El Pari Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "El Pari" están representado por la señora Beatriz y conformada por 14 miembros  que van ingresando a su tercer ciclo juntos demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos sin escatimar esfuerzos por sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios D. venta D.  comida, cosméticos, verduras, productos lácteos, ropa celulares, elaboración y venta D. pan y al transporte publico D. pasajeros.  En cuanto a la competencia siempre a existido en el mercado es por esta razón que la socias siempre están pendientes D. ella y D. lo productos mas competitivos para adquirirlos y poder generar una mejor ganancia para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería para la época naviD.ña que es cuando hay mayor demanda D. productos y cuando se pueD. generar mayores ganancias.  En cuanto a la experiencia las socias ya la tienen debido a que van ingresando a su tercer ciclo como grupo solidario y saben bien el manejo D. los fondos y asumir la responsabilidad D. cada inversión que realizan para seguir creciendo y fortaleciendo sus negocios para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “El Pari” are led by Sra. Beatriz. The group consists of 14 members who are starting their third loan cycle together. They have demonstrated honesty and responsibility with their payments. Without wasting any effort, the members strive to succeed in their small businesses selling food, cosmetics, vegetables, dairy products, clothing, mobile phones, bread, or transportation services. There is always competition in the market, so the members rely on one another to acquire products that will make them more competitive so that they can generate better earnings to support their families.

This loan will be used to acquire merchandise for the Christmas season when demand for products is higher and there is greater opportunity for generating better revenues. The members are already experienced since they are starting their third loan cycle as a solidarity group. They know how to manage their funds well and take responsibility for each of their investments, which will help grow and strengthen their businesses and proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 50 años, es una madre abnegada y perseverante y comparte su vida con su esposo Emilian y sus hijos Kenji de 18, Carol de 11 y Jahir de 2 años.  Desde hace 9 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, actividad que realiza durante el día, dándose tiempo solo para las labores del hogar y para su pequeño hijo Jahir quien muchas veces la acompaña a visitar a sus clientes, en donde ofrece la variedad de productos que tiene y otras en catalogo. A Teresa le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite disponer de sus horarios para el trabajo sin descuidar su hogar, pero gracias a su esposo que la apoya en todo y juntos esperan salir adelante en bienestar de sus hijos. En el futuro Teresa y su esposo esperan tener un negocio más estable en su propia casa, pero por ahora les va muy bien en la manera que hasta el momento trabajan. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y siempre se le ha considerado una persona muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza para tener en stock, ya que solicitan muchos productos en esta temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Teresa is 50 years old and is a virtuous and perseverant mother and she shares her life with her husband Emilian, and their children Kenji 18, Carol who is 11 and Jahir who is 2 years old. For some 9 years she has sold cosmetics, an activity that she does during the day and it gives her some time for housework and for her youngest son, Jahir, who many times accompanies her to visit her customers where she offers them products that she has and others by catalogue. Teresa enjoys her job very much since it allows her to have her own schedule and it doesn’t interfere with her housework. In the future, Teresa and her husband both hope to get ahead in life for the benefit of their children. Both hope to have a more stable business in their own home but for now they are doing very well in their respective jobs. This would be their fifth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and they have always considered her to be a very punctual person with the payments of loan quotas. With the loan, she will buy more beauty products to have in stock, since they need more products in this holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johanna del Carmen P. O. de 31 años desde hace tiempo vende  zapatos producto que comercializa de manera ambulante. Ella asegura que desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar y buscar la manera de salir adelante.  

P. viaja continuamente a Masaya para comprar su mercadería ya que parte de sus productos son nacionales debido a que son más económicos. Pero también comercializa otros tipos de zapatos más comerciales y de marca los cuales compra en el mercado Oriental.
texts.en:
Johanna del Carmen P. O. is 31 years old and she has been selling shoes for a while as a street vendor. She affirms that from a very young age she learned to work and find ways to get ahead in life. P. travels frequently to Masaya to buy her merchandise since some of her products are national products because they are more economical. She also sells other types of shoes, more marketable with brand-names which she buys at the Oriental market.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes L. is from the village of Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is 68 years old. Gertrudes is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Gertrudes owns and operates a retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, as well as snacks, candies, noodles, eggs and so on in the local community.  Gertrudes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $66 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gertrudes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Gertrudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gertrudes is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used for workers' wages. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay workers' wages

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 51 years old, married with one son, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband.  To supply additional income for her family, Mercedita has been buying and selling fish for almost fifteen years. Her husband, Marceliano, is also involved in the fish-selling business and works closely with Mercedita in Rizal.

Mercedita would like to receive a loan to purchase additional supplies for her business, including a fish cage, bamboo, netting, and bait.  Mercedita believes these purchases will increase her fish inventory and drive increased monthly revenue.  A proud member since 1999 of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines, Mercedita has been a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her long term goals are to maintain the profitability of her business, invest in a new home, and support the education of her son.  She hopes that he will have children one day so she can support the college education of her grandchildren.  

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business including a fish cage, bamboo, net, and bait.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou D. est un menuisier ébéniste de 48 ans. Il habite au plan Diakhaye une cite avoisinante de la localité de Baye Laye Guediawaye. C’est en mai 2009 qu’il a adhéré à la caisse de l’U-IMCEC  à Baye Laye. Monsieur D. exerce cette activité de menuisier ébéniste  depuis 1969. Il expose ses réalisations  et travaille sur commande. C’est un métier qu’il a choisi par amour et qu’il a choisi parmi tant d’autres. De par son aspect lucratif c’est pendant les veilles de fêtes  que son activité devient plus intéressante car il y’a beaucoup de commande en cette période. Mais en période d’hivernage le bois se fait rare. Par conséquent il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de bois pour faire des lits et d’autres meubles qu’il va revendre. Le crédit lui permet d’étendre sa capacité  de travail et d’augmenter ses profits. Dans ce cas il a la possibilité de mieux subvenir a ses besoins et aux besoins de sa famille. Il est marie et père de 8 enfants dont l’âge varie entre  3 et 30 ans.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou D. is a 48 year old cabinet maker. He lives on the plateau of Diakhaye, a neighboring town to the village of Baye Laye Guediawaye. In May 2009 he joined the U-IMCEC savings bank in Baye Laye. Mr. D. has been carrying out his cabinet-making business since 1969. He puts his creations on display and works to order. It is a profession he has chosen out of love and one out of so many that he could have chosen. From a profitability point of view, his business is particularly interesting during the run up to festivals, because there are a lot of orders during this period. However, during the winter period wood is rare. Consequently he is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used to buy wood in order to make beds and other furniture that he will sell. The loan will allow him to increase both his work capacity and his profits. As such, he will be able to provide better for his needs and those of his family. He is married and has eight children, the ages of whom range from three to 30 years.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 62 años, es un hombre correcto, espontáneo y muy emprendedor. Casado con Ana, de 52 años, y juntos tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos y juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 45 años que se dedica a la agricultura, pues le gusta sembrar todo tipo de verduras, pues cuenta con terrenos en donde cultiva y cosecha hortalizas, comercializándolos cada dos meses en los mercados de sus ciudad, obteniendo mayores ingresos económicos, permitiéndole adquirir bienes, y sobre todo poder cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos, quienes ya son profesionales y eso le llena de mucho orgullo. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos. En adelante piensa mejorar la construcción de su vivienda y reabrir dos tiendas para la venta de comestibles que algún tiempo las tuvo que cerrar por falta de tiempo. Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, y por tanto espera concretar sus planes y mejorar su vivienda. Siendo una persona responsable y puntual dentro de su grupo comunal, le agrada motivar a cada uno de ellos para emprender actividades que los beneficie. Entretanto solicita, mil quinientos nuevos soles para comprar bolsas de semilla de maíz y alverja, así como latas de semillas de lechuga y espinaca, además de productos químicos para proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 62, is a dignified, spontaneous and very enterprising man. He is married to Ana, 52, and they have three children, only one of whom still lives with them him in their own home. He has been a farmer for the last 45 years because he likes to plant all kinds of vegetables; he has fields where he grows and harvests vegetables. He sells them every two months in the city’s markets where he gets higher profits that make it possible for him to acquire assets and, above all, pay for his children’s educational expenses; they are all professionals now and this fills him with much pride. Alongside the farming, he also buys and sells automobiles. In the future, he plans to make some home improvements and reopen two grocery stores that he had to close a while back due to lack of time. This is his 10th loan with MFP and he hopes to finalize his plans and improve his home. He is a responsible and punctual person within his group and he enjoys motivating each one of them to undertake activities that will benefit them. In the meantime, he is asking for 1500 new soles to buy sacks of corn and pea seed, cans of lettuce and spinach seed as well as chemical products to protect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, pea, lettuce and spinach seed as well as chemical products to protect his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
A. Dilorom is 43 years old. She is married and the loving mother to 4 children. Dilorom owns a successful clothing sales business at the market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 11 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and the constant demand for her products. Dilorom tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. Dilorom has requested a loan of $1500 USD to increase her product inventory. By purchasing additional inventory, Dilorom will be better prepared to meet increased demand and to earn a good income. We believe that her perseverance, hard work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Sapalleda

texts.en:
A. R. Sapalleda is from the town of Brgy.Uno, Katipunan. She is 45 years old and married with 4 school-age children.

To make a living, A. sells ice cream and seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. A. is just starting this business.

A. joined PMPC in 2007 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her sixth loan, for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's living conditions and to educate her children.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 41 years old, married, and has four children aged between 9 months and 17 years old. Two of the children currently attend school.
Esther is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been practising mixed farming for 12 years and has managed to employ 8 people on a casual basis. Her main products are bananas, milk, vegetables, maize and millet, all of which she sells to the local market. She also operates a retail shop in the same area.
Esther's major challenges in farming are exploitation by middlemen who buy at very low prices, lack of proper means of transport, and lack of storage facilities for her cereals. She has requested this loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 50,000 KES to purchase more cereals for sale. She intends to use part of this loan to expand her retail shop. The extra income from this loan will enable her to educate her children and build a house that will be an asset to the family. She appreciates the help given by Juhudi and requests more funding and training on business management.

loans.use: To restock her cereals shop

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 31 years old and her children are 12, 9 and 7 years old. She sells charcoal, both wholesale and retail, and has been running this business since 2001.  Her husband buys overstock items, such as shoes and clothing, and sells them in the market.  With this loan, Odette hopes to buy a bigger piece of land from which she will get trees to burn and have charcoal.  With the profits, she hopes to renovate her house.

About the bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy land with trees to burn to make charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the floor of his house

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 6 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans, 2 enfants et  vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, CHATA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 Ha d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17000FCFA environs  en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women, who are on the average 42 years old, have two children, and live mainly in polygamous families in Zambougou, a village in the Diola Prefecture, Kolikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their activities at the beginning of the winter season. They cultivate peanuts, millet, corn and beans, among others. They are now on their first agricultural loan. With this loan, Chata D. plans to purchase agricultural inputs before the prices go up as well as buy small tools and pay for the labor to work a peanut field approximately 1 hectare (about 2.5 acres) in size. The produce is sold in the town of Fana and elsewhere in Diola after the harvest, to a customer base composed of both men and women. At the end of the harvesting, they plan to earn an average income of 17,000 West African Francs each.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding and small tools

loans.name: Determiners Group

texts.en:
Samuel G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Determiners.

He is 33 years old, married and has four children who are between 6 to 14 years old. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support. Samuel cares for two siblings.   

For five years, he has been selling soap, milk, and batteries in Thinkers Village Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 18,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 90,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of soap, milk, and batteries for his business.  He describes himself as a very kind person. His goal is to improve his business and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Dorithy is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more soap, milk, and batteries for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more radio batteries and toothpaste.

loans.name: Twibumbebahinzi Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 49 years old, married with 5 children who are 5, 7, 8, 12, and 15 years old.  Jacqueline is the leader of a group called 'Twibumbebahinzi'.  Jacqueline and her team are widely known in the business of selling agricultural products.  They have been in this business for a long time and their business hours are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Jacqueline and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  Once given this loan, they will expand the businesses through purchasing different agricultural products.  With these additional agricultural products for sale, they really hope that their sales as well as profits will increase to an extent that they will be able to keep reinvesting in their businesses for a better financial stability.

loans.use: the purchase of different agricultural products

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay Y., 52, is a widow with two children and lives in Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling noodles at the local market. On average, she is able to make about US$ 3 each day. She is also supported by one daughter who is employed as garment factory worker. 

Svay Y.’s daughter spends about US$ 0.50 every day on transportation and this makes her family face difficulties with daily transportation. Seeing this as a difficulty, Mrs. Svay Y. is asking for a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work. (Svay Y. is pictured with her daughter at her home.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Women's Group - Mityana

texts.en: N. Yudaaya, age 24, says she dropped out of school to embark on an agro produce sales business. She is quick to point out that it was not deliberate, but she just became a victim of circumstances. It was a decision that had to be backed up with determination, poise, courage and belief. Prior to that, she was more inclined to sell clothes. She still sells clothes, albeit on a smaller scale. She makes 700,000 shillings monthly. N. has a common cause with the borrowing group called Zibula Atudde in Mityana. With this loan, she wants to buy more cash crops like bananas and Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more cash crops such as bananas and potatoes

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
José tiene 24 años, reside en San Francisco Gotera, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, él es soltero y vive con su padres, este negocio lo tiene desde hace dos años y fue iniciativa propia, la venta normalmente la realiza de las 6:00am a 1:00 pm los clientes llegan a su casa a comprar los pollos.
Él Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mas pollos y concentrado para su crianza y engordarlos para comercializarlos, este préstamo le será muy útil porque los meses que vienen se incrementa la demanda, por lo que ve necesario en este momento de crecer la granja para dar abasto a los clientes cuando estos se acerquen a comprar.
Su objetivo es aumentar en este momento la granja y que sus ventas sean buenas en los meses próximos beneficiándose con mayores ingresos, además quiere contar con el servicio a domicilio para negocios del centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera. He works raising chickens to sell for meat. He is single and lives with his parents. He started this business two years ago on his own initiative. He normally sells his birds from 6:00 AM to 1:00 pm; clients come to his house to purchase the chickens. 

He will use the loan money to purchase more chickens and concentrated feed to fatten them in order to sell them. This loan will be very useful because in the coming months demand increases, which is why now is the time to expand the farm so that he can provide his clients with sufficient product. 

His goal at the moment is to expand his farm and have good sales in the coming months resulting in increased profits. He also hopes to begin offering home delivery service to provide service to businesses in the city.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and concetrate

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. is a 40-year-old landlady in Mikindani, Mombasa, who owns several rental houses. She is married and has additional income from her husband and together, they support three children.

She has been in this business for the last six years and has done great. After being introduced to KADET by a friend, she is now requesting her second loan to open up another business of paraffin selling. She intends to use the anticipated profit to expand her businesses and in the future, she hopes to open boutiques in the town center.

loans.use: To open up another business of paraffin selling

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is married and has three children. She sells cooked rice and beans at Elmina,which she has been doing for ten years. Her husband is a steel bender. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Esi will use the loan to expand her cooking business. She plans to reinvest her additional income back into her business.

loans.use: expand her cooking business

loans.name: Lucila Giralda

texts.es:
Lucila Giralda Z. V. tiene 52 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Lucila se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño construir la casa.
Le gusta salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Lucila Giralda Z. V. is 52 years. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and children. She lives in the Ventanas community in the province of Los Ríos. She has three children.
 
Members of the VRC LA UNION group, located in the Aguas Frías area in the Ventanas community, work in short-cycle farming, sowing corn, rice and beans. They have been working at this for a long time. 

Lucila has worked in farming for 15 years, specifically in sowing corn, rice and beans. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them at the Ventanas fair in the same area.

She is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops. With the support of this loan, she would have financial help with meeting her basic needs. There are challenges to be faced such as pests and diseases and the changes in climate. It is her dream to build her own home.
She likes to go out with her family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El Sr. Walter M. recibe en Asunción es soltero y sin hijos. 
Se dedica específicamente a atender su negocio que es un cyber y alquiler de videojuegos, empezó con el negocio en el año 2007, contando con 2 computadoras para alquilar. 
A medida que corría el tiempo y en vista a que su clientela iba aumentando tuvo que ir invirtiendo más en el negocio y comprando mas maquinas. 
Fue así que acudió a nuestra institución y accedió a los créditos. El crédito actual es para la compra de un Televisor color tipo Plasma de 32”.
Vale la pena destacar que ha crecido mucho comercialmente, con ayuda de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Walter M. lives in Asunción.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He works in his business which is an Internet café and videogame rental store.  He set up his business in 2007 with two computers that he rented out.

Over time, and seeing that his customer base was increasing, he had to invest more in his business and buy more machines.  This is why he came to our institution and got access to loans.  His current loan will be used to buy a 32” Plasma color television.

We must point out that Walter has grown a lot as a businessman with Fundación Paraguaya's help.

loans.use: To buy a plasma TV

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María C. González tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo,  en una zona de Alajuela que ha sido apoyada por instituciones como el Instituto Mixto de Ayuda Social, para mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas. Hace 7 años y por iniciativa propia, comenzó en el comercio vendiendo ropa y otros artículos, con el lapso de los años y gracias al esfuerzo de ella ha crecido, atendiendo otras necesidades de sus clientes, incursionando en la compra de electrodomésticos traídos desde el puerto libre de Golfito. 

Su principal prioridad es apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio; al mismo tiempo ella está llevando los cursos para obtener su título de  la secundaria a distancia; acaba de aprobar el sétimo año. Esto le ha ayudado a mejorar en su negocio y espera en el corto plazo obtener el bachillerato. Este es su primer crédito y llegó a  Fundación Mujer por referencia de una amiga que escuchó la información  en un programa de radio.

Ella inició su actividad con un préstamo por 25000 colones que su tía le otorgó. Con este adquirió   ropa intima y así inició su negocio. Le ha ido dando vuelta al capital y diversificando su oferta de productos a sus clientes, actualmente realiza ventas por catálogo y va a Golfito a comprar electrodomésticos, los cuales vende a pagos.

 Una vez realizado el estudio de crédito y verificado las diferentes actividades a las que se dedica la clienta  demuestra la capacidad  para cubrir la cuota en el plazo establecido. Además con esta inversión se va a ir a Panamá donde se va a comprar mercadería (ropa principalmente) a un muy buen precio, fortaleciendo así su capital de trabajo para sus otras actividades.

 La clienta tiene un pequeño local en su casa en donde mantiene un pequeño inventario de productos y atiende por las mañanas, después de haber enviado a sus hijos a la escuela, por las tardes realiza exhibiciones en localidades cercanas lo que le ha ayudado a aumentar su clientela, brinda facilidades de pago. Es una actividad que apoya los ingresos del hogar que se complementan con el trabajo de su esposo. Por las noches se dedica a estudiar.
texts.en:
María C. González is 28 years old.  She lives with her two children and her husband in an area of Alajuela that has been supported by institutions such as the 'Instituto Mixto de Ayuda Social' with the goal of improving residents' quality of life.  Seven years ago, under her own initiative, María set up her business selling clothes and other articles.  Over the years and thanks to her own hard work, she has grown in her business, meeting other needs of her customers, buying electrical appliances from Golfito free port.

María's main priority is to support her children in their studies.  At the same time, María herself is taking some distance-learning courses so that she can finish her high school education.  She has just passed her seventh year.  This has helped her to improve her business and she hopes, in the short term, that she will be able to obtain her high school diploma.  This is María's first loan.  A friend recommended that she approach Fundación Mujer when she heard about the institution on a radio program.

María started her business with a loan of 25,000 colones that she received from her aunt.  With this money she bought underwear and set up her business.  Her capital has gone around and she has diversified the range of products that she offers to her customers.  She currently makes catalog sales and travels to Golfito to buy electrical appliances which she sells on credit.

We have performed a credit report on the client and verified the different business activities that she carries out.  She shows the ability to make her repayments on time.  She is also planning to use her loan money to travel to Panama where she will buy merchandise (mainly clothes) at a very good price, thereby strengthening her working capital for other activities.

María has small premises in her home where she keeps a small inventory of products.  She works there in the mornings after having got her children ready for school.  In the afternoons, she displays her products in nearby towns which has helped her to increase her customer base.  She provides her customers with credit facilities.  María's activities support her household financially, together with the money her husband makes from his work.  In the evenings, María studies

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Dorene

texts.en:
Dorene A. is 42 years old, married to Dominic and they have three children. Dominic is a jua kali person and he helps cater for the family needs.

Dorene has a grocery store that she has been running for the last 15 years.
