She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD and plans to use the money to buy bananas, vegetables, onions and tomatoes to add to her stock. Her mothly income is KES 20,000. She will use the profits made to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to own a house and stop paying rent.

loans.use: To buy bananas, vegetables, onions and tomatoes to add to her stock

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es transportista publico, tiene  un taxi con el que trabaja. Tiene dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad.
Vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz en su casa propia.
El crédito lo utilizará para pagar el costo de mantenimiento de su vehiculo y la compra de un motor para su taxi.
 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva. El análisis socio-económico lo califica como sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Alfredo works in public transportation and has a taxi with which he works. He has two children who are 10 and 6 years old. He lives in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz in a house that he owns.

The loan will be used to pay the cost of maintenance for his vehicle and for the purchase of a motor for his taxi.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and through Kiva. The socio-economic evaluation completed qualifies him as a loan recipient.

loans.use: To purchase a motor and for maintenance for his taxi

loans.name: Félix Humberto

texts.es: El  Sr M.   labora como conductor es casado tiene cuatro persona a su cargo, es el cuarto crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece las oportunidad que  le han brindado por que así a podido realizar mejora de su vivienda, deuda que tenia con otras instituciones por los interese que  era muy alto ,con este  desembolso lo utilizare para solventa deuda
texts.en: Mr. M. has worked as a driver. He is married and has four people in charge. This is the fourth loan granted by CEPRODEL, and he appreciates the opportunity they have given him to be able to improve his home. The debt he had with other institutions had very high interests. He will use this loan to settle the other debts.

loans.use: He needs to consolidate his debts and make home improvements.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto D. Sr. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 58 years old. Norberto is married and has a 15-year-old child. To make a living, Norberto owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Norberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norberto has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Norberto is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his familiy's house.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Renee

texts.es: Renee tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo, con una de sus hijos y su nieto en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años instaló en su misma casa su tienda de abarrotes que le permite comercializar todos los días, su hija la ayuda en la atención cuando sale de su casa en busca de más mercadería. Siempre esta al tanto de los productos que tiene y que le falta, por lo que esta en constante contacto con sus proveedores. La amabilidad que tiene para atender a sus clientes, y ellos con gusto acuden siempre a su establecimiento, esto influye significativamente en sus ventas por lo que ha decidido incrementar la cantidad de productos que tiene. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en: Renee is 46-years-old and lives with her husband, one of her children, and her grandson in her own home.  More than two years ago she put a grocery store in her house that allows her make sales every day.  Her daughter helps her by watching the store when she leaves the house to look for more merchandise.  She always keeps track of which products she has and which she needs and is in constant contact with her suppliers.  She is very friendly with her customers and they are happy to always shop in her establishment.  This has a significant impact on her sales and is why she has decided to increase the quantity of products that she has.  This is her third credit with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support and has shown that she is responsible with her payments.  Also, she is thankful to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and united.  She thanks those people who invest in the loans and says it will be very helpful to her as her business moves forward.  With the loan that she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase more products to stock her store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene N. is a married woman with five children who all attend school. For the past six years she has operated an open-air food stall. She sells such food as cooked beans, chapati and rice. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby.

Irene decided to work with Yehu Microfinance because of its responsiveness to customer needs. She is requesting a second Kiva loan of 60,000 KES to increase her stock of food to sell, such as sacks of maize flour, rice, wheat flour, coconuts and charcoal. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming a big supplier in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize flour, rice, wheat flour, coconuts and charcoal

loans.name: Tayo Enole

texts.en:
Tayo Enole N., aged 33, is a married woman having four children who are schooling. She has been in the agriculture industry for the last seven years. She has good credit history with KADET. 


This will be her third loan with KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase farm inputs. She hopes to generate an income from the loan which would be used to educate her children.


She hopes in future she will live a better life and hopes to see her children prosper.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  5 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y los otros dos tienen 17 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El esposo es conserje.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a la preparación y venta de corviches, empanadas y helados de varios sabores, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde todas las tardes vende empanadas y corviches porque los helados los vende todo el día, por las  mañanas se dedica a elaborar  sus productos y en las tardes a las venta de los mismos. Nos cuenta que lleva 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar maní, plátano verde, pescado, aceite, frutas, entre otros materiales necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le encantan por que ha recibido mucha ayuda del banco y de la institución. 
 
Su sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
In the El Progreso neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the community bank Ilusiones meets every two weeks. This is a highly populated area on the outskirts of the city. It is known as the jail district because Portoviejo's women's jail is in the area.  

Here we meet María. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. Three of them are grown and the others are 17 and 12. They go to high school. Her husband is a janitor.   
 
She is a good housewife who also makes and sells corviches, empanadas and differently flavored ice creams. She has a small locale in her house where she sells empanadas and corviches every afternoon. She sells the ice cream all day long. In the morning, she makes her products and sells them in the afterrnoon. She tells us that she has been doing this activity for 5 years, and it has gone very well for her.  

She is going to use this loan to buy more peanuts, green plantains, fish, oil, fruit and other ingredients she needs to prepare the foods. This is her fifth cycle in the community bank and she loves them, because she has she has received a lot of help from the bank and the institution. 
 
Her dream is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, green plantains, fish, oil, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina R. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Adelina is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling food seasonings, spices, native vinegars, soy sauce & salt in packs in the local community. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Adelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products like food seasonings, spices & canned goods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like food seasonings, spices & canned goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 50 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Emilio de 57 años y su querido hijo menor Víctor de 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. María pasa sus días vendiendo productos de belleza en las calles del distrito de Puente Piedra, va de puerta en puerta ofreciendo sus cotizados productos, es muy alegre y conversadora, por lo cual sus clientes prefieren comprarle a ella. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar son sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre que cosmético les dará mejor resultado. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es que después de cada día de ventas termina muy cansada debido a las largas caminatas,  desea tener en el futuro una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza y otras cosas más y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida. Es el sétimo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cosméticos, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en: Maria is 50 years old. She is a very simple and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Emilio, 57 years old, and their beloved son Victor, 13 years old. She wants to provide them with a better quality of life. Maria spends her days selling beauty products in the streets of the district of Puente Piedra. She goes from door to door offering her products. She is very happy and conversational which is the reason why her clients prefer to buy from her. What she most enjoys about her work sis to chat with her clients and to give advice on which cosmetics will suit them most. She has 15 years in the business. What she least enjoys is that she feels very tired after ending her day from the very long distances she walks. In the future she wants to have a store from where to sell her beauty products and other products to improve the quality of her life. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is ready to make her payments on time. She doesn't want to cause any problems to her communal bank where she is very well liked by the other members. With the two thousand three hundred nuevos soles she requests she will purchase more cosmetics to offer her clients a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Maria Purificación

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Maria tiene 47 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos  la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su propio negocio la socia tiene un kiosco escolar en un colegio y vende todo tipo de abarrotes escolares, la socia vende galletas, caramelos, sándwich, empanadas de carne y queso, pan con huevo y gaseosas, también vende refrescos y papas fritas, la socia diversifica su kiosco para poder abastecer a sus clientes; la socia requiere el préstamo e n esta ocasión para poder invertir en la compra de mercadería escolar y embutidos, carnes para elaborar los sándwiches. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su negocio escolar.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the village bank SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC II. She lives in Urubamba, a town in the Urubamba province of the department of Cusco.
Maria is 47 years old and married with six children. In addition to taking care of the home, she also has her own business. She runs a little shop in a local school, where she sells all sorts of treats like cookies, candies, sandwiches, meat and cheese empanadas, egg sandwiches, soft drinks, and potato chips. Maria has a wide variety of products to satisfy her customers, and is requesting this loan to purchase school supplies and cold cuts for sandwiches for her business.
Maria is infinitely grateful for the loan she's been offered, since it will help her expand her business and improve her quality of life. She is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase products for her little school shop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 43 year-old married man, living with his wife and two children in Chtoura.  Ahmad has worked as a barber since 1985.   This long experience  gave him a special position in his region.  Ahmad loves his business and family alot and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary products for his business.  Part of the loan will also pay for a new car that he bought to take his family on some short trips around the region. 

Ahmad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles and is in good standing. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business.
Ahmad is a man with a good reputation.  He's liked by most of his customers and recommended to others. He hopes to expand his business by opening a big beauty salon for women and men.

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his shop

loans.name: William

texts.es: William vive en su casa propia, queda en Tapo, Anexo de Pazos, ciudad de Huancayo. Desde hace 2 años  trabaja vendiendo leña, que él mismo los extrae de árboles de eucalipto que han sido cultivado en años anteriores. Pero él compra los árboles por extensión de terreno y con ayuda de su herramienta de trabajo, que es su sierra eléctrica. Es así que su trabajo consiste en cortar la leña en trozos y venderlos al por mayor a los comerciantes mayoristas. Su esposa la apoya en la administración y en el ingreso y egreso de su negocio. Siempre tiene cuidado de extraer los árboles, dejando  solo las raíces para que nuevamente broten nuevamente. Siente mucha satisfacción de su trabajo y su deseo es comprar extensiones de terreno no solo de árboles de eucalipto sino también para extender el cultivo de maíz, ya que es una de sus actividades que también realiza. Es su segundo crédito con MFP,  fue animado por uno de sus familiares a formar un grupo solidario que actualmente integra. Se siente muy motivado de continuar trabajando de manera grupal porque confía en la responsabilidad de sus demás integrantes y porque cada crédito que recibe le ayuda a mejorar su capital de trabajo. Con este monto de dinero comprará más troncos de eucalipto y pagar el flete de transporte de la leña que produzca.
texts.en: William lives in his own house in Tapo, Anexo de Pazos in the city of Huancayo.  For two years he has been selling firewood which he gets from the eucalyptus trees planted years before.  He buys the trees by strips of land and uses an electric saw as his work tool.  His wife helps with administration of accounts receivable and payable.  He is always careful when cutting the tree trunks, leaving the roots so a new tree can sprout.  He is very satisfied with his work and wants to buy more strips of land, not only of eucalyptus but also to grow corn, since he also has experience in this area.  This is his second loan through MFP.  One of his relatives encouraged him to set up a communal bank.  He is very motivated to keep working in a group sense because he trusts the responsibility of the other members and because each loan he receives helps him improve his working capital.  With this loan he plans to buy more ecualyptus tree trunks and pay for the firewood shipping costs.

loans.use: To buy eucalyptus tree trunks.

loans.name: Ranulfa

texts.en:
Ranulfa is 44 years old and married. She has an 18-year-old child. Her husband works as a farmer.

Ranulfa has been in the hog-raising business for 6 years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month from her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs. 

In the future, Ranulfa hopes to expand her business. She also hopes to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 42 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Rachel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from tailoring and a rice mill.

Rachel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is single and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Betty has run a business selling clothes. She is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

Betty is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to expand her business by purchasing clothes to sell. With the help of her loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Betty hopes to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиер владелец малого бизнеса с Южной части Таджикистана. Он является единственным кормильцем семьи. У него жена и 2 детей. Он продает мужские, женские и детские одежды на рынке. Бахтиер работает в этом бизнесе уже около 5 лет. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть вторую точку продажу и таким образом увеличить свой прибыль. Бахтиер просит $2000 Долларов США для покупки одежды на предстоящий сезон. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и делать успехи и таким образом улучшить условие жизни своей семьи.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Bakhtiyor owns a small business in the southern part of Tajikistan.  He is the sole provider for his family.  He has a wife and two children.  He sells men's, women's and children's clothing at the market.  Bakhtiyor has been working in this business for about five years.  He wants to expand his business and open a new sales outlet and, thus, increase his profits.  Bakhtiyor is requesting $2000 for the purchase of clothing for the upcoming season.  He wants to expand his business and achieve successes and, thus, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Jorge  Lucrecio

texts.es: El joven Jorge  recién esta conformando un hogar, la actividad que el realiza es de confección de ropa a contrato solo pedidos de confección de ropa deportiva, esto por la falta de capital para lo cual el solicita el préstamo  el cual invertirá en la compra de una maquina cortadora y telas para realizar su negocio y así independizarse, el señor Jorge vive en una casa familiar que le pertenece a su tío, su principal sueño es establecer su taller y ahorrar para un anticrético para su casa, es una persona muy emprendedora, le guata su trabajo y desea tener una familia muy unida su pareja es quien le ayuda en la confección de ropa deportiva. En la foto el señor Jorge esta junto a su pareja que trabaja con el en su taller.
texts.en: Jorge is a young man who is setting up his family life.  He has a sewing business and makes sports clothing on an order contract basis.  Because of a lack of capital he is requesting a loan to buy a cutting machine and fabric so he can become independent.  Jorge lives in a house that belongs to his uncle.  His main goal is to establish his own sewing shop and save for his own house.  He is an entrepreneur who enjoys what he does and wants to have a close-knit family.  His partner helps him make the sports clothing.  Jorge is pictured with his partner in the work area.

loans.use: To buy a cutting machine and fabric.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38-years-old, married and has two school-going children. He has been operating a retail shop for two years.  So far, he has employed one person in the business.  He also practices livestock farming for more income.  He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he used his previous loans to educate is wife who is currently a teacher.

Peter hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation in the future.  He has requested for 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and beans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and blessed with three children. For the last six years, he has been operating a carpentry business to support the family.  He also does farming to supplement his income. He has employed four people to help him to manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to become an employer. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber for making furniture. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun, 38 years old, is a farmer and pig seller. She earns $1.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $4 per day. They have four children; two are studying and two more work in a garment factory. Each earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent/a house fee, $8 on school fees, $13 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy pigs to feed and sell. The rest of the money she will keep for her daughter's wedding. She wants to feed more pigs so she can make a good profit at this time.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace medio año, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 100.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en  su negocio de venta de golosinas, gelatinas y galletas.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles, comprará una bolsa de gelatina, chupetines, dulces y una caja de galletas chocolates.  La señora vende los sábados, en las ferias de Puno y su esposo trabaja en una carpintería.

La señora desea tener una tienda comercial de abarrotes que le permita generar más ganancias.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el compañerismo y las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Las Amigas communal bank in the district, province, and department of Puno.  She is 19 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She studied up to high school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for six months.  Her first loan was for the sum of 100 PEN, money she invested in her business selling sweets, gelatin, and cookies.

With this new loan of 200 PEN, she will buy a bag of gelatin, lollipops, sweets, and a box of chocolate cookies.  She sells on Saturdays in the markets of Puno and her husband works in a carpenter's shop.

Lucia wants to have a commercial grocery store that would allow her to generate more profit.

What she likes about her communal bank are the companionship and the talks about business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of gelatin, lollipops, sweets, and cookies

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is single. She is 48 years of age. She is from the village of Kapalaran, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur.

Anecita is engaged in planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and she has a return per cropping of PHP 15,000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. Her rice field is ready for planting. 

She became a member of GDMPC this year only to gain financial access for her rice production. Anecita plans to expand her rice field to save money for her old age. She doesn't have family. Her earnings are for her food and other basic needs. She helps her neighborhood. She compensates those people who helped her during harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Ghinaa'

texts.en: Ghinaa' is a married woman with three sons and two daughters. She and her husband work in agriculture and they have a greenhouse project. Nibal wants to make another greenhouse project to benefit more and increase her income, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ghinaa' gets the loan, she will pay the expenses needed to get another greenhouse project, to enable her to increase the crop and her selling which lead to increase her income and live in better conditions with her family. Ghinaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for making another greenhouse project.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (es una bebida a base de maíz), la socia vende en su casa desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar la chicha como maíz y jora al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LLANCASUN DE ARIN” communal bank. The bank is located in the Calca district and province which is located in the Cusco department. 

The member’s name is Rosa. She is 28 years old and has a partner and two children. The member alternates her daily activities with a business selling chicha (a drink made with a base of corn). The member sells the drink at her home from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Through this small business, she helps her children move ahead. Rosa wants to expand her business selling chicha. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for making chicha like wholesale corn and jora.

The member is happy for this loan and promises to fulfill the payments of her loan.

loans.use: purchase materials for making chicha like wholesale corn and jora.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a married woman with ten children, two of whom still attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past the ten years, she has operated a business selling maize from home to her neighbours and passers by.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.  She dreams of establishing a shop to sell maize at the market in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Shining Angles Group

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Sencia from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is single with two children, one is still at school. She also cares for two dependents. Sencia runs a business sewing kids' clothes. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges she faces are that rent is too high on the shop she is using as her factory. Sencia has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothing material for sewing. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family and kids. In the future, Sencia plans to own a wholesale kids' clothing business.

loans.use: to buy material for sewing

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lorna has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, noodles and other grocery items.

Lorna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, noodles and other grocery items.

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en: Adowa is a petty trader; she sells cloth and shoes in Abrafo near Abura. She is single and has one child. Adowa has been a petty trader for 5 years. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying for her child. Her loan will be used to purchase cloth and shoes for sale. She hopes to put the new profits from her business into savings which will enable her to give her child the best education.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and shoes for sale

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en: Ms Munawar is 42 years old. She is a housewife and a mother of four. Her husband has been selling crockery for many years. He offers various sizes of plates, boxes, and cooking utensils of steel. He has a good client list and is famous for his good quality products. Now he needs to buy more stock of steel products to cater to more customers. However, his resources restrict him from doing so. That is why Munawar, on behalf of her husband, requested a loan of Rs 30,000/- to buy more stock of steel crockery. He is hoping to earn more profits through his increased sales. He dreams of  providing his children with a good quality education.

loans.use: To buy steel crockery at lower rates

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tumaini Group, located in Busia District, consists of 14 women and 8 men led by Catherine, pictured on the right with her hand raised.  She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Catherine’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to grow enough food for the family.

Catherine described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to buy livestock as an investment for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive a loan for ½ an acre of agricultural inputs, for a total of 11 acres worth of loans.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Migniwannanmide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIGNIWANNANMIDE est composé de trois personnes qui fréquentent la même église. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agathe (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Agathe est mariée a un plombier du nom de Félix. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Agathe vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Agathe vend de la bouillie faite a base de maïs et de la nourriture depuis six ans environ. Agathe s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Agathe ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIGNIWANNANMIDE sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs et des sacs d'haricot.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Ms. Abla S. is a 37-year-old, illiterate woman who is married to a man with no income. She is the mother of four children who also takes care of two of her sisters. Her business consists of selling fried fish and “gari” (cassava flour). There are periods when there is an abundance of gari (the rainy season) and prices fall and periods when there is very little gari (the dry season) and prices jump because the supply falls.

Ms. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy barrels in order to stock gari in times of abundance and to earn a maximum profit from sales during the dry season. The loan will allow this courageous and enterprising woman to make her business profitable and get out of the vicious cycle of poverty in which she and her family are caught.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 37 ans, Mme S. Abla est une femme illettrée, mariée à un homme sans aucun moyen et mère de quatre (04) enfants avec deux (02) sœurs à charge. Elle a comme activité principale, la vente du poisson frit et du gari (la farine de manioc). Le gari à ses périodes d’abondance (période des pluies) où les prix chutes et les périodes de soudure (saison sèche) où les prix flambent car l’offre baisse.

Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter des fûts afin de pouvoir faire le stockage de gari en période d’abondance et en tirer le maximum de profit lors de la vente en saison sèche. Ce financement permettra à cette femme courageuse et entreprenante de rentabiliser son commerce afin de sortir du cercle vicieux de la pauvreté dans lequel se trouvent elle-même et sa famille.

loans.use: To buy barrels to stock “gari”

loans.name: Manuel Jesús

texts.en:
Manuel is 38 years old, married and has two children, of 12 and 14 years of age. He used to be a carrier and, two years ago he had saved enough to initiate his own business. Now he is dedicated to the sale of clothes with the aid of his wife. Together they have been able to make considerable progress – the business has been growing and customers multiplied.

Now Manuel needs a loan of $475 dollars that he will use to purchase merchandise to be able to offer his clients a greater variety of products and secure their preference. He intends to pay back this loan in a lapse of 4 to 8 months. The well-being of this family and the growth of their business is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Virgilio Russi, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Manuel tiene 38 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos, de 12 y 14 años de edad. Él tenía el oficio de cargador y con los ahorros que pudo acumular, hace dos años juntó el capital suficiente para iniciar su propio negocio, ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para atener su negocio y juntos han podido sacarlo adelante, afortunadamente su tienda de ropa ha estado creciendo y sus clientes se han multiplicado.

Ahora Manuel necesita de un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad y poder conservar su preferencia, el ofrece devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia y el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dude más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe started selling hamburgers about 3 years ago. She is married and has 2 small children. Maria is a resourceful and goal-oriented woman. She wants to set a good example for her children, and this is why she started her own business. By taking advantage of the area where she lives, she has set up a food stand in a major avenue(intersection) which has helped her increase her sales tremendously. She has also invested most of her profits back into her business. She has worked very hard all these years to make sure her children have a better life.

In order for her business to continue to grow, Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which she will use to purchase cooking ingredients and to do some improvements to her food stand so that she can better serve her clients. She has agreed to repay this amount within 6 months. Help Maria with her growing business. She and her family appreciate your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace tres años Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, Maria es una mujer emprendedora y activa quiere ser un ejemplo para sus hijos por lo que inició su propio negocio, aprovechando la ubicación de su hogar instaló su puesto en una avenida principal de su localidad, esto le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas rápidamente y crecer con su negocio, además de que ha reinvertido la mayor parte de sus utilidades en el negocio, el ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida la ha impulsado a trabajar arduamente durante todo este tiempo.

Para poder continuar creciendo ahora Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que le permitan incrementar su producción además de realizar algunas modificaciones en su local con lo que podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients and to do some improvements

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the twenty-two women of the Kandiadhiou Association, led by Ms. Awa B.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The Casamance is a very remote region of Senegal. It has the potential to be rich, but is nevertheless very poor. Its population is young and the majority are women, who dominate the local economy and constitute the engine of development. In this area, the majority of young girls and women do not have any source of income, and this is the cause of the exponential growth in migration away from rural areas.

The women of Casamance are brave and hardworking, especially in trade. However they lack the chance to put these attributes to good use, because they are trapped in a vicious cycle of poverty and deprivation. In fact, in many cases the wife is the most important member of the household, thanks to her role in producing food for the family and countless other responsibilities...

Purpose: The objectives of this trading business include restarting local economic activities, motivating young women to stay in their home villages by creating revenue-generating activities, creating revenues for women at the household level, fighting poverty by increasing income, guaranteeing the grassroots development of the locality, fighting malnutrition among mothers and children, and providing good-quality products to the inhabitants of the village.

Business activities: This business consists of lending money to the women of the village group so that they can engage in trade of products such as fresh, dried and smoked fish, sugar, tea, palm oil, vegetables, rice, oil, etc. At the same time, the women will purchase millet, cashew nuts, and other specialties of their own village to resell in the large town markets. This will allow the women to make a profit and repay the loan.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte : La Casamance est une région très enclavée du Sénégal. Elle est potentiellement riche mais très pauvre. Sa population est jeune avec une majorité des femmes qui sont prépondérantes dans l’économie locale et constituent le moteur du développement. Dans la localité, la plupart des jeunes filles et femmes n’ont pas de sources de revenus et ceci est la cause de la croissance exponentielle de l’exode rural.

La femme de la Casamance est très brave et tenace face au travail et le commerce en particulier cependant elle ne trouve pas de moyens ou d’opportunités pour exploiter ses potentialités car elle est contrecarrée par un cercle vicieux pauvreté et manque de moyens.

En effet, dans bon nombre de cas, la femme est plus importante dans le ménage, vu son rôle de production de vivres et tant d’autres...

Objectifs : Les objectifs visées sont par le projet commerce sont entre autre :

-Relancer les activités économiques dans la localité -Fixer les jeunes femmes de la localité dans leurs territoires par la création d’activités génératrices de revenues -Créer des revenus aux femmes au niveau des ménages -Lutter contre la pauvreté par la distribution de revenus -Garantir l’auto développement de la localité -Lutter contre la malnutrition maternelle et infantile -Mettre à la disposition des populations des produits de bonne qualité

Activités : Ce projet consiste à prêter de l’argent aux femmes des groupements villageois pour faire du commerce des produits tels que poissons frais, secs ou fumés, sucre, thé, huile de palme, légumes, riz, huile etc. Il y’a lieu de noter que les femmes vont en même temps acheter dans leur village du mil, des noix de cajou et d’autres pour les revendre dans les grands marchés. A partir de cette activité, les femmes vont fructifier l’argent pour arriver au bout de la dette. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of local goods, storage and transport for traveling sales

loans.name: Pav

texts.en: Mr. Pav L., age 25, is single and lives with his older sister. He makes and sells traditional Cambodia noodles that he sells in the market. He can earn an average of $2.50 per day which he contributes towards the family’s household expenses. He would like to create a fish breeding business and would like to finance his startup with a loan of $800 to invest in a water pump, pipes, and fish food. This new business will increase the family’s income and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To start a fish breeding business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is a  41 year old woman. She lives with her child, she is single and provides for her family alone. She barely makes ends meet, tried to sell different types of goods, but as most people in the bazar are occupied with other types of business, she decided to start a business with jewerly, which gets a better income. She wants to get a loan to expanding her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Mr. Hernandez has been selling toys for 18 years, throughout the years he's been able to make her business grow.

With the loans he's gotten from CEPRODEL he's been able to improve his business and buy more toys.

This holiday season Mr. Hernandez offers bicylces and fans to his customers. For this reason, he is grateful for CEPRODEL's helping hand. CEPRODEL has been able to help him increase his inventory and improve his way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. H. se dedica a la venta de juguetes desde hace ya 18 años tiempo en el cual ha logrado ir prosperando en su negocio poco a poco.

. Con los financiamientos que ha solicitado en CEPRODEL le han contribuido en las mejoras en su local permitiéndole exhibir mejor sus juguetes y compra al contado.

Actualmente el Sr.H. desea aprovechar la temporada navideña para ofrecer a los visitantes de su establecimiento Bicicletas y abanicos por lo que considera que la mano amiga de Ceprodel es vital para que su negocio aumente su inventario y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y el de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Ms. Sevil has very little income. She is 56, married with five children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Sevil owns a small herd of milk cows, and she sells the milk in the Saatli bazaar.

Sevil's family expenses are increasing as her children grow up. Sevil plans to increase the number of cows she has, so she can increase her income. To do this, Sevil has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $500. She hopes this loan will let her change her family's life for the better.

loans.use: To buy more milk cows to increase income

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Every morning Isabel distributes cow's milk to her community. Thanks to her 28 cows she is able to supply the majority of her neighbors and the members of her community. They are all very thankful for her care and kindness. Selling milk is fickle work because her travels to distribute the milk is complicated by high temperatures in the area. She also does not have the tools she needs to quicken her deliveries. This increases the amount of work she does and for this reason she is hoping to purchase some tools such as: special buckets and measurers to speed up her sales and minimize her work.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Isabel todas las mañanas reparte leche de vaca a su comunidad , gracias a las 28 vacas que posee puede abastecer a la gran mayoría de sus vecinos y comuneros de su localidad los cuales están muy agradecidos por la atención y amabilidad de Isabel..La venta de leche es un trabajo liviano pero caminar para el reparto de su producto es complicado por la alta temperatura de la zona además de no poseer utensilios para aligerar el trabajo de traslado ésta situación acrecienta su trabajo y por esa razón ella desea adquirir algunos utensilios tales como: baldes especiales y medidores para agilizar sus ventas y aminorar su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of tools to improve and increase her distributions.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men H., age 39, has five children. She owns a plot of farmland and grows rice. Usually, she earns about $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kok Tin, works raises ducks. Every day he sells the eggs at the market, and earns approximately $3 a day. Two children help their mother, and the others are students.

To expand the business, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more ducks to raise and more food for the ducks. This will allow all the ducks to grow very quickly and produce eggs every day.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to raise and more food for the ducks

loans.name: Kamwokya Ii Development Group

texts.en:
Faith M., the chairperson of the Kamwokya II Development group, is a multi-business woman. She rears 250 local and broiler chickens at her home, a business she has had for seven years. She also sells tap water. And through the chicken business, she was able to start up the food processing business where she makes and sells juice, cakes, and other confectioneries. In all these businesses, she employs no one but works hand-in-hand with some of her children. She needs a loan to help buy more chicks and stock chicken feeds because the prices are going up by the day.

Faith is 53 years and married with six children. Though only one of her children is still in school, she cares for five other kids of which four are in school. The rest of the children are grown up and working in their own businesses.

Her group has been together since 1992 and they are grateful to Pearl Microfinance for the loans that have enabled them with the smooth running of their businesses.

loans.use: Faith would buy more broiler chicks and stock chicken feeds with her part of this group loan

loans.name: Idimo

texts.en:
A. Idimo is 46 is years old. She is married with three children. Idimo’s husband is entrepreneur. Idimo and her husband are working hard to ensure a bright future for their children.

Idimo has been running her own small business for thirteen years. She has a place in the central local market for selling food, such as macaroni, sugar, sweets, detergents, soap, washing powder, toothpaste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. The business is stable and allows her to improve her family's living conditions.

This year, Idimo’s daughter is finishing school and dreaming about entering the University. In order to make her daughter’s dream come true, Idimo needs to develop her business. For this purpose, she requests for 3000 Somoni ($875 USD). Idimo is planning to spend the loan to buy more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of the goods. She promises to repay the loan within 5 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her making her daughter’s dream a reality. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo is 37 years old and is married to Juana Espínola who is a housewife. They have two children who attend primary school in the town. They live in their own home.

Guillermo began work as a taxi-driver 15 years ago. Through hard work and good financial management, a few years ago he succeeded in obtaining a plot of land in the town and built his house there.

With this loan, he wishes to buy a vehicle and achieve his dream of being the owner of a successful business. At the moment the vehicle that he drives does not belong to him, and he works on a contract basis.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermo tiene 37 años de edad, está casado con Juana Espínola, quien es ama de casa. Tienen dos hijos que van aún a la escuela primaria de la ciudad, viven en casa propia.

Guillermo inicio su labor como taxista hace 15 años. Gracias al sacrificio y sus buenos manejos económicos luego de varios años logró adquirir un terreno en la ciudad, en donde edificó su casa.

Guillermo con la ayuda del crédito desea comprar un vehículo y así poder cumplir su sueño cual es el de ser propietario de un negocio próspero en el cual él podrá ser propietario ya que actualmente el vehículo con el que trabaja no le pertenece y gana de acuerdo a una comisión.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicia Rodriguez D. Lopez was born in Asuncion. She has been married to Felipe Lopez for over 20 years and has 12 adult children.

Felicia works making traditional decorative woolen cloths for crosses on graves and family vaults in cemeteries. She has maD. these cloths since 1985 with the help of her family. Since the whole family works creating these cloths, they make large quantities and are able to export their goods to nearby cities in Argentina and Brazil.

She has worked with the Foundation since 2000, using her loans to increase her fixed assets by purchasing sewing machines and has thereby improved her income. She is now seeking another loan in order to perform maintenance on her sewing machines and purchase more fabric and accessories for her craft.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Felicia R. D. L. nació en la ciudad D. Asunción, está casada con el Sr. Felipe L. desD. hace mas D. veinte años con quien tuvo doce hijos quienes ya son todos mayores D. edad.

Felicia se dedica a la confección D. paños para cruces que se encuentran que se usan en las tumbas y panteones D. cementerios como una tradición nuestra. Ya desD. el año 1985 ella ha confeccionado estos paños, al igual que toda su familia, pues todos se dedican a lo mismo. Es así que con su familia trabajan en grandes cantidades e importan a ciudades cercanas D. Argentina y Brasil.

Opera con la Fundación desD. el año 2000 logrando aumentar su activo fijo con la compra D. varias máquinas para cocer telas y así logro ir aumentar sus ingresos. Ella hoy solicita un nuevo crédito con la que podrá realizar los mantenimientos necesarios a sus máquinas D. cocer además D. comprar telas y accesorios necesarios para la confección D. sus paños.

loans.use: Machine maintenance, purchase of fabrics and accessories for her handiwork

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
M. Nodira is 34 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Nodira has been selling sportswear for men and boys for the past 11 years. She started the sales business because she had been out of work for some time, and her children's necessities could not be paid for with her husband’s income alone. Nodira decided to use her savings to buy sportswear from wholesale vendors and, in turn, sell it in the local market. Little by little, she has managed to increase her customer base and to make enough income to support her 4 children.

At present, however, the selection of garments in Nodira's inventory is poor, and she therefore needs a loan of US$1,000 to be repaid in 6 months. With the help of the loan, Nodira will be able to purchase new and more diverse merchandise to offer to her clients. With your support, Nodira will eventually be able to expand her business and save money for her children’s future expenses.

loans.use: Purchase sportswear for men and boys

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria Victoria inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas, galletas, sodas y artículos de consumo diario hace cuatro años.
Ella nos cuenta que gracias a Dios el negocio que tiene en su casa, esta muy cerca de la Escuela de la Aldea de Cruz Blanca, y por eso empezó a vender cuadernos, crayones y hojas de papel.   Sus clientes le empezaron a pedir hilos para la elaboración de güipiles, servilletas, herrajes y otras prendas típicas de vestir. Con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha venido creciendo, hoy en día la venta de cuadernos escolares y hojas de papel, se ha convertido en una pequeña venta de útiles escolares.  También su venta de hilos ha ido creciendo, ya que vende hilos de varias clases y precios.

Gracias a Dios ella dice que en la escuela le están haciendo pedidos de gomas de mascar, galleras y toda variedad de dulces y golosinas.  Por esta demanda de sus clientes ella necesita más capital, y quiere prepararse ya que pronto será la época navideña, y es una buena época para vender otra clase de productos de esa temporada.
Ella desea aumentar sus ventas y negocios.

loans.use: Compra de productos para venta en su tienda.  Dulces, golosinas y utiles escolares.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Mr. Nut S. R. is 27 years old, and is single. He lives in Siem Reap province with his parents. He is an electrical repair man, and repairs televisions, radios, cassette and video players. He received training as an electrical repair man in school, and once he finished school he decided to open an electrical repair shop in his area. He opened the shop because he noticed that there were no such shops in the area where he lived. He earns on average about $7 per day. His mother is a food vendor and sells rice and a variety of Khmer dishes at the market. His father is a motor-taxi driver. Mr. Nut S. R. contributes his income to the total household income of his parents. On average, monthly expenses run about $82 with about $37 for food, $20 for utilities, and $25 for transportation. Inflation has hit Cambodia though, at a rate of about 22% from when the last statistics were taken, increasing monthly expenses for many people in Cambodia.

Mr. Nut S. R. is requesting his loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate.  Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan after harvest.

loans.use: To buy a new, more reliable moto-taxi for his father

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice M. is married and has 4 children. She has attended school through the senior high school level. In 2000, Beatrice started a business selling clothing at Kissi, near the city of Elmina, Ghana. She uses her income to pay for utility bills and other family expenses. Beatrice is requesting this loan to purchase additional supplies of clothing to meet the demands of her customers. She plans to use the additional profits from her increased business to save towards a house for the family to live in.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing supplies to meet the demands of her costumers

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en:
Adesuwa E. sells yams in bulk and individually in New Benin Market in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 49 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a farmer. 

She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more yams to sell. 

She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Nora Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Nora Rosa R. R. tiene 36 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, tiene 01 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Nora se dedica a la venta de menú, inicio su negocio vendiendo caldos por las mañanas y ceviche los domingos, dejo de trabajar durante 01 año por motivo de salud, cuando inicio nuevamente empezó vendiendo menú a diario, ahora tiene pensionistas todos los días, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de mesas, sillas y arreglo el piso de su casa.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina o congeladora para su negocio.
Nora tiene el gran sueño de construir su casa y viajar a Huaraz con su hija.
texts.en:
Ms. Nora Rosa R. R. is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied up to the 3rd year of middle school. She has 1 dependent daughter. Nora sells set menu meals for a living. She started out by selling soup in the morning and ceviche—citrus marinated fish—on Sundays. She stopped working for a whole year due to health reasons. When she resumed her business, she started selling set menu meals daily. She now serves patrons everyday in her restaurant, which she runs from home.

She invested the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her local microfinance institute—“Las Lomeras”—in purchasing tables and chairs and having her floor repaired. She will invest this 800.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, in purchasing a display case or a freezer for her business.

Nora’s biggest dream is building her house and traveling to Huaraz with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case or freezer

loans.name: Mudi

texts.en:
Married with seven children who are currently in school, 52-year-old Mudi Y. lives in Abofour, located in the Ashanti region of Ghana, where she sells foodstuffs such as bags of maize in the local market.

Mudi is an achiever, and her focus is to save enough money to provide her children with quality educations, but without adequate funds this dream won’t be realized. Mudi is therefore humbly requesting your help through a loan to purchase an increased stock of maize directly from the farmers to satisfy her customers’ needs. This will allow her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their family.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stocks of cassava and maize.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles  en majorité monogames  dans le village de  Finkolo, Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente des condiments, de haricot, de la farine de blé et  la restauration.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé de collaborer  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq prêts précédents, elles sont à leur sixième prêt  de groupe (prêt solidaire) 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt,  15 sacs de 100kg de haricot, 7 sacs et ½  de 50 kilogrammes de farine de blé, 5 bidons d’huiles de 20 litres, 10 paniers de tomates, 30 sacs de choux pommés et des condiments pour la sauce. Elles s’approvisionnent  au marché de Sikasso et Finkolo.
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Gladiè, Kadièla et Finkolo en détail, au comptant et à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie  investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Danaya are all married and average 39 years of age and seven children. They live in traditional families, mostly monogamous ones, in the village of Finkolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do various work, such as buying and selling condiments, beans, and flour, and they do food catering.

To satisfy their customers, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid their five preceding loans, they are on their sixth group loan (solidarity loan). The members plan to buy fifteen 100-kg sacks of beans, seven and a half 50-kg sacks of flour, five 20-liter drums of oil, 10 baskets of tomatoes, 30 sacks of cabbage, and condiments for making sauces. Supplies are gotten at the Sikasso and Finkolo marketplaces. The merchandise is sold retail at the marketplaces of Gladiè, Kadièla, and Finkolo (cash or credit accepted).

The group members each envision realizing an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA per month. Part of the profits will be used to meet family needs, and the other part is to be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for commerce and for catering

loans.name: Naiba

texts.en:
Naiba K. is 60 years old and a widow raising her one daughter alone. Her daughter is Naiba's inspiration to work hard every day and continue with her business. When her husband passed away, Naiba was left without steady income. Supporting her children practically on her own was very difficult. After a long suffering she decided to open a grocery store near her house. Naiba is trying to generate income not only for her family's consumption, but also to be able to create savings for the future wedding of her daughter.

To increase the range of goods she has for sale, Naiba is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working. Your generosity can change her life and her family's life.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 37 años, vive junto a su pareja, y actualmente está a la espera de su primer hijo. Se dedica a la venta de variedades de plásticos; durante las mañanas lo hace en un puesto de un mercado de su localidad, y por las tardes lleva a vender a las diferentes tiendas que se encuentran por su zona. Este trabajo lo viene ejerciendo desde hace un año atrás en forma permanente, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, pues trabajan juntos. A Lucy le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce muchos lugares y se socializa, además que le es rentable porque tiene su propia clientela y sus productos se vende diariamente. Su plan para un futuro cercano es acondicionar un lugar en su casa para la venta de su mercadería y dejar de pagar alquiler. Con este, ya son 7 préstamos que Lucy viene trabajando con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Las Palmas”, al cual le gusta pertenecer porque hay mucha comprensión y responsabilidad entre todos los integrantes. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, mandará a construir el local que tanto desea en su casa para poner su negocio, para lo que gastará 1500 soles; con el resto comprará mayor cantidad de productos plásticos en diferentes variedades.
texts.en:
Lucy is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and she is currently pregnant with their first child. She sells various types of plastic; during the mornings she sells from a stand in her local market and in the afternoons she sells to different stores in her area. She has worked full-time in this job for the past year and she works together with her husband. Lucy likes her job because she gets to visit a lot of places and socialize. It is also profitable because she has her own group of customers and she sells her products each day. Her short-term plan is to prepare a space in her home to sell her products from so she can stop paying rent (in the market). This is Lucy’s 7th loan with MFP. Her community bank is called “Las Palmas” and she enjoys being a member because there is a lot of compassion and responsibility among all of the members. With the loan money, she will begin building the space in her home that she has been hoping for, a place to have her business. She will spend 1,500 soles on that and the rest will b used to buy more types of plastic.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: build a place for her business

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina A. is thirty seven years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Currently all the children are in school. She loves selling goods, the business which is the source of her livelihood.  Selina resides in Takroase, a farming and a mining community in the in the eastern region of Ghana. She was born and bred there with family members. Selina lives in the family house together with the husband. Her husband buys and sells diamonds. She has been selling food stuffs like tubers of yam, beans and peanuts etc. for twelve years to support her family. She treks to nearby farming communities  to buy her stock of yam. Sometimes she spends days in the villages just to get a large quantity of food stuffs. This saves her from the middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, Selina wants to buy bulk tubers of yam, peanuts and beans etc. to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school.Selina belongs to a village bank called ‘Nkwagyedom’ which literally means "savior of the multitude".

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy food stuffs like yam, peanuts and beans etc.

loans.name: Mbakisya

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Mbakisya M. from Dar es Salaam. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 9 and 20. Mbakisya has been running a tailoring business since 2003. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Mbakisya currently earns about $120 US from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase cloth and sewing accessories in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve her business. Mbakisya thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and sewing accessories in bulk

loans.name: Dominiciano

texts.en:
"My parents are farmers. They taught me everything about farming so that when I had my own family I could support my wife as well as my children. Now, we are busy preparing our farm for our next planting. Our wish is that we will again have an abundant harvest,“ says Dominiciano S., a father of four children.

He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate. He thinks that the loan will help him improve his harvest.

CEVI provides financial services to entrepreneurial poor. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate for farming.

loans.name: Nagriza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Наргиза Отаназарова 1977 года рождения,замужем, имеет двоих детей. C малых лет Наргиза любила шить и мечтала открыть своё ателье.Сейчас она шьёт на заказ портьеры и занавески европейского стиля.Они пользуются хорошим спросом среди населения.Для расширения своего бизнеса Наргиза обратилась в нашу организацию. Она рада сотрудничеству с нами и благодарит наших партнёров по КИВА.
texts.en:
Nagriza O. was born in 1977. She's married and has two children. Since she was very small she has liked to sew and has dreamed of opening her own sewing studio. At present she makes custom European-style curtains and drapes, and profits by their high demand. She is seeking assistance from our organization to expand her business. Nagriza is very glad to be associated with us and thanks our partners at Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing accessories

loans.name: Anes Gull Group

texts.en:
Anes Gull is the group leader of Anes Gull loan group. There are four members in this group and they live in District 4th, Kabul, Afghanistan. The total requested amount is 40000 Afghani and each of them would like to receive the loan for his/her own business.

Anes Gull and Faryda want a loan for their fresh fruit cart businesses. Halema wants a loan for her carpet weaving business. Sema Gull wants a loan for bakery. They admire this process and want to thank Kiva, too.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Osewuonamen

texts.en: Osewuonamen O. is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She sells laboratory equipment. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more laboratory equipment to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more laboratory equipment to sell

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
For more than 15 years, Zarifa has been a business owner by selling different kinds of foodstuff and school items. Her business is situated near a local school where there are always a lot of schoolchildren, so the business is very stable and generates a stable income for her family.

Mavzuna has been working with IMON for 4 years and has proven herself to be an accurate client. Today she requests 5,000 Somoni for purchasing school items due to the coming of the 1st of September. Mavzuna thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan in time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing school items for selling.

loans.name: Eduardito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Eduardito, es originario del Bo Maestro, perteneciente a Managua, las integrantes de este grupo son tres mujeres de carácter muy humilde pero de gran osadía.

Doña Fátima del Socorro Fuente, tiene 36 años de edad, y es la coordinadora del grupo quien inicio hace más de 5 años en su casa una mini-pulperia, con la que solventaba sus gastos y necesidades.

Fátima nos dice que ella sufrió un robo donde perdió mucho de su inversión, por lo tanto opto por poner a trabajar como Taxi el carro que poseía. Desde entonces invierte los créditos que ADIM le brinda en el mantenimiento del vehículo (El ciclo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de Llantas; éste ciclo pretende darle mantenimiento al motor) para después ir pagando las cuotas con los pagos diarios del alquiler. 

Ella aspira poder recuperar su pulpería con forme avance en los créditos que se le brindan, asi podrá tener más ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida.

Xiomara Antonia G. forma parte del grupo, posee un negocio de Barbería en su casa de habitación; Doña Xiomara M. trabaja en un Kiosco propio donde vende todo tipo de golosinas, bebidas y algunos alimentos. Todas quieren seguir adelante con sus créditos, este grupo se caracteriza por ser un grupo muy cumplidor, puntual y jamás ha faltado a sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The Eduardito Group is originally from Bo Maestro, which is part of Managua. The three members of this group are women of humble character who fear nothing.
