Doña Fátima del Socorro Fuente is 36 years old and the group coordinator. Five years ago, she started a mini grocery store out of her home as a means of earning an income and paying for basic necessities.

Fátima says she lost a lot of money that she personally invested into an automobile that she rents out as a taxi. Since then, she has used her loans from ADIM to pay for maintenance of the vehicle. (Her previous loan was used to buy tires. This loan will be used to pay for engine repairs.) Going forward, she will make her payments using the rental fees she receives on a daily basis.

She hopes to revive her grocery store using the loans that have been provided to her, so that she can earn more income and improve her living conditions.

Xiomara Antonia G. recently joined the group and operates a barber shop out of her home. Doña Xiomara M. sells all kinds of candy, drinks, and other foods from her vending kiosk. They all want to use their loans to help them succeed. The group is very reliable, punctual, and has never failed to make their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for engine repairs & purchase supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza P. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 33 years old and married with an infant.  To make a living, Mariza sells both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Mariza joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariza successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 7000 PHP, which was used to purchase new items and expand her product offering.  Mariza is now requesting her third loan, this one for 10000 PHP, for the same purpose.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her product offering.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth A., 39 years old, lives in the populous urban community of Maricaban, Pasay City. She has three children: two attend high school and the youngest is in grade school. Her husband, Ramoncito, 49, is a transport supervisor. Maribeth has owned a general store for thirteen years. Business has been very progressive through the years and she has already been able to purchase two passenger jeepneys (small buses). She is now earning P12,000 a month. She uses her profits to sustain the education of her children. Maribeth has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2003. She is now applying for a new loan of P22,000 which she will use to purchase an upright freezer for her general store. She will also stock up on soft drinks. Maribeth wishes to have another branch in the adjacent village. She also wants to see all her children finish their college education. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase an upright freezer and softdrinks

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells akara (beans cake).The demands for her akara is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more bags of bean to fry akara to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of bean to fry akara to sell

loans.name: Dora Sandra

texts.es: Dora Sandra C. reside en el departamento de Santa Ana, con sus dos hijos Jose de 17 años de edad y Bryan de 11 años de edad, ambos estudiantes. Dora es madre soltera, ella trabaja en su negocio hace dieciséis años, donde de manera ambulante vende variedad de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros , ella viaje a diferentes departamentos de todo El salvador para lograr abarcar un mercado amplio, el deseo de Dora es poder surtir su inventario de otra variedad de productos, como ropa interior, es para ello que utilizara este crédito, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas, las cuales son de gran importancia, por ser ella el único pilar económico de la familia.
texts.en:
Dora Sandra C. lives in the department of Santa Ana with her two children, Jose (age 17) and Bryan (age 11). Both of her sons are students. Dora is a single mother and has been working 16 years as a street merchant selling clothes for children, women, and men. She travels to different neighborhoods throughout El Salvador to sell her products so that she can acquire as many customers as she can. Dora hopes to increase her inventory by adding other varieties of merchandise, such as undergarments. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales. Generating an income is of great importance since this is her only means of financial support for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Harrietta

texts.en:
Harrietta is 40 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home.

Harrietta is a LAPO client who sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a hardworking woman and she sells for long hours to make more profits to meet the basic needs of her family.

Harrietta is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Las Pepas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Pepas está integrado por mujeres trabajadoras, capaces y emprendedoras que han sabido salir adelante estás son Sadia S., Elizabeth M. y María C.. Ellas necesitan el crédito para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ya que en esta época se las ventas suben.
Sadia S. de veintisiete años tiene nueve años de vender ropa, Elizabeth M. vende nacatamales, frito, chicharrón, moronga, chancho con yuca y carne de cerdo y María C. vende tortillas y leche de soya.
texts.en:
The group “Las Pepas” consists of three hardworking, capable, and enterprising women who want to succeed: Sadia S., Elizabeth M., and María C.. They need a loan so that they can meet the increased demand from their customers that occurs during this time of the year.

Sadia S. is 27 years old and has been selling clothes for 9 years. Elizabeth M. sells nacatamales, fried pork, chicharrones, blood sausage, pork with cassava, and other dishes. María C. sells tortillas and soy milk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Magaly Salvadora

texts.en:
Magaly has a general grocery store in Villa Nueva's market. She has had this store for quite some time now. Among the most popular items that she sells are eggs and sweet candies. She will use her loan to invest in more of these items.

Magaly has four kids who are already grown up. Her husband works in construction, and helps to cover the costs of the house, but he doesn't earn much and he can't quite cover all the necessities. They have their own house, but they would like to use the increased earnings from the loan to continue construction projects around the house.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, candy, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda S., reside en Ilopango, departamento de San salvador. Vive en casa propia, tiene dos hijos los cuales residen en Estados Unidos, razón por la cual ella vive sola. A sus 69 años de edad, Gilda es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza a diario vendiendo pupusas en su casa. Este negocio lo posee desde hace 5 años, y es el cual le permite obtener el dinero necesario para todos sus gastos personales. Gilda solícita un préstamo, ya que desea poder mejorar las ventas de su negocio y es solo de esta manera como ella puede obtener el capital necesario para comprar bebidas y toda la materia prima para la elaboración de las pupusas. Gilda desea poder vender más, ya que este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos seguros que tiene, debido a que sus hijo le mandan remesas las cuales no recibe siempre, es por ello que Gilda trabaja mucho para mantener su negocio de manera estable, ya que es este el cual le permite poder solventar todos los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Gilda Sanchez lives in Ilopango, San Salvador Department. She lives in her own house and has two children who live in the United States, which is why she lives alone. At 69 years of age, Gilda is a very hard working person who strives daily to sell pupusas in her house. She ha owned this business for 5 years and it is through it that she can obtain the money necessary for her personal expenses. Gilda requests a loan because she wants to improve her business' sales and this is the only way she can obtain the necessary capital to buy drinks and raw ingredients to prepare her pupusas. Gilda wants to sell more because this business is her only secure source of income because her sons send her money she doesn't always get. This is why Gilda works very hard to keep her business stable given that it is her business which allows her to support all of her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials to make pupusas, and buying drinks

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo vive en la Colonia Venecia desde hace veinte años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un lugar muy transitado por los vecinos, cuenta con una variedad de productos de consumo diario como ser huevos, leche, arroz, manteca azucar, café entre otros, asi mismo se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo ( AVON ), las cuales tambien prefieren sus clientas, doña Consuelo es una mujer
muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta. Esta casada y su esposo se dedica tambien al comercio, forman una bonita familia con tres hijos los cuales han luchado para que tengan una buena educacion. Necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia avon al por mayor y conseguir precios mas bajos y con esto obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Consuelo has lived in the Colonia Venecia neighborhood for twenty years. Her business is located in a place where many neighbors pass by regularly. She offers a variety of everyday products such as eggs, milk, rice, shortening, sugar and coffee, among others. In addition, she sells Avon products by catalog, which are also popular among her customers. Consuelo is a very hard-working, responsible and honest woman. She is married, and her husband also works in the business. They have three children, forming a beautiful family, and they have struggled to provide a good education for their children. Consuelo needs a loan to purchase more wholesale Avon merchandise, so that she can pay lower prices and thus receive more income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing creams, lotions, perfumes, deodorants, makeup, nail polish, and polish remover

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon L., 41, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Henry L., an employee, they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own junk shop for quite some time now.

Corazon has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 10 times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her salon business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to purchase more junk supplies which in turn will be sold to bigger foundries and manufacturers. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education, so that they can have degrees and have good stable jobs once they’re grown.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more junk supplies which in turn will be sold to bigger foundries and manufacturers

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie C. is from the village of Meddina, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Rosie owns and operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 37 años, separada de su esposo, por lo que vive con sus dos hijos en la casa de su madre.  Tras su ruptura matrimonial, cayó en depresión, pero gracias al apoyo de sus padres, le cedieron un espacio dentro de su casa, por el cual instaló su negocio. Desde entonces se siente una mujer muy útil para sus hijos, y está contenta con su tienda, empezando su actividad desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche,  resultándole muy rentable los fines de semana, por vender cervezas y gaseosas, ganando por cada caja  S/ 10.0 soles, capital que le ayuda a cubrir la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Por lo pronto desea abastecerse de cajas de cervezas, y con ello asegurar el bienestar de sus hijos hasta cuando sean mayores de edad. Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP, y se compromete nuevamente a seguir trabajando como hasta ahora lo ha hecho dentro de su grupo comunal, por ser una persona muy responsable. Con el dinero va comprar gaseosas y más cajas de cervezas, para que pueda generarle más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Monica is 37 years old and separated from her husband, for which she lives with her two children in her mother's house. After the break-up of her marriage, she fell into depression, but thanks to the support of her parents, she was able to set up a business in a space that they gave her inside their house. Since then, she has felt like a very useful woman for her children, and she is happy with her store, which is open from 6 in the morning until 11 at night. This turns out to be very profitable for her on weekends, selling beer and soda, for which she earns 10.0 soles per box. This income helps her cover food and education expenses for her children. For now, she would like to stock up her store with cases of beer, thereby assuring the well-being of her children until they are grown up. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she is committed once again to continue working as she has up to this point within her communal group, since she is a very responsible person. With this money, she is going to purchase soda and more cases of beer, in order to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soda and beer for her store

loans.name: Niyazova Zuhrahon`s Group

texts.ru:
Зухрахон, 41 год. Она замужем и воспитывает 2 сыновей. Оба учатся в школе. Клиент занимается полеводством, выращивает картофель. Этим бизнесом она занимается 12 лет, с момента разделения земельных наделов. Ее супруг находится на заработках в России. кредит запрашивается для закупа минеральных удобрений. 

Малохат, 41. Ее супруг работает частным родителем в Араване. У нее 4 детей: 3 сына и дочь. Двое старших детей работают, младшие учатся в школе. Она также занимается выращиванием картофеля. Кредит нужен для закупа удобрений, т.к. в настоящее время спрос на них увеличивается и растет цена продукции. 

Дилафзахон замужем. У нее 3 детей. Супруг является членом крестьянского хозяйства. На своем земельном наделе они выращивают картофель и пшеницу. Она также собирается закупить удобрения на полученный кредит. 

Последним членом группы является Муроджон. Он женат и отец 2 детей. дочь работает в столовой, а сын учится в школе. Как и предыдущие участники, он тоже занимается земледелием. Цель кредита также аналогична предыдущим клиентам.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zuhrahon, 41 years old. She is married and raising two sons. Both sons go to school. This client does farming work, growing potatoes. She has been doing this for 12 years, from the time when land plots had been divided. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. The loan is being requested to purchase mineral fertilizers. Malohat, 41 years old. Her husband works as a private chauffeur in Aravan. She has four children: three sons and a daughter. The two older children work, the younger ones go to school. She also grows potatoes. The loan is needed to purchase fertilizers, because they are now in greater demand and their prices are growing. Dilafzahon is married. She has three children. Her husband is a member of a farmer’s union. They grow potatoes and wheat on their land plot. She is also planning to use her loan to buy fertilizers. Finally, the last member of this group, Murodjon. He is married and the father of two children. His daughter works in a cafeteria, and his son goes to school. As the other group members, he also does farming. The purpose of his loan is also the same as above.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.en:
T. Gulmurod is 55 years old. He is married and has three children. Gulmurod is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the raising large livestock and their sale at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from farms in adjacent villages. He raises the heifers with the help of his wife and young son. He then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today, Gulmurod is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $1200 USD in his business. In order to receive this amount, Gulmurod has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.    
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Lechuguitas Group

texts.es:
El banco D. emprendimiento Lechuguitas se origino ante la necesidad D. crédito por parte D. las integrantes, para la inversión en sus mercaderías y así D. esta manera generar mayor utilidad el cual pueda satisfacer sus necesidades.

La directiva electa por parte D. las  socias esta a cargo D. la Señora Cristina, como presidenta del grupo, una persona D. VallegranD. que emigro a nuestra ciudad en busca D. un futuro mejor para su familia ya que el lugar no era tan comercial, la Sra. Cristina esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la venta D. ropa tiene puesto fijo en un mercado D. la ciudad D. cochabamba, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. ropa por mayor y D. temporada ya que se acerca el invierno y necesita surtir su puesto D. venta con ropa abrigada para esta temporada.

Como tesorera se encuentra la Señora Elisa, una persona con unas características D. liderazgo, responsabilidad y confianza demostrada a través D. otras organizaciones en la que estuvo presente, se dedica a la venta D. comida y con el dinero del credito comprara insumos para la elaboracion D. sus riquisimos platillos.

Todas son empresarias con un alto sentido D. superación en busca D. ser motores productivos dentro su familia y no así solo amas D. casa que dependan del esposo, es por esta razón que para llevar adelante sus emprendimientos deciden agruparse para solicitar crédito mancomunado  ya que no cuentan con garantías que la banca tradicional exige, y D. esta manera apoyarse para sacar un solo crédito, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The “Lechugitas” (Little Heads of Lettuce) communal bank grew out of the members’ need to invest in their merchandise so that they could produce higher profits to meet their needs. The governing board elected by the members is led by Cristina, group president. She is originally from VallegranD. but she moved to our city looking for a better future for her family because the previous place wasn’t too commercial. Cristina is married and has two, school-age children. She sells clothing in a sales stall in Cochabamba’s market. She will use the funds to buy seasonal clothing at wholesale since winter is approaching and she needs to stock her stall with warm clothing for this season. Elisa is group treasurer. She is a person with strong leadership, responsibility and reliability characteristics that she has demonstrated in other organizations she’s been involved with. She sells food and will use the funds to buy ingredients to make her delicious meals. All the members are businesswomen with a high sense of self improvement; they are always looking for ways to push their families forward and not just be housewives dependent on their husbands. This is why they decided to group together to seek a group loan that will help all of them since they don’t qualify for financing from traditional banks; this way they can support each other and take out a single loan. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 35 years old. He is married and has seven children, ages 2½-16. All the children except the youngest one are attending school.

He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya where he has been farming for 12 years. His main products are vegetables, bananas, and oranges, which he sells in the local market. He also makes ballast and knits sweaters.

His biggest challenges in farming are a lack of finances, a poor transport network, and the lack of an organized market for his products.

He has requested a loan of KES.40,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a dairy cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and for sale.

He hopes to take out larger loans in future so he can invest more in his business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mrs. La Hen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This loan is meant for a group of 11 people, who are based out of Preaek Touch-II village in Kandal province. The group members are requesting a loan to help improve their businesses in the future, and have selected Mrs. La H. as the village bank president, or the group leader. 

Mrs. La H. is 55 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Khorn Kai, are farmers who own a two-point five-hectare plot of land, where they grow crop for sale to support their family. They are facing trouble because they have no money to buy seeds to grow crops, and their field is also made up of infertile soil. In order to improve production, Mrs. La H. is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and rent a plow machine to plow her field. She has four children: one is a laborer, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one helps her in farming, and one attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and rent a plow machine to plow her field

loans.name: Mile

texts.en:
Mile Fruen is 41, married, and has six children between the ages of 12 and 27.  She owns a business venture selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Mile has four years of experience in this business.  Mile needs a loan of 2,900 WST to buy raw ingredients for her cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or $208 USD per week) to improve her business.

In 2006, Mile joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Mile's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
La solicitante es de la ciudad de Santani, es casada, tiene casa propia se dedica al alquiler de mesas y sillas para acontecimiento por toda la zona de Santani.
Según ella comenzó con 20 sillas y mesitas ahora ye cuenta con mas 60, cada unos gracias a la  buena administración de los ingresos que ella obtiene con los alquileres.
Pero desea crecer en el negocio y para ello quiere contar con mayor numero de silla y mesitas, y solicita el préstamo para concretar dicha compra.
Es una persona responsable, trabajadora posee buenas referencias comerciales  y personales, la señora empezó a trabajar  hace aproximadamente 4 años a este trabajo siempre se esmera por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Victorina is from the city of Santani. She is married and has her own house. She rents tables and chairs for events throughout the Santani area. According to Victorina, she started with 20 chairs and small tables and now she has more than 60, thanks to the good management of the income that she gets from her rentals. But she wants to grow her business, and to do that she needs to have a greater number of chairs and tables. She requests a loan in order to buy these additional chairs and tables. She is a hardworking, responsible person who has good business and personal references. She started to work about 4 years ago, and she always puts a lot of care into this work because she wants to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Merci Nayibe

texts.es:
Mercy P. es una joven que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena donde tiene su negocio llamado Variedades Estrella, Está solicitando un credikiva, que es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir su negocio con mercancía que en este momento se le está agotando y tiene alta rotación, como perfumes, bolsos para damas, calzado infantil, artículos de cacharrería y otros.
Su negoció nació con su sueño emprendedor de ser independiente mediante la oferta de productos que sus clientes necesitan y que a ella también le gusta vender. Por eso a futuro quiere convertirlo en una gran empresan que la ayude a aumentar siempre sus condiciones de vida y las de la familia de tres hijos que planea con su esposo hacia el futuro.
Su meta principal es tener varias unidades de comercialización en sitios altamente concurridos   y generar empleos mediante ellos. En la actualidad enfrenta el desafío de prepararse física y mentalmente, para empezar el sueño de tener su familia y ampliar su negocio, que en la actualidad se encuentra en una habitación de su vivienda y no es visible al público.
texts.en:
Mercy P. is a young woman who lives in the city of Cartagena, where she has a shop, called "Variedades Estrella". She is seeking a Kiva loan - her first loan with [field partner] Fundación Mario Santo Domingo - to stock her shop with additional merchandise. At the moment she has a high turn over and is running out of items such as perfumes, handbags, baby shoes, and crockery. Mercy's business was born of her dream to be independent. It has been able to grow because she offers the right goods for her customers, and because she enjoys selling. She would like it to become a big company in the future, which will help her improve her quality of life - and that of the three children she and her husband hope to have one day! Her goal is to have a chain of stores, in busy areas, and to employ people to work in them. Now she faces the challenge of preparing herself, physically and mentally, to realize her dream of having a family and growing her business, which at the moment is located in a room of their house and is not easily seen by passers-by.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To re-stock her business with goods she is running out of, such as perfumes, handbags, baby shoes and crockery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter les intrants notamment les semences et des fertilisants

loans.name: Elsa  Marlyse

texts.fr:
femme de 35  ans celibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie de 4 mois a 17 ans. Après son  baccalaureat n'ayant plus de soutien financier et ayant 3personnes en charge, elle se lança dans le commerce de vente de tissus en 2005 avec un capital de 80000frs.
Avec ce prêt elle veut agrandir son activité en achetant des tissus comme borsalino, du lin,de la soie des tissus de céremonies et autres tissus de premièrs qualites.
sa strategie est de vendre au prix hors concurrence et toujours avoir une bonne marchandise, épargner toutes les semaines.
elle aimerait être grossiste dans les jours futurs, elle veut que son commerce prospère, elle aimerait que sa famille vive dans des meilleurs conditions en ameliorant leurs conditions de vies et qu'elle prospère.
son entourage la felicite pour ses initiatives  et pour son esprit de creativité.
texts.en:
This is a 35-year-old woman who is unmarried and the mother of three children, who range in age from 4 months to 17 years. After graduating from high school and without any more financial support, plus three people in her care, she got started in a business selling cloth. This was in 2005 with 80,000 francs in capital. With this loan, she wants to expand her business by buying some fabrics, such as felt, linen, silk, ceremonial cloth, and other top quality fabrics. Her strategy is to sell at unrivaled prices, to offer good merchandise at all times, and to save money every week. She would like to be a wholesaler in the days to come. She wants her commerce to prosper. She would like her family to live under the best conditions and to prosper. Her friends and family compliment her on her initiative and creative spirit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying linen, poplin, silk, felt, and ceremonial cloth

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa F. is from the village of Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old and married with six adult children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is part of the communal bank “21 de Mayo – El Roble” and resides in the city of Lota. Pedro has a stand located in the main streets of Lota, where he sells delightful sweets and children's crossword puzzle and word search books. Pedro's business sits in a commercial district area and is quite far from his home. Pedro's stand has no roof, so Pedro uses an umbrella to protect it from the sun and cover for the rain. Pedro has worked this stand for the past 15 years, but has worked in this type of business for the past 25 years.

Pedro started selling items in the street fairs and little by little he started working towards establishing the stand he holds today from Monday to Saturday. For many years, Pedro’s wife has also run a stand, but of fruits and vegetables, in the street market.

With this loan Pedro will purchase merchandise, a new and larger umbrella and will send his stand-booth to get repaired. Pedro is a father of three; the two oldest sons are professionals and no longer reside with him. Pedro’s youngest son just graduated from high school and is 18 years old; he still resides with Pedro and is looking for work to continue his studies. Pedro’s goal is to support his son through his studies as he did with his older sons, thanks to his business and wife. 

The entrepreneurial training offered by Kiva Partner Fondo Esperanza has been very helpful to Pedro, as he has improved his money management skills. Pedro is also grateful for his loan officer and the companionship of his other fellow group members. 

In Mapudungun (the language of the indigenous Mapuche population), Lota means "Humble Village".  It is a coastal community located near to the city of Concepción in the southern region of Bíobío. Lote is known for its large coal deposits, which were very important in the history and development of Chile. Chilean writer Baldomero Lillo memorializes Lota and the difficult living conditions of its coal miners in his book Subterra (Underground).

loans.use: To buy merchandise and items to fix Kiosk Stand.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 38-year-old married lady with three children who are in school.  She does stone quarrying to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 10 years and has managed to employ two people.  She hopes to expand her business and supply more stones.  She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stones.

loans.use: To buy stones

loans.name: Buren

texts.en: Buren A. is 34 years old and lives with his sibling in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Buren is a driver and works in the city as a taxi mechanic. Besides his work, he has been operating a cosmetics trading business at a rented stall at the local trading center since 2009. His sibling helps with his business by working as a salesperson. Buren is a modest man and is requesting a 2,280,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase spare parts for his car and also to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Hadi

texts.ar:
هادي في عمر 26 سنة متزوج وله ولدان طموح يحب عائلته يرغب في تحسين وضع عائلته المادي وزيادة مدخوله فهو خباز  يعمل في فرن للمناقيش                                                                                                        
يعتمد على ذاته منذ اكثر من 9 سنوات تاريخ بدء عمله فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى فتح محل جديد له لتكبير       مصلحته يلقى دائما دعم كبير من عائلته                                                                              
وهو محبوب من محيطه وزبائنه طموح يحلم بفتح اكثر من محل في المستقبل تاريخه السابق مع المجموعة جيد جدا
texts.en: Hadi is a 26-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family very much and seeks to improve their financial situation; they, for their part, are a big support to him. Hadi has been self-reliant for the past nine years as he’s worked at a fateera pastry shop. He is seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to open a new shop to expand his business. Hadi is well-liked by his colleagues and patrons. He is very driven, and dreams of opening up multiple other outlets in the future. His credit history with Al Majmoua is very good.

loans.use: Open up new shop.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 47 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa heredada D. sus familiares. DesD. hace 6 años se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales, principalmente comercializa ovejas y cerdos, que son llevados a vender los fines D. semana en las ferias ganadera D. su comunidad. En ocasiones, sus hijos la apoyan en esta tarea ganadera, ya sea en la alimentación como en el aseo D. estos animales. Disfruta mucho realizar este trabajo, porque le resulta más rentable que otras actividades. Ahora su prioridad es tener mayor cantidad D. animales para incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Es el crédito número 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más animales como ovejas y cerdos.
texts.en: Francisca, age 47, lives with her 2 children in the house she inherited from her family. For the past 6 years she has been buying and selling livestock, principally sheep and pigs, which are taken each weekend to sell in the local livestock markets. Sometimes her children help her with this task, as well as with feeding and cleaning out the animals. She really enjoys her work, becasue it is more profitable than other activities. Her priority now is to increase the number of animals, so as to increase her working capital. This is her 5th loan from [field partner] MFP. She is happy to know that she has this financial backing, and is grateful that she is part of her communal bank, because all its members are responsible people who support one another. She is grateful also to all the people who will be her lenders, because the loan will be very useful in developing her business further. With the loan, she will invest in the purchase of more sheep and pigs.

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman with two children, both of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the purchase of food.

She has established a nursery school for young children and has been in operation for the past two years. Her potential customers are the neighboring school children. Jane faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her school in the future. 

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase furniture fittings (chairs, tables and a black chalk board) for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture fittings(chairs, tables and black chalk board) for the school.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es: El señor Silvestre dedicado al servicio de transporte hace ya un año a atrás, hasta el momento solo pudo ahorrar el 15% para la compra de un línea de ruta, este crédito le servirá para poder completar en monto requerido para esta y así poder trabajar de manera segura, el señor es el que mantiene toda la familia con este ingreso ya que su esposa solo se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos, este crédito servirá a esta familia para mejorar su calidad de vida ya que incrementara sus ingresos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: For the past year, Silvestre has dedicated himself to providing transportation services.  Up until now, he has only been able to save 15% toward the total amount he needs to buy a route line.  This loan will help him be able to gather the total funds required to do this, so that he can secure his work.  He alone supports his entire family with this income, given that his wife cares for their children.  This loan will help the family improve their standard of living, since it will increase his income.  He is very thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To purchase a route line.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita T. is 62 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Julita weaves and sells the fronds of the nipa, a palm native to the Philippines (these weavings are used to thatch roofs, for example). She has been in business for twenty years and earns a monthly net income of 3000 PHP.

In 2007, Julita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Julita has successfully repaid a previous loan, her seventh from PMPC, of 2,000 PHP. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Julita is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP that will be used as additional working capital.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her nipa weaving business

loans.name: Parcifal

texts.es: Parcifal tiene 23 años, el vive con sus padres en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica al reciclaje, recolectando objetos en desuso y luego son vendidos por kilo a una empresa grande de reciclado. Es así que trabaja  todos los días a partir del medio día, recorriendo las calles aledañas de su zona. Para  él es muy rentable esta actividad ya que  aumenta su precio por el kilo, recibiendo buenas rentas y eso le motiva a seguir trabajando en este rubro, además con el dinero obtenido lo invierte en sus estudios universitarios. El desea adquirir un terreno propio para poder tener un gran almacén y vender a mayores cantidades, asimismo dedicarse a la agricultura utilizando los desechos orgánicos  tratados como un abono saludable. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la adquisición de más objetos en desuso al por mayor.
texts.en:
Parcifal is 23 years old and lives with his parents in their house.  For more than two years, he has worked in recycling.  He collects used items and sells them by the kilo to a large recycling company.  He canvasses the streets in his neighborhood every day starting at noon.  For him, this work is very profitable.  Since he raised his price per kilo, he has earned a good income, which motivates him to continue working in this area.  He invests the money he earns in his university studies.  He would like to buy his own land to have a large store and sell in larger quantities.  He also works in agriculture and uses organic waste as a fertilizer.

This is his fourth loan with MFP and he feels very happy to know that he has financial support, since he has always demonstrated his responsibility with his payments.  He is also happy to be a part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  He thanks everyone who will make this loan possible.  It will be very helpful to the progress of his business.  

With the loan he is requesting, he will acquire more used items in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase used items

loans.name: Yaneth Rocio

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 01 hijo.  La señora estudió educación superior incompleto. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir y otros productos.
Con éste crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, comprará cuatro cajas de shampoo.  Ella recibe el apoyo y ayuda su esposo, quien también trabaja como chofer.
Su sueño es tener un capital propio para hacer crecer su negocio y terminar de estudiar.	
Le que gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad con la que la que le otorgan los préstamos.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the "Inka Wasi" communal bank which is located in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 20 years old and has a common-law husband and a son.  She was unable to complete her secondary education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four months.  She invested her first loan of 300 PEN in her business selling clothing and other products.

She plans to use the new 300 PEN loan to buy four cases of shampoo.  She receives support and help from her husband who works as a driver.

Her dream is to have her own capital so she can increase her business and finish her education.

She likes the communal bank because of how easy it is to get a loan there.

loans.use: To buy four cases of shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional food inventory
